story:
*** English will follow *** 

 

SYNOPSIS 

SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE est un portait vivant de quatre individus issus des communautés LGBTQ+ et musulmanes. Ces derniers s’expriment sur leur réalité en lien avec leur religion et leur propre identité personnelle. Voyageant entre Montréal, Ottawa et Toronto, le court-métrage expose des moments spécifiques dans la vie de ces individus en lien avec leur émancipation identitaire. Ils représentent ensemble un autre visage peu connu de l’Islam, qui malgré son effervescence, lutte encore pour sa reconnaissance. Ce documentaire aura certainement une importance capitale à sa sortie grâce à son sujet terriblement d'actualité et profondément touchant.

 

ÉQUIPE 


Lysandre Cosse, réalisateur
Sabrina Gaggino, productrice déléguée
Laurence Blais, directrice de la photographie
Mélina Lemaire, monteuse
Sarah Tardif, assistante à la réalisation et assistante au montage
Josef Tulane et Olivier Séguin-Dang, assistants caméra
Jacob Marcoux et Marie-Kathryne Viens, son
A., Monib, Tariq et Yara, protagonistes

 

MONTANT DEMANDÉ: 1500$ 


Afin de permettre la pérennité de ce beau projet, notamment son envoi dans divers festivals où il fera certainement écho, en plus de rembourser les frais déboursés au moment du tournage et de la post-production, nous faisons appel à vous, vous permettant ainsi de faire intégralement parti du beau voyage que ce documentaire s'apprête à vivre.

Pour illustrer les dépenses déjà effectuées, nous vous partageons quelques exemples des frais déjà déboursés et à venir:


- Location d'un Econoline pour assurer le transport de l'équipe et de l'équipement à Toronto, Ottawa et Montréal
- Hébergement pour l'équipe à Toronto et Ottawa
- Essence
- Achat d'équipement de direction photo
- Nourriture pour l'équipe lors des jours de tournage
- Frais d'envoi en festivals

POURQUOI CE PROJET? 

SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE aura un impact indéniable dès sa sortie, qui aura lieu au printemps 2018. En effet, bien que le sujet se concentre sur la communauté musulmane et LGBTQ+, il est tout de même universel. Chacun ne pourra qu'être touché par les propos des intervenants, car l'essentiel de ce court-métrage réside dans le conflit que nous pouvons ressentir face à notre identité sexuelle et / ou spirituelle et la communauté dans laquelle nous vivons. Bien que ce thème puisse sembler délicat à première vue, il est abordé avec finesse et respect pour les intervenants ainsi que les auditeurs, sans toutefois dénaturer l'essentiel du projet et nier l'importance d'aborder ces sujets.

Il s'agit également d'un sujet précieux pour le réalisateur Lysandre Cosse et son équipe. SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE est le deuxième projet documentaire du cinéaste abordant les quêtes personnelles et identitaires, le tout ayant déjà été abordé sous un autre angle dans PARCOURS, sorti à l'hiver 2017. Depuis, ce premier court-métrage profite d'une belle présence à divers événements cinématographiques et nous avons très hâte de vous montrer une autre facette de ce sujet avec SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE, d'où l'importance de votre aide.

 

AUTRES FAÇONS DE NOUS AIDER 

Votre don sera grandement apprécié de la part de toute l'équipe. Toutefois, nous espérons que votre contribution ne s'arrêtera pas là afin de vous permettre de faire intégralement parti de cette belle aventure! Nous vous encourageons donc à assister à la première du court-métrage en mai 2017. Pour plus de détails sur cet événement et les autres à venir, vous êtes invités à suivre notre page Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/skiesanjb/ et n'hésitez pas à la partager avec votre entourage!

Nous vous remercions pour votre aide, celle-ci est très grande et appréciée, peu importe le montant offert, et au plaisir d'assurer la pérennité de ce projet avec vous,

L'équipe de SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE

 

SYNOPSIS

SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE is a living portrait of four individuals from the LGBTQ+ and muslim communities. Those express themselves on their own realities in regard of their religion and personal identity. Traveling between Montreal, Ottawa and Toronto, this short film exposes specific moments in the life and emancipation of these four individuals. Together, they represent a little-known face of Islam which, despite it's turmoil, fights for it's recognition. This documentary will certainly have a great impact on its release because of deeply touching and actual topic.

 

TEAM

Lysandre Cosse, director
Sabrina Gaggino, line producer
Laurence Blais, director of photography  
Mélina Lemaire, editor
Sarah Tardif, 1st director assistant and editor assistant 
Josef Tulane et Olivier Séguin-Dang, camera assistants 
Jacob Marcoux et Marie-Kathryne Viens, sound 
A., Monib, Tariq et Yara, protagonists

 

GOAL: 1500$ 

To be able to ensure the life of this beautiful project, especially it's presence in film festivals where it will certainly have a great visibility, and to reimburse the fees incurred, we ask for your help, giving you the opportunity to completely be a part of this wonderful journey that this documentary is getting ready to live.

Here are a few examples of the incurred and upcoming fees:
- Rental of an Econoline to insure the transportation of the team and gear in Montreal, Ottawa and Toronto
- Accommodations for the team in Ottawa and Toronto
- Gas
- Cinematography gear
- Food for the team and protagonists during filming
- Festivals fees
 

WHY THIS PROJECT? 

SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE will certainly have an impact on its release date in Spring 2018. Indeed, even if the topic is precisely regarding the muslim and LGBTQ+ communities, it is still universal. Each and everyone of us will without a doubt be touched by the protagonists speech because the essence of this short film resides in the conflict that we can all feel according to our sexual and / or spiritual identities and the community we live in. Our topic can appear tricky, but it is addressed with delicacy by respect for the protagonists, but also for the audience, without altering the essence and importance of our project.


It is also a precious topic for the director, Lysander Cosse and his team. SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE is Lysandre Cosse’s second short documentary about personal identity quests. Indeed, the latter have been addressed with another angle in PARCOURS (TRACKS), released in Winter 2017. Since then, this first short film has a great presence in different festivals and cinematographic events and we are really thrilled to introduce you another side of this topic with SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP US 

Your contribution will be greatly appreciated. However, we hope that your contribution will not end there, we want you to be able to completely be a part of our journey. We encourage you to assist to the film premiere in May 2018. For more infos and details on this event and the upcoming ones, you are invited yo join us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/skiesanjb/ and do not hesitate to share with your surroundings !

We thank you for your help, it is huge, no matter the amount you offer, and is infinitely appreciated.

Sincerely,

The SKIES ARE NOT JUST BLUE team

story:
The Art of Protest

 

This December, The Next Four Years- Milwaukee shared a call for protest poster designs via Facebook, Twitter and email. Ten days later, a jury of art professionals and activists  from diverse backgrounds reviewed the submissions, and selected “We Rise” as the first of image to go to print. 

Protest posters have given voice to individuals with views that have been silenced by oppression throughout history. Capable of provoking large numbers of people in dialogue, the messages contained within a protest poster influence the place in which it is seen until removed. The thoughts and conversations sparked by the poster create a catalyst to action.

 

Tear Us Down, We Rise.

 

The first design selected by N4Y-MKE is emblematic of the power and necessity in protecting women’s rights. Collaboratively designed by artists Niki Johnson & Christian Westphal We Rise is inspired by Johnson’s recent artwork Hills & Valleys, made out of the signage from Planned Parenthood health care centers defunded under Governor Scott Walker’s administration in Wisconsin. Johnson was the recipient of Planned Parenthood Wisconsin’s 2016 Voices Award for the visibility and activism she inspired through the creation of her artwork. Niki Johnson is beginning a national tour with Hills & Valleys in collaboration with national Planned Parenthood affiliates in 2017.

 

The Next Four Years - Milwaukee is proud to stand with Johnson, Westphal and this design-  offering We Rise as a symbol of the power of women in the face of adversity.

 

How It Works

 

  1. You buy, we fly! Buy in bulk and shipping is free!!
  2. Order here, pick up your purchases in person in Milwaukee and skip shipping fees.
  3. Need your order shipped? No problem! Shipping will be included in your total. 

(See the perk offerings in this campaign for more information.)

 

Who We Are

 

The Next Four Years - Milwaukee was founded the day after the 2016 presidential election. Now over 4,400 members strong, N4Y-MKE is taking action to prevent further harm to our rights, our environment and the constitution by the Trump administration, its appointees, and all state parties who flout the rule of law & the will of the people. The next four years are going to demand we join together to coordinate action against legislation and executive actions that come out of Washington DC and our state legislatures. Stand with us and join our community!

By purchasing and carrying one of our posters at the Women's March on Washington (or at the next rally you attend), you join us, standing with our community of activists and artists in resistance against the forces of hate, bigotry, racism, anti-feminism and anti-LGBT that won this election.

 

Join Us!

 

The Next Four Years - Milwaukee is sending protesters/rights protectors by bus to take part in Inauguration rallies in Washington DC, Milwaukee and Madison on January 21st, 2017. We have joined forces with the National Women’s March in support of their mission to ensure diverse voices are heard during these historic events.

 

By purchasing a poster you can become an active sponsor of the march. By carrying one to a march near you, you stand with our community!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Join a March Near You!

  • Besides ordering posters, you can also help get people to the protest marches around the country, especially the Women's March on Washington on January 21, 2017. More details are available about the Women’s March on Washington are available on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

Be Visible!

  • Tag the Women’s March on your posts @womensmarch
  • Use the hashtags #WomensMarch and #WhyIMarch.

Donate!

  • This is a march of the people for the people, funded by the people. Anything you give will go directly to the march. Let’s make herstory! Make a donation to the Women's March on Washington and support the movement. 

 

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Awakening is the latest offering from the crew who created Metamorphosis – a temple of transformation – for the AfrikaBurn festival in South Africa last year. This is a creative project, entirely volunteer-run, with a vision to create beautiful art while creating positive shifts in the world around us.

Temple structures like Metamorphosis and Awakening play a special role at AfrikaBurn; they provide a space for personal reflection and for spiritual and emotional awakening. They provide sanctuary for you to release, and ultimately burn, all that no longer serves you. And so Awakening is intended to be somewhere you can meditate, contemplate, rejoice, mourn, release and celebrate. A place for ceremonies of love, commitment, farewell and friendship. The lotus, an ancient symbol of rebirth and awakening, invites you to consider what you want to awaken in yourself… what dreams and potential is lying dormant?

Social upliftment

Awakening is a project with a conscience; creating positive change and awakening the potential in others is part of our vision. We strive to leave legacies that benefit communities beyond the Burn, and help spark transformation and awakening in others.

Last year the Metamorphosis team brought the theme of transformation home, raising a substantial amount of money to renovate the Home of Hope in Johannesburg. The Home rescues women and children from abuse, poverty and sexual exploitation and ensures they get an education while having a safe place to live. The extreme makeover included everything from fresh paint to new furniture, kitchen appliances, light fittings, bedding and décor. Mam Khanyi, who runs the organization, said that the renovations had “helped restore dignity to all the girls who live at the Home.”

Building on this relationship, after the Burn, Awakening will be installing a learning centre at the Home of Hope including computers and internet access. This will help all of the women who are studying and don't have ready access to these resources. The focus on education fits with the idea of awakening… awakening to one’s potential, to a world of opportunity.

In addition we hope to open the Burn up to other communities and to aid skills development. To this end we included four local artists from Alexandra in the Metamorphosis project last year. Tsholo, Tebogo, Mpumi and Mmabadimo assisted with the building of the temple in Jo’burg, construction in Tankwa and attended the festival. This year we are bringing Tsholo and his wife Salome and Mpumi and we want to help facilitate that journey for them. Helping us with funds means contributing to both the Home of Hope and to providing access to the Burn for others.

Donate

If passion alone could bring our structure into being, we’d pretty much be ready to head into the Karoo. However, the reality is that there is money to be raised… R100 000 (ZAR) to be exact. We were fortunate to be awarded some funding from AfrikaBurn’s art grant fund (hence we were able to start the building) but we don’t yet have enough funds to bring this powerful project to its completion!

For the investigative types:

-  Find out more about AfrikaBurn via their official website: http://www.afrikaburn.com/

-  Read more about Metamorphosis: https://www.facebook.com/Metamorphosis.Afrikaburn

-  And the Home of Hope: http://www.hopehome.org.za/

story:
Join us in our effort to transform Ames Alley into a more vibrant public space. We are working with the Green Alleys Project and Luna Rienne Gallery to commission a mural from local artist Jet Martinez. Jet’s murals are vibrant explosions of color and often weave together flowers and animals. We’ve given him artistic freedom to make his mark on our alley. 

This new work will be adjacent to an existing mural by another San Francisco artist, Ursula Young. Ursula’s mural was the first to bring new life to the alley and attracts visitors to the alley on a regular basis. 

Jet Martinez's work is inspired by Mexican folk art, which, though stylized in a flat, graphic manner, creates vibrance with its use and application of color -- static imagery celebrating life at its most ecstatic. 

Martinez begins with a traditional rendering, then integrates his own visual language. A graduate of the San Francisco Art Institute, he is a prevalent and long-standing artist in the Mission and beyond, having been a director of the Clarion Alley Mural Project as well as exhibited in cities throughout the world.

We’re looking for support to help offset the costs of bringing Jet’s art to the community, with a goal of raising $3,000. We have already installed solar lighting on these walls as part of a DIY Green Alleys Project, so both murals will be illuminated year-round. Also, anti-graffiti coating will be applied to protect the art.

Thank you for your support!

MORE INFO:
Jet Martinez: jetromartinez.com
Luna Rienne Gallery: lunarienne.com / lunarienne.com/artists/jet-martinez
Green Alleys Project: greenalleys.org

Thank you for your support!MORE INFO:Jet Martinez: jetromartinez.comLuna Rienne Gallery: lunarienne.com / lunarienne.com/artists/jet-martinezGreen Alleys Project: greenalleys.org

story:
APAture is a multidisciplinary arts festival for emerging Asian-Pacific American (APA) artists to develop their art, affirm their voices, and share their work with the APA community.


For the past 14 years, Kearny Street Workshop's festival has shaped the culture of the San Francisco Bay Area by addressing the realities and narratives of APA lives through the important space our festival provides: a space that belongs to us.

2016 marks APAture’s 15th year. We’re asking for your help in reaching our $2500 goal, ensuring our festival continues to allow emerging APA artists and communities to come together and hold this space for one another.

APAture is dedicated to showcasing new work from emerging APA artists currently located in the Bay Area. It is the only festival of its kind, and an important lifeline for our artists, all of whom are currently at the beginning of their artistic careers.

Our festival is multidisciplinary: we feature talent in film, literary arts, music, performing arts, comics and illustration, and visual arts. Our festival consists of six artist showcases (one for each genre). Every showcase is headlined by one featured artist, who presents a new work or piece not yet shown to the public.

Our featured artists for APAture 2016 are:
Nina Vichayapai, Visual Arts
Krystle Ahmadyar of Ruby Mountain and Los Sirenas, Music
Trinidad Escobar, Comics and Illustration
Jade Cho, Literary Arts
Sammay Dizon, Performing Arts
Việt Lê, Film

All of our featured artists receive an artist honorarium for their work, and showcase artists receive a small stipend.


This year, the festival runs September 30 to October 16. Our venues are all within walking distance of San Francisco’s Civic Center.


Visual Arts Showcase Opening Reception
9/30 @ 6-10 pm. Arc Studios & Gallery.

Music Showcase (co-presented by KollaborationSF)
10/1 @ 7-11 pm. Bindlestiff Studio.

Comics and Illustration Showcase
10/2 @ 12-5 pm. SF Library (Latino/Hispanic Room)

Literary Arts Showcase (co-presented by Lantern Review)
10/7 @ 7-10 pm. Arc Studios & Gallery.

Performing Arts Showcase
10/8 @ 2-5 pm. Asian Art Museum (Samsung Hall).

Film Showcase
10/9 @ 2-5 pm. SF Library (Koret Auditorium).

Closing Reception
10/15 @ 12-3 pm. Arc Studios & Gallery.

We're looking to raise funds to contribute to 57% of the cost APAture, or approximately $13,300. This amount does not include grant-funded paid time staff. The funding breakdown for the festival is as follows:

As we are a non-profit, we are completely reliant upon grants and individual donations from generous people in the community, so this fundraiser is especially important for us, and every single dollar we raise will be put towards the festival.

Please note that our target for the campaign is far below our total cost; this ensures that every dollar will be put toward making up the $13,300 we need to fund the festival, regardless of whether we come up short, meet our goal, or exceed it.

To thank you for your kind donation, we've prepared a long list of perks for our donors. Buckle up and get ready to be blown away by all the great offerings we have in store for you this year, including our All-Access Pass, which is your all-access ticket to every single APAture event this year!

Remember: Every level of donation includes the addition/upgrade of ALL ABOVE perks. You won't miss out, no matter how big your donation.

$10 USD

  • Thumbs Up!
  • Our love and appreciation

$15 USD

  • Social Media Shoutout
  • Website Acknowledgement
  • APAture 2016 button (claim at any APAture event)

$25 USD

  • Literary Arts Ticket or Music Ticket

$50 USD

  • Performing Arts Ticket (Asian Art Museum Ticket Included)
  • Print Program Acknowledgment

$75 USD

  • Tickets Upgraded to All-Access Pass
  • APAture 2016 Poster

$100 USD

  • APAture 2016 T-Shirt
  • Acknowledgement at all events

$250 USD

  • Mega-Access Pass: includes Celebrate Your Body, KSW presents, more-- fundraisers not included (2 total)
  • One-quarter page ad (2"x3", B&W) in Program
  • 2 VIP Gift Bags

$500 USD

  • Mega-Access Passes (2 total)
  • Upgrade to one-half page ad (4"x6", B&W) in Program
  • 2 VIP Gift Bags (4 total)
  • Limited Edition APAture 2016 Poster, signed by all six featured artists!
  • One-on-one arts consultation/portfolio review (60 minutes) in any discipline

$1000 USD

  • Upgrade to full page ad (8”x12”, B&W) in Program
  • Exclusive VIP gallery tour with curators
  • Private Performance by APAture artist (TBD)


APAture is a production of Kearny Street Workshop (KSW), the oldest APA art non-profit in the Bay Area. Our Artistic and Managing Directors, Jason and Rachel, form the core staff of KSW, but the majority of the APAture team is composed of a volunteer General Planning Committee (GPC).

The GPC is a diverse mix of volunteer artists, educators, and students committed to creating spaces for APA art and artists here in the Bay Area. Together, we engage in the outreach, planning, solicitation, selection, and running of all APAture events. And we do this for free! This festival is a labor of love, and we are very happy to bring it to you, our community.


Thanks for stopping by! If you are unable to donate at this time, you still can help us out by doing the following:

  • Share this campaign with hastag #APAture2016
  • Like Kearny Street Workshop on Facebook.
  • Follow Kearny Street Workshop on Twitter.
  • Encourage your friends and family to donate.


Make checks payable to Kearny Street Workshop. Include APAture 2016 in the memo field and mail to:

Kearny Street Workshop
Attn: APAture 2016
P.O. Box 14545
San Francisco, CA 94114-0545

Kearny Street Workshop is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.
Federal Tax ID: 94-3207003

Contact: apature@kearnystreet.org

Thank you for supporting APA emerging artists and the APA community!

story:
Resolution: noun

  1. a firm decision to do or not to do something. 
  2. the action of solving a problem 
  3. the process of reducing or separating something into its components 
  4. the smallest interval measurable by an optical instrument 
-------------------------------------------- 
We are fifteen students graduating in April of 2016 from the University of West Florida's Graphic Design program. We're a large group of talented students who hope to graduate having left a mark in the form of an Exit Show to remember! 

It is our job to plan this show, which we have titled Resolution, from start to finish. From inception to reception, we've got to plan for (and pay for!) it all. So, using IndieGoGo, we're asking for your help to start our careers off right. 

Resolution is a weeklong gallery-style art exhibition that will wrap up with an evening reception on April 14th. This reception will serve as our debut to the local art and design communities - i.e., our potential employers and future clients. It will also serve as an opportunity for our friends and family to see the fruits of our labors, to understand those all-nighters and triple-shot-espressos and obsession over pixel perfection.   

What You're Funding:

  • Exhibition design and construction - Specifically, the displays on which we will mount our printed work. We will be constructing these from our own plans, from start to finish. This money will cover items such as lumber, hardware, and paint.
  • Venue rental costs - We will have the privilege of displaying our work in the University of West Florida's own Innovation Institute, but this space does not come without some minor convenience and cleaning fees.
  • Reception menu and supplies - we will be preparing all our own food, to save on catering costs, but that does mean we will need to pay for furniture rental, serving equipment, paper/plastic disposables - and, of course, all the groceries!
  • Show collateral - also known as promotional material or print promotions. This includes things like postcards, buttons, stickers, t-shirts for the reception, and our sponsor rewards for IndieGoGo contributors!
What is more, we as members of Resolution are invested in giving back to our community, and to youth in the arts. Which is why: any donations in excess of our needs for the show will be donated to First City Art Center in Pensacola, who so kindly will be hosting us at their Hot Glass Cold Brew event on March 18th, 2016.

story:
A little about me

I am the artist known online as Christy "Goldenwolf" Grandjean (and sometimes just Goldenwolf)!  I am a mostly self-taught professional artist well known for my anthropomorphic animal characters and unique whimsical style.  My work is quite visible, well known, and wide-spread across the internet. I have had several licensing deals with various companies, and I have been published in several magazines and other publications.  My art has even been featured on the hit MTV series "Teen Wolf"!

This is my fourth sketchbook volume that follows my wildly successful three previous volumes.  These "sketchbooks" are collections of drawings I have done for clients, or friends, or for myself, plus doodles, scribbles, ideas, vignettes, and just plain silliness from my own personal sketchbooks over the years. No two of my sketchbook collections are alike, and each one features entirely different art than the others.

I need your help getting funded so that I can cover my costs of printing a first run of these sketchbooks. 

The Sketchbook

Same format and size as the first three volumes:
8.5" X 11" Perfect Bound Paperback
Black and White interior
Glossy Full Color Cover
PG-13 Content (suitable for teens and up)

63 Pages full of my sketches and drawings from over the years, including many never before seen works!  There will be some old, and lots of new in this volume so there will be tons of great stuff to enjoy! (FYI I will never repeat stuff that has been used in previous volumes so that the art in each of my sketchbooks is fresh).

What I Need, and Perks!

I would like to do an initial printing run of 200 books, plus enough to re-order 100 copies of each of the previous three sketchbooks. All of this, with shipping, will cost about $3,000. Once the books are printed they will be available on my website, www.goldenwolfen.com, in my Etsy store, and at the various art shows and conventions I attend throughout the year. However, if you help fund this campaign, you will get your sketchbook(s) and other perks at a reduced price!

Here are the perks I am offering in return for your contribution:

Sketchbook V4 - $18: You will receive an signed copy of the sketchbook.

Sketchbook Plus - $30: You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, plus an 8.5" X 11" open edition, unmatted print of your choice from my website.

Two Sketchbooks - $35 : You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, plus a signed copy of a previous sketchbook of your choice

Yay Prints - $43: You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, and two 8.5" X 11" open edition, unmatted prints from my website.

Three Sketchbooks - $52: You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, plus signed copies of any two previous sketchbooks of your choice

Four Sketchbooks - $70: You will receive  signed copies of all four sketchbooks

Sketchy Sketch - $100: You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook with a custom sketch in pencil, from the artist, on the inside of the sketchbook!  Two-word descriptions only, such as "Anthro Wolf", "Werewolf", "Tiger Dude", "Fire Dragon", "Fairy Princess", etc.  These will be rough sketches on a blank page just inside the cover.  Please be non-specific, I will not do a sketch named "my character" or anything like that, nor will I do anything pornographic.  Please allow an additional 6 - 8 weeks for delivery after the sketchbooks are printed.

If you don't want any perk and just want to contribute, I will happily accept your donation with my heartfelt thanks! Just click on the pink "Contribute Now" button near the upper right hand of this page.

Stretch Goals

IndieGoGo Special Edition Sketchbook - $4,000

If we can reach $4,000 in the campaign I will do an exclusive centerfold sketch just for this sketchbook, and only available to campaign contributors! This sketch will never be featured in any other publication of mine, ever, and will include a personal message to my contributors.

Shipping and Fulfillment

Shipping is extra on top of what the perk costs, and IndieGoGo will add it to your total.  Once the campaign ends, I will be ordering these sketchbooks right away. I am hoping to have them to me by April 2018 (or sooner if I can). Once I have them, I will begin shipping them out to everyone. Please be aware that I am just one person handling this, however, so getting everyone's perks out may take some additional time. I will aim to get them all out by the end of April, but I am asking in advance for your patience in case things take longer.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my sketchbook!

Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!

story:
Our Story

The Naperville Independent Film Festival, Inc. ( http://www.naperfilmfest.org/new) (located just west of Chicago ), is a non-profit 501-(c) 3 organization that holds an annual film festival to help filmmakers get their work seen and distributed.

This year we have decided on the theme, " A Salute to Our Troops ", and in September at the 4th annual Naperville Independent Film Festival, we will present a special series of events honoring the brave men and women who have served in the United States Armed Forces. As part of this salute, we will present selected servicemen and women with a special trophy. A trophy selected and acquired with YOUR help.

We will be showing clips from a documentary feature at the Opening Night ceremony called " The Triangle of Death". This documentary was shot over several tours of duty by Sergeant Folleh Tamba, a  Purple Heart recipient 32 year old Marine. This work is a compilation of over 400 hours of film. Folleh Tamba was born in Sierra Leone, Africa and moved to the United States at the age of 17. He joined the Marines a few years later. His documentary is a powerful  eye-opener, showing the true feelings and perspectives of a soldier in Iraq.

Our primary goal is to find and select a unique, impressive, and substantial trophy for the purpose of showing our troops how much we appreciate and support them. Our ultimate goal is to raise enough money to have a Custom-Made trophy created especially for our troops.

The Impact

The recognition of even one soldier is worth this project, but we are honoring many.

We feel we can't do enough to say "Thank You" to the soldiers who have courageously fought to protect the freedom we have today. These soldiers include our fathers and our mothers, brothers and sisters, husbands and wives, sons and daughters, friends and neighbors.

If you feel the same way, then THIS is the perfect project to be a part of. Yes! This is extremely patriotic thing to do, but we feel that honoring our servicemen and women is vitally important.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to create a Custom-Made trophy, the total cost to design, prototype, mold, and replicate the trophy is $25,000. However, we will still select and acquire a trophy design, even if we can't get a Custom-Made one.

What do you get as a supporter? Beside the good feeling you'll get, there are a number of things you can receive in appreciation of your contribution. This includes autographed copies of the documentary "The Triangle of Death", tickets to the Festival ( September 17th - 24th 2011 )and much, much more.

One really great reward is a duplicate of the actual, full-sized trophy. Once you receive it you could have it engraved and present it to the serviceman or woman of your choice. this is a lasting tribute to your beloved soldier.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell all your friends and family, this is another way for you to support our cause, Thank you and please visit:

http://www.naperfilmfest.org/new

Please tell all your friends and family, this is another way for you to support our cause, Thank you and please visit:
http://www.naperfilmfest.org/new

story:
Our Story

This campaign is run by the official Alan Turing Year 2012 Arts and Culture Subcommittee (a voluntary organisation) which is part of the international Alan Year Year 2012 celebrations and our aim is to work with internationally renowned and emerging artists to raise public awareness of the great work of Alan Turing and its enormous cultural relevance and to create a 'touring Turing' exhibition entitled "Intuition and Ingenuity" as well as workshops, talks and other events.

2012 will be the 100th anniversary of the birth of Alan Turing, one of the greatest minds Britain has ever produced. Between inventing the digital computer and helping to decode the German Enigma machine, to founding the science of Artificial Intelligence, the world today would have been a very different place without him and his ideas. His work on morphogenesis (the biological processes that cause organisms to grow in a particular shapes) and the now famous ï¿½Turing Testï¿½ for machine intelligence have captured the imagination of artists for decades whilst his technological developments have given them the tools to create new kinds of artworks. This exhibition, which takes its name from Turingï¿½s own writing on the subject of mathematical reasoning, brings together a number of important artists from digital art pioneers to emerging contemporaries to investigate Turingï¿½s enduring influence on art and contemporary culture.


Artists already confirmed include: Roman Verostko, Boredom Research, Patrick Tresset, Greg Garvey, Anna Dumitriu and Alex May.

 

ï¿½Intuition and Ingenuityï¿½ will tour throughout 2012, see the arts and culture section on the website for more information.

 http://www.turingcentenary.eu


Image shows "Alan Turing" drawn by Paul the robot conceived by the Aikon project hosted at Goldsmiths College's Computing Department.

The Impact

We have already confirmed several high profile venues for the exhibition including:

Kinetica Art Fair

Thursday 9th - Sunday 12th February 2012

A large scale art fair focussed on kinetic, electronic, robotic, sound, light, time-based and multi-disciplinary new media art, science and technology. Featuring "Intuition and Ingenuity" an exhibition of digital pioneers and emerging artists whose work is inspired by Turing's pioneering ideas

http://www.kinetica-artfair.com/

V&A Digital Design Weekend

Saturday 22 - Sunday 23 September 2012

A weekend of events celebrating contemporary digital art and design, including demonstrations of robotics, hacking and tinkering projects, interactive installations and more. The Digital Design Weekend coincides with the London Design Festival at the V&A and the Alan Turing Centenary. Free, drop-in.

http://www.vam.ac.uk/


What We Need & What You Get

We need money to pay for venue costs, transport of artists work, insurance and people to take care of the work while it's on show as well as PR to make sure the world knows what we are doing


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word for us, suggest venues and potential sponsors or volunteer to help install or invigilate one of the events.

story:
Our Story

Some of you know Pirats Art Network, because we have a strong communication, both inside and outside Second Life as on Facebook, YouTube, Dailymotion, MySpace, LinkedIn and especially through our website now followed in more than 100 countries and whose visits are steadily rising.

I would pass quickly on the Second Life statistics, a group of 1,400 people, almost 20,070 unique visitors and some 170.000 TP in our galleries, openings with 90 to 200 people every Monday to see the work of more than 240 artists from around wide.

In three years Pirats Art Network made 160 exhibitions and openings, some in Real Life and Second Life, 4,800 individual arts shows, more than 13,000 art works exhibited for an international audience.

Our main strength is undoubtedly the growing number of people we attract in Second Life, which came first for Art, for Pirats Art Network, but still, ultimately, residents of Second Life and clients of Linden Lab.


More information on:

  • Pirats Art Network Website: http://www.pirats-art-network.org
  • Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/PiratsArtNetwork


The Impact

If this campaign doesn't happen, many artists will no longer have a place for exhibit with the strong communication that Pirats Art Network does for them.


Testimonials

Document sans nom

Lionigaly Slartit:

Pirats I declare it to be the best european result , if not in the world, of art exhibitions in Second Life.

 Anthony Jacob:

This news makes me very sad, and most appreciative for all you have done for the artists of Second Life. Thank you, my dear friends.

 Annette Chust:

Oh, that is so sad to read! I always loved it to have exhibitions there with you all and to see so many other artists there.

 Maya Paris:

So sorry to hear this news, you have done such wonderful work in SL. A HUGE thank you to you both.

 LeMelonrouge PuntCom:

Of course, i don't like these news. All my support, so Pirats cannot disappear!

 Marnie Reinard:

How sad and again second life looses a important group of people who make sl what it is.

 Orlando Castro Ortiz:

Wao, very sad for this news, not is posible.

 FreeWee Ling:

This is a tragedy. A terrible loss to all who value creativity and imagination. Something must be done to stop the exodus of such dedicated servants to art.

 Steve Hess:

Keep it open -- it's a collective of talent and artistic expression which is slowly dying in Second Life.

 Marie Wattre:

I am an artist Pirats, I like their work on sl. Many artists work with them. Thanks to them, SL is important for artists and creativity. Thank you for allowing them to continue their business

 Karima Hoisan:

I urge Linden Lab to help keep Pirats' doors open. Pirats must continue to be the showcase,that it has always been in the past, the inspirational gathering place for so many truly talented artists and art lovers from all over the world.

 Yoku Tison:

pls let the pirats be on air its important 2 have them in here 4 the future, Phil!

 Cat Boccaccio:

Pirats elevated the standard of SL's creative community and the end of Pirats would be a great loss to the culture and the prestige of Second Life.

 Fragile Bing:

gardez ouvert l'espace d'art, il est important de dÃ©fendre les lieux d'expression

 Kimm Paulino:

SL gives a huge number of people the chance to experiment with their artistic side. People who would never get this chance in RL. Organisations such as PiRats are vital in giving these people an outlet for achieving this "second chance", which, at the end of the day, is a large part of what SL is really about. Art is their imagination come to life. PiRats gives them a world in which to do it by providing venue, community and audience. For these artists, PiRats, and similar venues, are prime examples of "Their World, Their Imagination" in action.

 CADEL:

I love pirats !!!!!!!

 Luciella Lutrova:

im a real life artist, and Pirats helped me to show my art, to many people of all the world, and i had the pleasure of knew artwork of many artist from differents parts of the world, is really magic !!, and at the same time, is many people that have not oportunity of see art in rl, and here they can . is a real way of diffund culture, and Pirats do it

 LaÃ«titia Buton:

We must do all the best we can to save PiRats, someting must be done absolutly. I'm proud to be a PiRat Lady.

 La Baroque:

Pirats can't die because it is the place of wonder and creativity

 Graine Macbain:

The slow death of SL art must be stopped! Please don't allow any more of these losses.

 Tani Thor:

One group that has most promoted art in sl can not close. We fight because it does not happen.

 La Baroque:

Pirats can't die because it is the place of wonder and creativity

 Rafale Kamachi:

Artistic endeavours such as PiRats are a great and cheap advertisement for SL. It would make sense to keep their sim running.

 Albatroz Hird:

Seeing a so involved non-profit association for Art promotion dying on SL because Linden Lab don't want to reduce their benefit is a shame.

 Briawinde Magic:

Pirats offers a venue to artists from around the world showing the works of some of the most creative people in both RL and SL. The art is enjoyed by many in SL, not just by other artists. As such Pirats is an important venue and has helped to promote SL as the premier virtual world for the arts. To lose Pirats would be a blow,,not just to artists from around the world but to the entire SL community.

 Lollito Larkham:

It's a pity pirats can't have aland with low fee after all they've done for traffic in sl and art expression in virtual worlds, specially second life.

 Cherry Manga:

Second Life metavers needs people like Pirats members to show what wonders are possible, sharing art, creativity, cultures, friendships, it is a model for Linden Lab and it's a shame to ask residents to pay so much as they offer a lot to the community.

 Luis Vasconcelos:

Pirats Art Network is a very important way to promote art in Second Life. We ALL need it to continue it's work. Please help us to honnor and to save this project.

 Bouffort Remi:

i'm really disappointed to see pirats disappear as this !

 Dividni Shostakovich:

Comments: Few venues have supported the challenging, innovative work of so many. Linden Labs needs to reverse its decision to raise tiers for nonprofit and educational organizations, and find ways to keep the creative people and the people who underwrite their existence from being forced out of Second Life. People like these are the ones who make virtual worlds an exciting place.

 Eve Kazan:

"L'art naÃ®t de contraintes, vit de luttes, et meurt de libertÃ©s." AndrÃ© Gide (merci google) Hope Linden Lab will understand that Art can be more beautiful than money ...

 Maryva Mayo:

 Pirats must not die !! As Einstein said, "Art is the expression of the Simplest Deepest Thoughts In The Way" ... Pirats all these years has made visible the art in SL and RL, and helped many artists. I am very saddened at the thought that all this will end! Linden needs to understand that art, it is true that does not lead to them, directly gains, but it is a source of indirect income, attracting many people. If not, .. because many artists are contacted by other Virtual Worlds, .. with offers of land, Sim free, to create art events, which attract many people, .. both in the Web and in virtual worlds?

 Bau-Ur Secundum:

PiRats are a buoyant community of creators and art appreciators who demonstrate the very best of which Second Life is capable. Its steady leaders have developed an international community with both real-life and virtual presence.

PiRats members are connected by both shared activity and social fellowship -- exactly the formula which, Linden Lab's own research shows, is most likely to keep residents in SL. As such, the PiRats are a considerable economic asset to Linden Lab.

Moreover, PiRat galleries are run with the discernment, civility, attentiveness, and high standards of which any real-life gallery should be proud.

As a tremendous aesthetic and creativity-promoting asset to Second Life, the PiRats are perfect candidates for a free region from the Linden Endowment for the Arts.

I sincerely hope that a region will be granted to the PiRat owners so that they can save up resources for a year to continue PiRats thereafter. Keeping the PiRats in Second Life at the cost of simply granting them a region would be a terrific bargain for Linden Lab.

 Scott Rolfe:

I have had the privilege of showing at Pirats many times, and has always been a positive experience. It has served as a hub for artists all over the world to show and to meet. You have all done a great job and it will be sorely missed.

 Kristine Schomaker:

Pirats has been an amazing force in the SL art community. It has been wonderful showing with them. It will be a shame if they have to go. The whole team at pirats rock!!! The raise the bar for any other virtual galleries or art organizations in SL!!!

 PralineBarjowski Ghost:

Too bad ! What really wants LL ? To let PIRats close is a tragedy at many levels! I hope you will not give up ! and at last, other grids exist !!

 Tracie Zenovka:

I hope Linden Lab will recognise the valuable dimension organisations like Pirats add to Second Life. Pirats provides opportunities for artists to expose their work to a wider audience. This gives people like me art to look at that I would never otherwise find. And SL benefits from having a wholesome side it can promote.

 Quan Lavender:

It would be a great loss for the art world in SL

 Daniele DACO Costantin:

if this is true, I am very sorry ... but we all now think of giving birth to something new, or continue in a new way, W Pirats


What We Need & What You Get

This is 11 months that we informed Linden Lab that the Pirats Art Network Organization was unable to finance the Simulator for the future months.

We exchanged many email with many people of Linden Lab on this topic, Carla Linden, Zeeshan Qasim, Kim Salzer, Courtney Linden, Rod Humble, Jay Linden, Catherine Linden, Madhavi Lindenâ€¦ including the last, dated August 12, 2011 said that Linden Lab would help us find a solution.

Today Pirats Art Network need to pay an invoice sent by Linden Lab for its Second Life simulator for:

$2,051.21.USD


Total amount needed :  $ 2,051.21 USD 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • http://www.pirats-art-network.org/p-34-membersh...
  • http://www.ipetitions.com/petition/save-pirats/

story:
Help me publish a wonderful book...

... and get wonderful art in the process!

 

Ajude-me a publicar um livro maravilhoso...

... e receba arte maravilhosa por isso!

 

 

IMPORTANT:

For every perk that has an OR condition or asks for your choice you MUST provide a valid option, either through a comment when you claim the perk, or by e-mailing me at beatricebulteau@gmail.com. If no choice is made, you will receive one of the available options at random.

T-shirt sizes MUST be specified in the same manner.

Pet portraits REQUIRE the photo of the pet to be sent via e-mail to the address above.

--------------------------[PORTUGUÊS]------------------------------

IMPORTANTE:

Por cada recompensa que tenha uma condição OU (OR) ou peça uma escolha, TEM de fornecer uma opção válida, seja por comentário quando a recompensa é reclamada, ou mandando um e-mail a beatricebulteau@gmail.com. Se nenhuma escolha for feita, receberá uma das opções ao acaso.

Tamanhos de t-shirt TÊM de ser especificados da mesma forma.

Retratos de animais de estimação REQUEREM que a foto do animal seja enviada via e-mail para o endereço acima.

 

PERK #1 - $25 - The Least You Could Do

- One-of-a-kind hand-painted t-shirt (reverse-only washable) of an Arabian or Lusitano horse, your choice.

AND

- Original signed china-ink drawing of an Arabian or Lusitano horse, your choice. 8x12'' (21x30cm)

SPECIAL: The first 50 supporters to claim this perk will get TWO china-ink drawings instead of just one.

--------------------------[PORTUGUÊS]------------------------------

- T-shirt única pintada à mão (lavável apenas do avesso) de um cavalo Lusitano ou Árabe, à escolha.

MAIS

- Desenho a tinta-da-china original assinado de um cavalo Lusitano ou Árabe, à escolha.

ESPECIAL: Os primeiros 50 contribuintes que reclamarem esta recompensa receberão DOIS desenhos em vez de um.

 

 

PERK #2 - $50 - Better Yet

- One-of-a-kind hand-painted t-shirt (reverse-only washable) of an Arabian or Lusitano horse, your choice.

AND

- Original signed china-ink drawing of a specific horse breed of your choice. 12x16'' (30x40cm)

--------------------------[PORTUGUÊS]------------------------------

- T-shirt única pintada à mão (lavável apenas do avesso) de um cavalo Lusitano ou Árabe, à escolha.

MAIS

- Desenho a tinta-da-china original assinado de uma raça específica de cavalo à escolha.

 

 

PERK #3 - $80 - Precious

- One-of-a-kind hand-painted t-shirt (reverse-only washable) of an Arabian or Lusitano horse, your choice.

AND

- Original signed china-ink drawing of a specific horse breed in ONE movement from the following:

Trot
Flying Changes
Piaffer
Passage
Galop
Jump

your choice. 12x16'' (30x40cm)

AND

- The finished book.*

*If the funding isn't enough to publish the book, instead of the book you will receive four different additional drawings of no specific horse breed. 12x16'' (30x40cm)

--------------------------[PORTUGUÊS]------------------------------

- T-shirt única pintada à mão (lavável apenas do avesso) de um cavalo Lusitano ou Árabe, à escolha.

ABOUT THE PROJECT

My name is Beatrice Bulteau. I'm an artist. I've been painting for over forty years, and I am known for my works with horses. I have already published two art books since 2001, Magical Horses and Lusitano. The latter depicts the character of the Lusitano Horse with paintings, drawings and ceramics, along with the help of poetry written by Joseph Sherman and others. Such a complete and sincere account was only possible after many years of living in Portugal among the breeders and the horses themselves in their natural habitat. Through the arts we show the soul of what we depict.

This year I intend to to the same by publishing my third book, this time on the Arabian Horse.

I had the incredible luck of meeting exceptional breeders from Cairo, Egypt, the birthplace of the Egyptian Arab Horse. Dr. Nasr Marei (breeder and international judge) and Dani Barbeiri (with 40+ years of experience in arabian horse breeding) among them. They both showed me the incredible mystical side of the desert horse, so that I could portray it. It's a kind of secret that I can't keep, and after a few years among their company, want to reveal.

It is important that I publish this book myself because, just as it was with my first book, I feel like this work needs my full control. In order to make sure that it is organized in the best possible way, that the message goes across as best as possible, I have chosen to self-publish to ensure that it remains a pure work of art.

This is my second book on a specific breed. The first one helped to spread the knowledge and the origins of the Lusitano horse throughout the world, along with its beauty, character, and the cultural connection it has to its country, Portugal. My art served as the vehicle for this expression. I want to do the same for the Arabian Horse, as I think it deserves the same recognition. By helping me publish this book, you are helping me show the hidden side of the Arabian Horse.

If the goal is not reached, the funds will further support my art and cover some of the expenses of my research on the Arab Horse, along with all the other resources that I gathered to make this book. Also, you will have still had the opportunity to take advantage of the situation and acquire my works at an incredibly low price! How dare you! :)
I will also have had the compensation of knowing you all better and working like heck to send you all this wonderful stuff! Oh, well... :)

So please join my project so we can show the world an artistic report on the soul of the desert horse. Also, let us pay tribute to the greatest breeders of this most ancient and valuable treasure.

ABOUT THE PROJECT
My name is Beatrice Bulteau. I'm an artist. I've been painting for over forty years, and I am known for my works with horses. I have already published two art books since 2001, Magical Horses and Lusitano. The latter depicts the character of the Lusitano Horse with paintings, drawings and ceramics, along with the help of poetry written by Joseph Sherman and others. Such a complete and sincere account was only possible after many years of living in Portugal among the breeders and the horses themselves in their natural habitat. Through the arts we show the soul of what we depict.
This year I intend to to the same by publishing my third book, this time on the Arabian Horse.
I had the incredible luck of meeting exceptional breeders from Cairo, Egypt, the birthplace of the Egyptian Arab Horse. Dr. Nasr Marei (breeder and international judge) and Dani Barbeiri (with 40+ years of experience in arabian horse breeding) among them. They both showed me the incredible mystical side of the desert horse, so that I could portray it. It's a kind of secret that I can't keep, and after a few years among their company, want to reveal.
It is important that I publish this book myself because, just as it was with my first book, I feel like this work needs my full control. In order to make sure that it is organized in the best possible way, that the message goes across as best as possible, I have chosen to self-publish to ensure that it remains a pure work of art.
This is my second book on a specific breed. The first one helped to spread the knowledge and the origins of the Lusitano horse throughout the world, along with its beauty, character, and the cultural connection it has to its country, Portugal. My art served as the vehicle for this expression. I want to do the same for the Arabian Horse, as I think it deserves the same recognition. By helping me publish this book, you are helping me show the hidden side of the Arabian Horse.
If the goal is not reached, the funds will further support my art and cover some of the expenses of my research on the Arab Horse, along with all the other resources that I gathered to make this book. Also, you will have still had the opportunity to take advantage of the situation and acquire my works at an incredibly low price! How dare you! :)I will also have had the compensation of knowing you all better and working like heck to send you all this wonderful stuff! Oh, well... :)
So please join my project so we can show the world an artistic report on the soul of the desert horse. Also, let us pay tribute to the greatest breeders of this most ancient and valuable treasure.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dorian "Paul D" Rogers. I have been a performance poet for more than ten years. During that time, I have been blessed to make many achievements in the U.S. I've featured at over 40 colleges and universities. I have also won both regional and national poetry competitions. My most recent goal has been to take my talents abroad. In November 2011, I moved to Abu Dhabi to teach and help spread spoken word. In December, I was able to have my first international feature in Berlin. With your help, I will continue my goal with my first international tour to Cape Town and Johannesburg. With your assistance, no matter how small, I will be fulfilling my dreams to spread performance poetry across the world. I will also be able to give free educational workshops that focus on writing poetry and an appreciation for language arts.
 
LIST OF COLLEGES/UNIVERSITIES IN WHICH I'VE FEATURED:
Sorbonne University- Abu Dhabi
Florida State University
Western Carolina University
University of Maryland
University of Miami
Jacksonville University
Columbus State University
University of Florida
Savannah College of Art and Design
Lenoir Rhyne College
UAB-Birmingham
Mississippi University for Women
Mary Baldwin College
Louisiana Tech
Virginia Wesleyan
Southern Polytechnic
Brenau University
Kennesaw State University
Georgia State University
Winthrop University
Radford University
Armstrong Atlantic University
Averett University
Longwood University
Methodist University
UNC Wilmington
Coastal Carolina University
Georgia Tech University
University of Texas-San Antonio
Broward Community College- North Campus
Broward Community College- South Campus
Johnson C. Smith University
Henderson State University
 

What We Need & What You Get

For this two-week journey, I will need $4,000. I will be taking care of the cost of my own flight. Your funds will be allotted to a few specific areas. I will use $1500 to bring along a film-maker to document the journey. This will take care of their flight, hotel, and give them spending money for food. It will also cover cost for equipment rental. Another $1500 will assist with helping me commute across different regions of South Africa. Another $1,000 will assist with my own lodging. I am offering a silver, gold, and diamond donor package that includes everything from copies of my upcoming poetry CD a custom-made poem written specifically to a big occasion in your life.

The Impact

The impact of this tour will be big. If you know me, you know that I am positive ambassador for progressive arts that empowers others to express themselves. As a school teacher for seven years, I know that I am uniquely qualified to get youth excited about the power of words. The video documentary will help you see first-hand the impact that I will have on South Africa. Don't worry if you can't pony up any funds. Getting the word out is valuable in of itself. Take a second to share my campaign link with your close friends. It only takes a second and will make a world of difference to me. Thanks and may God bless you!
