story:
WhyTheNose? is producing and filming a 25-hour music video documentary of the Burning Man 2014 Community in the style of Pharrell's 24HoursofHappy.com

Every 4 minutes, the song replays as a new dancer steps into frame and we'll showcase 360 dancers over 24 hours on screen, so we named it:

360 Degrees of Happy! At Burning Man

WhyTheNose?

Hi, my name is Tex Allen. For the last four years, I've worn a clown Nose on my face every time I leave the house. I did so because it made me happy. The first day, three people asked me, “Why the Nose?” That night, my fiance told me to, “...grab that domain name, you're onto something.”

I did and kept wearing the Nose, handing them out to anyone brave enough to SPEAK to me. I also started taking their photos with the Nose and telling the amazing and beautiful stories online. People around the world who've tuned into the movement have asked me for Noses or bought their own and spread this JOY to over 30 countries with nearly 250,000 lovebombs gifted to date!

WhyTheNose? has produced over 40 music videos too and this one is starting a REVOLUTION!


In early March, late one night I discovered the site:

24hoursofhappy.com

via my fiance' Cat handing me an iPad, saying, “You've GOT to see this!”

Well, the song's infectious lyrics and how it put the raw, beautiful breadth of humanity on display through dance just grabbed me and I was overwhelmed.

“This needs to happen at Burning Man!', I told my fiance Cat.

“With Noses!” she replied.

NOTE: Noses are OPTIONAL during the video :)

After that night in March, we began to ask if there was community interest in the project and instantly found that:

  • People, Camps, Art Projects and Core organizations were ready to participate

  • Videographers from all over the community wanted to pitch in!

Bolstered by the support, I prepared a brief and sent it over to Burning Man as a media project.

It got approved and a team began assembling to co-create this massive videography artwork.

It's a bold, audacious and grand LOVESTUNT!

Our goal is to REMIX and REBUILD the universal meme Pharrell created and show the entire Burning Man community through a lens of dance and happiness that's unique to the citizens of Black Rock City. We'll take the viewer on a journey from Gate to the Temple in 24 hours...and create an experience that immerses the viewer in the myriad, unlimited possibilities that we create on the Playa, together.

For those who've never attended, this will be a living document of the love that went into creating Burning Man 2014 and a chance for the millions who want to attend Burning Man to take a 24 hour trip to the desert!

Every camp / art installation / core services team / and major Playa event will have the opportunity to participate and we'll film it for them. We're being given an opportunity to create the WORLD'S FIRST MUSIC VIDEO DOCUMENTARY and have the entire Burning Man community ready to participate.

“You're a fan of the Grand Gesture...”

The previous four years of ridiculous stunts in the name of LOVE for EVERYONE via WhyTheNose? have paved the way for this GRAND project. We've had plenty of practice pulling together community under the banner of FUN, we're simply scaling it up a bit for 2014!

360Happy! serves many purposes:

  • It's the first music video documentary of it's kind that's been collaboratively created and funded by the ENTIRE community. It's the World's Longest Home Video starring YOU and thousands of your friends!

  • 360Happy! will portray the Burning Man experience from “the inside out” We'll be highlighting the organizations, camps and art pieces that are the HEART of our community. Then we add in Happy! and a dancer and the backdrop of Burning Man in all directions. You could call it “Meeting John Malkovich” meets Soul Train in the desert, for 24 hours.

  • Once completed, we'll have a film that can be shown around the world as a unique artwork that IMMERSES the viewer in the Burning Man experience. It will be available to Burning Man regionals, as well as civic art events, art museums and other creatively inspired community engagements globally.

  • 360Happy! allows us to create a HISTORIC, NEXTCULTURE documentary that reaches out and pays tribute to the thousands of Burning Man artists by encouraging ALL the community to participate in it's creation.

360Happy! is a massive GIFT of Happiness! from our community to each other and the world.

Remember, this is a Burning Man version of Happy!


There's a lot of planning and equipment going into creating this video and we've made this list of items and services to be funded with your help:

  • 2003 Chevy Express Cargo Van and 2-person travel trailer serving as production headquarters for Burning Man and our Community Engagement vehicles for the Nose and 360Happy! - Rental $4650

  • Electric art car filming platform, previously used by Roy2Thousand to create “The Fertile Desert” with a complement of four batteries, chargers and a generator http://vimeo.com/37149784 - $3800

  • 10 GoPro kits for the five video crews. Each kit includes a GoPro3, hand-held stabilizer, two backup batteries, viewer BacPak, 128GB of memory, external memory bank for video storage and LED lighting for night capture. Cameras and branded accessories will be rentals. - $4550

  • 4000 Lumen Projector and portable movie screen for filming backdrops on Playa for 360Happy! - $500

All the money raised will go directly towards purchasing the equipment needed to bring this gift to life. Any funds raised beyond our needs will go into extra equipment to further outfit video volunteer teams. Also, we've been offered the opportunity to apply our van/trailer rental fees towards purchasing them as a platform to move forward with our art. Extra funds would be added to those fees and outright purchase of the vehicles.

Since this is a WhyTheNose? Project, you should be aware that we've got some ridiculous and amazing rewards!

Producer Credit – $1

That's right, you get to be a REAL LIVE PRODUCER of a 24-hour documentary! We'll put your name up there, or whatever name you like, as one of our Producers. Heck, you can put that on a business card! Think of the possibilities. The mind boggles!

Personal Thank You in the “World's Longest Credits Video” - $5

After we're done, I'm gonna personally thank EVERYONE WHO DONATED at and above this level. YEP. My last “Thank You” video for Burning Man 2012 went for 12 minutes...
My goal is to also make it the most entertaining credits EVER.
I can't wait to SHOUT YOU OUT!

WhyTheNose? Archives 8 x 10 print - $25

Since the project began, I've taken thousands of portraits of faces from all over the world. For this reward level, you'll get a signed print I've chosen from the massive galleries taken at Burning Man.   

(You also receive the previous reward levels.)

Two Hour 360Happy! DVD with bonus footage - $50

Look, 24 hours of video is a LOT to watch and you'd probably love to watch a condensed version of this trip to Burning Man on a DVD, right? Well, this reward puts the experience AND a whole mess of behind-the-scenes in a single package! Seriously, if you're already laughing at this idea, wait until you see what went into making it happen :) It'll be the best gag reel...Ever.

(You also receive the previous reward levels.)

Sponsor a DANCE! - $100

We KNOW you're a lovely person and a giving person and someone who wants to make everyone Happy! Knowing that, we created “Sponsor a Dance” just for YOU! At this level, you are SPONSORING a random person at Burning Man and gifting them their 4 MINUTES OF FAME :) Our teams will tell the people who are lining up to dance that YOU sponsored them to do their THANG. Or shake their THANG. Or however they GET DOWN.

In addition, we'll put your name as the AWESOME gifting sponsor on their dance credits and connect you and your dancer as artist and benefactor. You're getting a new, dancing friend and everyone's even Happier! (Yes, there's a theme here)

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels)

Set of 12 Limited Edition Prints - $200

During Burning Man 2014, I'll be creating a series of photos that capture the experience of filming 360Happy! combined with WhyTheNose? Afterwards, the shots will be printed in a limited set of 12 and never printed again. For a few supporters, I'll create this #loveset of photos to enjoy and remember the beautiful effort the community put forth to create this art.

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels)

Featured Dance, Top of the Hour! - $350

With 24 hours available, we thought it would be great to REALLY give everyone attending this year, the opportunity to have their OWN FEATURED DANCE. At the top of each hour, we'll have a highlighted dance that will begin that specific 

If you'd like to show the world YOUR awesome dancing self at the highlighted times in 360Happy! in front of the WORLD: Here's your shot!
Who wants to DANCE at Sunset? Or Sunrise? Or even Noon?

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)

DANCIN' TEX - $500

This reward is a FANTASTIC opportunity for YOU to make ME look completely SILLY. Because I'm putting up FIVE rewards where I'm your dancin' Tex! You tell me how to dance and I'll do it. It's your script. Want me to climb upside down and jerk like a monkey, flip down, crawl towards to camera like Madonna, strip off my boots and take a shower with my clothes on while dancing to Happy! And eating a peanut butter sandwich with no milk in a tutu? OK. That's EASY.

You could actually ask me to do something RIDICULOUS too, I guess.

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)

The NOSE - $1000

Four years ago, I wore a Nose and changed my life. Shortly after we attended Burning Man for the first time, took 50 Noses and the story that began. Thousands and thousands of Noses later, I've still got two from that first trip. They've been placed on my personal altar. Sometimes, when I feel I really NEED a lift, I drop one in my pocket as a token. After four years, I'm offering up one of these personal artifacts.

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)

Janky Tent - $2000

If there was ever an instant symbol of the Nose and the love that Cat and I have for this community, the Janky Tent shines. Before the first Burning Man with the Nose, we camped out in the desert a few months before and created a circus tent for the trip. It's a hand-painted mess, courtesy of my lack-of-painting-skills! It's janky.

It's been the center of every event we've attended though and we've handed out thousands of Noses under it's awnings. It's held thousands of friends and family in and out of it's modest shell. Really, it's our sacred spot and we know that it's got so much lovin' JUJU soaked up in the fabric that secret government agencies are probably tracking it's heat signature. For real.

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)

VIPPEE Nose Ambassador - $3000

Once 360Happy! Is complete, we expect to take it around the USA to art events where the Nose has already been asked to participate on a civic/community level. If the movie is playing near you, I'll fly in to meet YOU for the entire 24hour Happy! experience and we'll Nose your TOWN! Additionally, YOU'LL be the VIPPEE presenting the movie, and the Nose Ambassador of Love! (No Pressure)
Sound like fun? You have no idea how much we can do in a day together with a few hundred Noses...

(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)


We've got a crew of media professional, Playa-veterans on our team.

Their expertise is centered around video production and between them there's 30 years of experience in the Black Rock Desert. Every one of them is ready to dedicate the time and energy to make sure this project covers our entire community and brings 25 hours of smiles :)

PLEASE WATCH BELOW WHERE I EXPLAIN THE RISKS, THANKS!


So, although usage rights prevent us from using "Happy" in the crowdfunding video itself, we are securing synchronization license from the copyright owner, where we will have full use of the song in our 24+ hour movie venture!

Thank you!

Without you, there would be no WhyTheNose? You've all carried this #lovestunt around the world. We want to broadcast that ethos of love, inclusion and understanding to a larger audience.

360Happy! is ready to do that with your continued belief in:

Spreading Love Around the World, Person to Person, One Nose at a Time :)

_______________________________________________________________________

You can also support this campaign SOCIALLY via our Thunderclap!
Thank you!
story_txt:
WhyTheNose? is producing and filming a 25-hour music video documentary of the
Burning Man 2014 Community in the style of Pharrell's
24HoursofHappy.com

Every
4 minutes, the song replays as a new dancer steps into frame and
we'll showcase 360 dancers over 24 hours on screen, so we named it:


360
Degrees of Happy! At Burning Man 


WhyTheNose?


Hi,
my name is Tex Allen. For the last four years, I've worn a clown Nose
on my face every time I leave the house. I did so because it made me
happy. The first day, three people asked me, “Why the Nose?” That
night, my fiance told me to, “...grab that domain name, you're onto
something.”

I
did and kept wearing the Nose, handing them out to anyone brave
enough to SPEAK to me. I also started taking their photos with the
Nose and telling the amazing and beautiful stories online. People
around the world who've tuned into the movement have asked me for
Noses or bought their own and spread this JOY to over
30 countries with nearly 250,000 lovebombs gifted to date! 

WhyTheNose? has produced over 40 music videos too and this one is starting a REVOLUTION!
In
early March, late one night I discovered the site:


24hoursofhappy.com


via
my fiance' Cat handing me an iPad, saying, “You've GOT to see
this!”

Well, the song's infectious lyrics and
how it put the raw, beautiful breadth of humanity on display through
dance just grabbed me and I was overwhelmed. 



“This
needs to happen at Burning Man!', I told my fiance Cat.

“With
Noses!” she replied.


NOTE:
Noses are OPTIONAL during the video :)


After
that night in March, we began to ask if there was community interest
in the project and instantly found that:




	People,
	Camps, Art Projects and Core organizations were ready to participate



	Videographers
	from all over the community wanted to pitch in!


Bolstered by the support, I prepared a brief and sent it over to
Burning Man as a media project. 



It
got approved and a team began assembling to co-create this massive videography artwork.

It's a bold, audacious and grand LOVESTUNT!

Our
goal is to REMIX and REBUILD the universal meme Pharrell created and show the entire
Burning Man community through a lens of dance and happiness that's
unique to the citizens of Black Rock City. We'll take the viewer on a
journey from Gate to the Temple in 24 hours...and create an
experience that immerses the viewer in the myriad, unlimited
possibilities that we create on the Playa, together.


For
those who've never attended, this will be a living document of the
love that went into creating Burning Man 2014 and a chance for the
millions who want to attend Burning Man to take a 24 hour trip to the
desert!Every
camp / art installation / core services team / and major Playa event
will have the opportunity to participate and we'll film it for them.
We're being given an opportunity to create the WORLD'S FIRST MUSIC VIDEO DOCUMENTARY and have the entire Burning Man community ready to
participate.

“You're
a fan of the Grand Gesture...”

The
previous four years of ridiculous stunts in the name of LOVE for
EVERYONE via WhyTheNose? have paved the way for this GRAND project.
We've had plenty of practice pulling together community under the
banner of FUN, we're simply scaling it up a bit for 2014!


360Happy!
serves many purposes:




	It's
	the first music video documentary of it's kind that's been
	collaboratively created and funded by the ENTIRE community. It's the
	World's Longest Home Video starring YOU and thousands of your
	friends!



	360Happy!
	will portray the Burning Man experience from “the inside out”
	We'll be highlighting the organizations, camps and art pieces that
	are the HEART of our community. Then we add in Happy! and a dancer
	and the backdrop of Burning Man in all directions. You could call it
	“Meeting John Malkovich” meets Soul Train in the desert, for 24
	hours.



	Once
	completed, we'll have a film that can be shown around the world as a
	unique artwork that IMMERSES the viewer in the Burning Man
	experience. It will be available to Burning Man regionals, as well
	as civic art events, art museums and other creatively inspired
	community engagements globally.



	360Happy!
	allows us to create a HISTORIC, NEXTCULTURE documentary that reaches out and pays
	tribute to the thousands of Burning Man artists by encouraging ALL
	the community to participate in it's creation. 
	



360Happy!
is a massive GIFT of Happiness! from our community to each other and
the world.Remember, this is a Burning Man version of Happy!


There's
a lot of planning and equipment going into creating this video and
we've made this list of items and services to be funded with your
help:





	2003
	Chevy Express Cargo Van and 2-person travel trailer serving as
	production headquarters for Burning Man and our Community Engagement
	vehicles for the Nose and 360Happy! - Rental $4650


Electric art car filming platform, previously used by Roy2Thousand
	to create “The Fertile Desert” with  a complement of four
	batteries, chargers and a generator http://vimeo.com/37149784
	- $3800



	10
	GoPro kits for the five video crews. Each kit includes a GoPro3,
	hand-held stabilizer, two backup batteries, viewer BacPak, 128GB of
	memory, external memory bank for video storage and LED lighting for night
	capture. Cameras and branded accessories will be rentals. - $4550



	4000
	Lumen Projector and portable movie screen for filming backdrops on
	Playa for 360Happy! - $500


All
the money raised will go directly towards purchasing the
equipment needed to bring this gift to life. Any funds raised beyond
our needs will go into extra equipment to further outfit  video
volunteer teams. Also, we've been offered the opportunity to apply our van/trailer rental fees towards purchasing them as a platform to move forward with our art. Extra funds would be added to those fees and outright purchase of the vehicles.

Since
this is a WhyTheNose? Project, you should be aware that we've got some
ridiculous and amazing rewards!
Producer
Credit – $1
That's
right, you get to be a REAL LIVE PRODUCER of a 24-hour documentary!
We'll put your name up there, or whatever name you like, as one of
our Producers. Heck, you can put that on a business card! Think of
the possibilities. The mind boggles!Personal
Thank You in the “World's Longest Credits Video” - $5
After
we're done, I'm gonna personally thank EVERYONE WHO DONATED at and
above this level. YEP. My last “Thank You” video for Burning Man
2012 went for 12 minutes...My goal is to also make it the most entertaining credits EVER.I can't wait to SHOUT YOU OUT!
WhyTheNose?
Archives 8 x 10 print - $25
Since
the project began, I've taken thousands of portraits of faces from
all over the world. For this reward level, you'll get a signed print
I've chosen from the massive galleries taken at Burning Man.   (You also receive the previous reward levels.)
Two
Hour 360Happy! DVD with bonus footage - $50
Look,
24 hours of video is a LOT to watch and you'd probably love to watch
a condensed version of this trip to Burning Man on a DVD, right?
Well, this reward puts the experience AND a whole mess of
behind-the-scenes in a single package! Seriously, if you're already
laughing at this idea, wait until you see what went into making it
happen :) It'll be the best gag reel...Ever.(You also receive the previous reward levels.)
Sponsor
a DANCE! - $100
We
KNOW you're a lovely person and a giving person and someone who wants
to make everyone Happy! Knowing that, we created “Sponsor a Dance”
just for YOU! At this level, you are SPONSORING a random person at
Burning Man and gifting them their 4 MINUTES OF FAME :) Our teams
will tell the people who are lining up to dance that YOU sponsored
them to do their THANG. Or shake their THANG. Or however they GET
DOWN. 

In
addition, we'll put your name as the AWESOME gifting sponsor on their
dance credits and connect you and your dancer as artist and
benefactor. You're getting a new, dancing friend and everyone's even
Happier! (Yes, there's a theme here)(You also receive Producer and Credit levels)Set
of 12 Limited Edition Prints - $200
During
Burning Man 2014, I'll be creating a series of photos that capture
the experience of filming 360Happy! combined with WhyTheNose?
Afterwards, the shots will be printed in a limited set of 12 and
never printed again. For a few supporters, I'll create this #loveset
of photos to enjoy and remember the beautiful effort the community
put forth to create this art.(You also receive Producer and Credit levels)
Featured
Dance, Top of the Hour! - $350
With
24 hours available, we thought it would be great to REALLY give
everyone attending this year, the opportunity to have their OWN
FEATURED DANCE. At the top of each hour, we'll have a highlighted
dance that will begin that specific If you'd like to show the world YOUR awesome dancing self at the highlighted times in 360Happy! in front of the WORLD: Here's your shot!Who wants to
DANCE at Sunset? Or Sunrise? Or even Noon?(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)DANCIN'
TEX - $500This
reward is a FANTASTIC opportunity for YOU to make ME look completely SILLY. Because I'm
putting up FIVE rewards where I'm your dancin' Tex! You tell me how
to dance and I'll do it. It's your script. Want me to climb upside
down and jerk like a monkey, flip down, crawl towards to camera like
Madonna, strip off my boots and take a shower with my clothes on
while dancing to Happy! And eating a peanut butter sandwich with no
milk in a tutu? OK. That's EASY.
You
could actually ask me to do something RIDICULOUS too, I guess.(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)
The
NOSE - $1000Four
years ago, I wore a Nose and changed my life. Shortly after we
attended Burning Man for the first time, took 50 Noses and the story
that began. Thousands and thousands of Noses later, I've still
got two from that first trip. They've been placed on my
personal altar. Sometimes, when I feel I really NEED a lift, I drop one in my pocket as a
token. After four years, I'm offering up one of these personal
artifacts.(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)
Janky
Tent - $2000

If
there was ever an instant symbol of the Nose and the love that Cat
and I have for this community, the Janky Tent shines. Before the
first Burning Man with the Nose, we camped out in the desert a few
months before and created a circus tent for the trip. It's a
hand-painted mess, courtesy of my lack-of-painting-skills! It's
janky.
It's
been the center of every event we've attended though and we've handed
out thousands of Noses under it's awnings. It's held thousands of
friends and family in and out of it's modest shell. Really, it's our
sacred spot and we know that it's got so much lovin' JUJU soaked up
in the fabric that secret government agencies are probably tracking
it's heat signature. For real.(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)VIPPEE
Nose Ambassador - $3000
Once
360Happy! Is complete, we expect to take it around the USA to art
events where the Nose has already been asked to participate on a
civic/community level. If the movie is playing near you, I'll fly in
to meet YOU for the entire 24hour Happy! experience and we'll Nose
your TOWN! Additionally, YOU'LL be the VIPPEE presenting the movie,
and the Nose Ambassador of Love! (No Pressure) Sound like fun? You have no idea how much we can
do in a day together with a few hundred Noses...(You also receive Producer and Credit levels, along with an archive print)
We've
got a crew of media professional, Playa-veterans on our team.
Their
expertise is centered around video production and between them
there's 30 years of experience in the Black Rock Desert. Every one of
them is ready to dedicate the time and energy to make sure this
project covers our entire community and brings 25 hours of smiles :)
PLEASE WATCH BELOW WHERE I EXPLAIN THE RISKS, THANKS!So, although usage rights prevent us from using "Happy" in the crowdfunding video itself, we are securing synchronization license from the copyright owner, where we will have full use of the song in our 24+ hour movie venture!Thank
you!
Without
you, there would be no WhyTheNose? You've all carried this #lovestunt around the world. We want to broadcast that ethos of
love, inclusion and understanding to a larger audience.360Happy! is ready to do that with your continued belief in:Spreading
Love Around the World, Person to Person, One Nose at a Time :)
_______________________________________________________________________You can also support this campaign SOCIALLY via our Thunderclap!Thank you!

story:
I started a business in 2007 while I was in my second year of college. I started up without any capital yet in 3 months my business was booming. I ran a Overseas Cultural Exchange Placement Service for University students.  Right around the recession things went bad and my business collapsed. I was left in a 4.8 million dollar dept or US$46,000. Over the years I have struggled to pay it off and with the interest going up and all my tries failing I now owe something around US$130,000.

 


I got arrested for taking too long to pay off my debts and right now I am on bail. I have 5 court cases going. It’s now 4:30 pm and 10:am tomorrow morning I am suppose to bring  US$1800 to court. I have less than a quarter of the money and the judge gave me tomorrow as the last day to bring the money in. I am not going to jail, especially since I have a 1 year old daughter.... and jail sucks! I am not gonna commit suicide and I'm not gonna steal the money, I am going to try all that I can and right now I am trying crowd funding. I also rented a restaurant space 3 months ago to start a new business to help pay the debt, but the space has just been sitting there because I have insufficient capital to start up.  I ask anyone reading this to help me please. I need at least the $1800 by tomorrow. Even If 1800 persons donate $1, I will accept it with great thanks. My phone number is 876 288-8212 if anyone wants to call me, also I have some goodies from my country to sell/give per donation if you guys are interested.

 

Break down of funds needed:

$1800- Court refund payment tomorrow

$1040- Court on August 23

$2000 - Court on August 26th

$800 - Court on September 5th

$700 -  Restaurant Capital to pay off the rest of the debt.

 

Please see my perks and donate, thanks you so much.

story:
Short Summary

We, The Satanic Temple, an established New York City-based religious organization, seek to donate a public monument to Oklahoma’s Capitol Preservation Commission for display upon Oklahoma City’s capitol grounds. As an “homage” to Satan, the purpose of the monument is to complement and contrast the Ten Commandments monument that already resides on the North side of the building.


The existing Ten Commandments monument, donated to the Capitol Preservation Commission in 2009 by Mike Ritze, a representative of the Oklahoma State Legislature and ordained Southern Baptist Deacon, has raised the ire of the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) who filed suit in August of 2013, noting that, “the monument stands alone, with no other monuments or memorials in the immediate vicinity.” Also of concern to the ACLU is the “self-evidently exclusive” religious message “that supports and endorses the faiths and creeds of some churches and sects.” We believe that in being allowed to place our monument within the proximity of the Ten Commandments monument, we can appease the ACLU’s concerns.

By accepting our offer, the good people of Oklahoma City will have the opportunity to show that they espouse the basic freedoms spelled out in the Constitution. We imagine that the ACLU will also embrace such a response. Allowing us to donate a monument would show that the Oklahoma City Council does not discriminate, and both the religious and non-religious should be happy with such an outcome. Our mission is to bring people together by finding common sentiments that create solutions that everyone can appreciate and enjoy.

We are keenly attune to the need for a public-friendly design and plan is to make our monument an object of play for young children. The Satanic Temple is accepting donations toward the production and placement of this historic and important monument to religious diversity.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $20,000 toward the construction and placement of our Satanic monument that will be erected alongside of the 10 Commandments monument at the Oklahoma State Capitol. Donations within certain price brackets earn the donator official Satanic Temple Merchandise gift packages. All funds will go toward the cost of constructing and erecting the monument. Donors must be aware of the possibility that the monument offer may be rejected or refused by the Oklahoma City Council prior to any construction. If Oklahoma City refuses to allow us to donate a monument, all funds will go toward efforts to appeal or contest the rejection, and/or place another Satanic monument in another relevant location.

The Impact

By contributing to The Satanic Temple's monument you will be contributing to the spread of religious diversity and a raising of the public consciousness. A Satanic monument erected in contrast to a 10 Commandments monument will send a clear and distinct message to the world that pluralism is alive and well in the United States.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the link to this campaign within your social media.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a free-lance artist who specializes in painting guitars. I've been painting guitars for over 20 years for several companies including, but not limited to, Fender, Gibson and Ibanez. I've also painted drums for bands including but not limited to Motley Crue, Def Leppard and Mick Fleetwood. I've also created art for bands and festivals to use on tour merchandise for the Scorpions, Aerosmith, Lollapalooza and others. In recent years, I've been working on a portrait portfolio of musicians and sports celebritites.

I've been working out of my home studio and it's time to get out! I want to open an art gallery in North Hollywood, CA. where I can display my art and meet clients in a professional setting. This gallery will be the first of its kind in the world. One investor funded the creation of 10 guitars and matching paintings for the grand opening. The luthiers involved are world-renowned masterbuilders from Fender's and Ibanez's Custom Shops. The event that brings us all together in one place will be HISTORIC IN THE GUITAR WORLD.

My entire career I've worked as a free-lancer creating art for companies and private collectors. I've worked at home to raise my child. Now that he's 23, it's time for me to make my own stamp in public. The goal is to run this as a family business with my son handling the business, leaving me free to paint.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for funding to cover expenses for the first year of the gallery. The total costs are $120,000 which will cover building expenses such as rent and utillities, construction in the building, supplies, advertising, insurance and an assistant's salary. I'm asking for 25% of total funds.

I have hundreds of images that you can choose from for your perks. I do my own fine art prints that I personally quality control. As my public profile increases, so will the value of my art. Some of my guitars have sold for as much as $30,000. John Mayer and Kenny Wayne Shepherd are 2 musicians that have played instruments I've painted. A painted guitar will add an immediate value to your guitar that will grow with time.

If I don't reach my entire goal, the money will be saved until I do. I have several interested investors and also have the option to subsidize the gap with a loan.

 

The Impact

This will be the first art gallery of its kind, blending music and art. If you want to be part of something that is truly unique and special, this is your chance. When you see your favorite musician playing an instrument painted by me, you'll know you had a part in making it happen.

I've been working in this industry for over 20 years. I've painted some of Fender's most successful projects including the Playboy 40th Anniversary Fender CS Strat and the Jimi Hendrix Monterey Pop Fender CS Strat. I was also on the design team of the Harley 90th Anniversary Fender CS Strat. These guitars are selling for up to $30,000.

I have a strong reputation as being reliable and delivering the highest quality possible. This is why the companies I've worked with have been relationships lasting more than 20 years.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell musicians you know about this new adventure in the world of music!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Who is Honey Pot Performance?

Honey Pot Performance (HPP) is Felicia Holman, Aisha Jean-Baptiste, Abra Johnson and Meida McNeal---a quartet of Chicago-based, kindred creative spirits who began collaborating in January 2001.

HPP is a woman-focused collaborative creative community committed to chronicling and interrogating Afro-diasporic feminist and unconventional subjectivities amidst the pressures of contemporary global life.

Following in the footsteps of cultural workers such as Zora Neale Hurston, Beryl McBurnie, Pearl Primus and Katherine Dunham, Honey Pot Performance forefronts African diasporic performance traditions. We draw upon a central notion found in both performance studies and black feminist discourse: non-Western, everyday popular and/or folk forms of cultural performance are valuable sites of knowledge production and cultural capital for subjectivities that often exist outside of mainstream communities.

The Sweet Spot (a.k.a. The Win/Win)

During the monthlong world premiere of 'Price Point' (June 2013; Sketchbook 13 performance festival), our audience response included overwhelming demand for a remount!  Here’s a sample of the feedback from our wonderfully engaged Sketchbook 13 audiences:

“Great performance! These amazing artists are terrific, straight forward and touching at the same time. Lots of times I have felt misunderstood, misinterpreted, and misheard when I speak up about life in general (success, economics, work, and even spiritual life) working so hard to obtain the BEST sacrificing many valuable things as family, mind, spirit, soul, and even compromising one’s health. When the performance finished I had a sweet & sour after taste!!! I love their work, very well done. Good sense of humor in some parts (why not laugh about our reality for a little bit?). I totally recommend… It’s a Must!”

“If you have not witnessed these ladies illustrate,testify to that which is happening right before our eyes everyday (the rude awakening of the “American Dream”), you are doing yourself a disservice!”

“This is compelling stuff . . . breaks the boundaries of academic postulation on these matters, even as you use the language of the sector, to get at the reality. Many thanks for sharing.”

“Price Point is an extraordinary blend of poetic monologue, humor, music, movement and digital media that speaks to our current economic crisis and experience as working folk. Price Point creatively weaves in riveting facts regarding the disparities between the upper and lower classes by including interviews, news clippings, quotes, and narration. Price Point not only takes us through the past and present, but gives us hope that collectively we can determine our future. The dialogue is powerful enough to invoke change and inspiration in our union as the majority. Words are not enough, videos are not enough, you MUST see this live to receive the full experience. Every man, woman, and child should be forced to see this show; once they have, they’ll thank their enforcer immediately. SIX STARS for an AWESOME Performance. So glad I didn’t miss this!”

As Sketchbook 13 festival participants, all of our production and marketing needs were supported by the festival's producer---Collaboraction theater company.  As we approach our self-produced 2013/2014 performance season, we are creatively sourcing our production/marketing needs through various channels....which include THIS 30-day fundraising campaign!

So what do we need from YOU?!..Our goal for this 30-day fundraising campaign is to raise $5,000 for our 2013-2014 production season which includes a remount of 'Price Point' at the new Links Hall in September 2013. Your generous contributions would help cover the cost of website completion, marketing, space rental, design (sound/video/lights/set/costumes), crew staffing and other production needs. Even if we do not meet our campaign goal, all "Stick With Honey Pot" contributions will go toward the costs listed above.

So what do you get from US?!..With six contributor levels to choose from, your sweet "Stick With Honey Pot Performance" perk options include: published recognition of your contribution via our online and offline materials, copies of our chapbook and 'Price Point' soundtrack, a peek inside our creative process during an open HPP rehearsal, "associate producer" credit and at our highest level ($500), contributors also receive a private creative movement/writing workshop led by Honey Pot Performance. Let your budget & perk preference be your guide, y'all!

The HPP Impact

The audience feedback above vividly illustrates the impact of an HPP show, but let's also consider this: funding HPP's 2013-14 season is important to us, our audiences and our communities because we each recognize that everyday popular and/or folk forms of cultural performance are valuable sites of knowledge production and cultural capital for subjectivities that often exist outside of mainstream communities. Performance is our therapy, our catharsis, our way to community. Performance is the haven that welcomes us to rediscover our own value and worth.  Performance and expression bring our dormant, unsaid emotions to the surface and urge us to work them out within a community that not only bears witness, but also empathizes through experience. It is in this spirit of healing & community that we strive to incorporate an outreach component in each of our projects.

For example, during our 2010 residency at the UNC/Chapel Hill, we devised and led afterschool workshops to share our creative process with area public school students. During our 2011 touring performance festival ('To Art & Profit'; Chicago,IL), we coordinated site specific public "spectacles" and panel discussions which invited residents of the participating festival neighborhoods to witness/participate in collaborative art practices & art valuation.

Our latest work, 'Price Point', serves as a hybrid of art and public service...an economic ringshout! The live 'Price Point' experience offers a proverbial safe space to both witness and testify to the dynamic endeavor of surviving in a devalued labor market. A safe space to create new answers to the question "What is today's social contract?". Our coalition with fellow artists and concerned citizens reflects our shared vision and experiences of alternative/DIY economic mobility. With your generous contributions, we can continue to pursue and manifest that vision!

Since 2001, our creative works have been presented at Kenyon College, Columbia College, the Chicago Cultural Center, Ohio University, Northwestern University, University of California-Irvine, Malcolm X College (Chicago), Links Hall (Chicago), Old Town School of Folk Music (Chicago) and the University of West Indies (Trinidad).  We have also received grants and other generous support from the Center for Interdisciplinary Research in the Arts (Northwestern University), the Telecommunications Service of Trinidad & Tobago (Trinidad), the Community Arts Assistance Program, the Evanston Arts Council, the Illinois Humanities Council, the Contemporary Arts Council (Chicago), Driehaus Foundation, Chicago Dancemakers Forum, Puffin Foundation and the University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill.

Join the Hive--Other Ways to Stick With Honey Pot!

Of course, we understand that some folks really want to but are unable to offer financial support.  No worries! There are several other ways to support Honey Pot Performance. You can ALWAYS....

- Share the "Stick with Honey Pot Performance" IndieGoGo campaign link.

- "Like"/share the Honey Pot Performance Facebook page here:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Honey-Pot-Performance/176043555793856

- Donate time, volunteer for HPP stage/production crew. Contact Felicia at honeypotperformance@gmail.com for more info.

- Attend Honey Pot Performance shows & bring folks!

- Join our HPP Review Circle---write & share your reviews on HPP shows.

Every bit helps and is MUCH appreciated so please help support independent/community-based art....stick with Honey Pot Performance and spread the love!
story_txt:
Who is Honey Pot Performance?
Honey Pot Performance (HPP) is Felicia Holman, Aisha Jean-Baptiste, Abra Johnson and Meida McNeal---a quartet of Chicago-based, kindred creative spirits who began collaborating in January 2001.

HPP is a woman-focused collaborative creative community committed to chronicling and interrogating Afro-diasporic feminist and unconventional subjectivities amidst the pressures of contemporary global life.
Following in the footsteps of cultural workers such as Zora Neale Hurston, Beryl McBurnie, Pearl Primus and Katherine Dunham, Honey Pot Performance forefronts African diasporic performance traditions. We draw upon a central notion found in both performance studies and black feminist discourse: non-Western, everyday popular and/or folk forms of cultural performance are valuable sites of knowledge production and cultural capital for subjectivities that often exist outside of mainstream communities.
The Sweet Spot (a.k.a. The Win/Win)


During the monthlong world premiere of 'Price Point' (June 2013; Sketchbook 13 performance festival), our audience response included overwhelming demand for a remount!  Here’s a sample of the feedback from our wonderfully engaged Sketchbook 13 audiences:
“Great performance! These amazing artists are terrific, straight forward and touching at the same time. Lots of times I have felt misunderstood, misinterpreted, and misheard when I speak up about life in general (success, economics, work, and even spiritual life) working so hard to obtain the BEST sacrificing many valuable things as family, mind, spirit, soul, and even compromising one’s health. When the performance finished I had a sweet & sour after taste!!! I love their work, very well done. Good sense of humor in some parts (why not laugh about our reality for a little bit?). I totally recommend… It’s a Must!”

“If you have not witnessed these ladies illustrate,testify to that which is happening right before our eyes everyday (the rude awakening of the “American Dream”), you are doing yourself a disservice!”
“This is compelling stuff . . . breaks the boundaries of academic postulation on these matters, even as you use the language of the sector, to get at the reality. Many thanks for sharing.”

“Price Point is an extraordinary blend of poetic monologue, humor, music, movement and digital media that speaks to our current economic crisis and experience as working folk. Price Point creatively weaves in riveting facts regarding the disparities between the upper and lower classes by including interviews, news clippings, quotes, and narration. story:
What?

So ten years of art-making later, I'm finally getting myself a proper online portfolio for my paintings, words and curatorial projects. Yay!  

 

Why?

Because Multiply has ceased functioning as a blog site (*shakes fist in the air*) and if I don't get a site I can update, my public profile is doomed to forever be frozen in January 2013 -- not good for an independant practitioner of any sort!

 

Who?

In summary, I am artist/writer based in Singapore and my work revolves around exploring how personal stories can be used to address larger socio-cultural issues of sex, gender, queer desire and notions of home. Besides painting and writing, my curatorial practice includes co-founding/running Etiquette, Singapore's first multidisciplinary art collective focused on feminist issues and organising exhibitions/discussions in alignment with NGOS/collectives such as the Association of Women for Action & Research (AWARE), IndigNation, Slutwalk Singapore, Animal Concerns, Research & Education Society (ACRES) and Sayoni. 

You can check out my extended profile, images of my work and samples of my writing on my old website here. Just remember that it's outdated! 

 

When?

I'm aiming to get the website out by June 2013. With two books coming out this year, a whole new slew of Etiquette events and me fresh into a new research project re-presenting art-activism in Singapore, I thought it would be a great time to start documenting everything that is going on. 

 

How?

Good question! Especially since I am to computers what fire is to ice. Don't worry, I'm not attempting to build a website from scratch. I've hired the awesome peeps at Octopus Ink to do it. So when you support this project, you're also supporting a homegrown design house that started its work from scratch in 2006, and has since gone on to do amazing things. Octopus makes books, websites & love. Evidence at www.octopus.sg

 

What again? 

Ah yes, what exactly you are funding. By supporting this project, you will be helping fund a number of crucial aspects that will make it possible. Your money will fund:

  • Concept Fees
  • Design Fees
  • Programming Fees
  • Domain Costs (2 years)
  • Hosting Costs (2 years)
  • A one-off Update Tutorial
  • Credit Card & Indiegogo Fees tied to this campaign. 

And of course, there is stuff in it for you too! Depending on how much you'd like to contribute, this is what you can pick from:

  • Original Drawings
  • Original Paintings
  • Books
  • Vouchers
  • My Pepetual Thanks
  • Mention on the website

And if by some stroke of karma we exceed the funding cap, I will be channeling all excess funds into my next body of visual work. Just in case you were wondering ;)

story:
Mongolia’s Buddhist Monasteries Project

Uncovering the past, building the future

Help us publish a treasure trove of data on historic Buddhist temple sites and share the stories of Mongolia’s elders, preserving a rich cultural past and encouraging young Mongolian citizens to embrace their heritage.

THEN

In the late 1930’s Mongolia’s Buddhist heritage was torn away when the Soviet-style Communists devastated the country’s sacred landscapes by destroying all the monasteries – and exiling or killing the monks or ordering them to be nomads, factory workers or soldiers.

 NOW

Today, Mongolians are actively seeking to retrieve the past, and striving to make contact with their historic cultural identity.  The history of Mongolia has been captured through stories of the elderly and archeological mapping of former Buddhist monastery sites, key to rediscovering Mongolia's unique cultural heritage.

STEP 1: We visited over 1300 sites of old and revived temples

The Arts Council of Mongolia sent survey teams to every part of the country to seek out the elders and survey the sites over a 1,000 Buddhist temples.  These elders, many of them young monks at the time of the destruction, told us their stories about daily life in the temples and monasteries. We also took GPS readings and photographs to preserve the elder’s identification of the Monastery sites.

STEP 2: We now need to publish what we found

The hard part is done.  Now, these stories, locations and photographs need to be published initially online so that Mongolians – and people across the globe – can gain access to Mongolia’s rich Buddhist past.

OUR GOAL

We are so close!  We need only $8,000 to complete the online publishing and make Mongolia’s Buddhist history accessible to Mongolians and the rest of the world.  We can do that with your help.  Please help us preserve the past and build the future of Mongolia’s history, and worldwide cultural understanding.

PROJECT SPECIFICS

The money from this drive will allow us to pay for the programming needed to get this trove of information in a easy-to-use website. (The address will be http://www.mongoliantemples.net.)

For each of the over 1,300 sites surveyed, the web site will aim to have a dedicated page in Mongolian and English with full details collected by the surveyors: GPS coordinates, narrative description of the location, date structure was founded, number of monks in residence, date of closure / destruction, any available archive photos, photos of the site at time of the survey, transcripts of Oral Histories collected from old people who knew the site, any available site plan, and a Precis of the history of the site (taken from interviews, other local sources and extracts from the Mongolian National Archive).

The website will also contain two scholarly reports on temples in Ikh Khuree (today's Ulaanbaatar) written by Krisztina Teleki and Zsuzsa Majer. One report covers old temples. The other covers post 1990 active temples. The web site will also include an 800 word Glossary in Mongolian/Tibetan into English compiled by these two scholars.

Subject to raising needed funds, the site should launch before the end of 2013.

 

ACM-US  maintains complete discretion over allocation of gifts. Although ACM-US cannot  legally  guarantee gifts will be used for the purpose specified, in all past cases we’ve been able to honor donor’s wishes. Subject to ACM-US board approval, any excess funds from this campaign will be used for further publication efforts for this project.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Gregg Deal. I am an artist, a husband, a father and a member of the Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe. Welcome to what could very easily be the most important work of my artistic career. 

This project is a performance art piece. I will be wearing traditional Native American clothing in various, everyday scenarios interacting with the public which will create interesting, thought-provoking, and even comical situations where the public will be forced to look at me, as a stereotypical Native person, and what I'm doing, and question what they are watching. How will they react if they saw me, a Native dressed in buckskin and a headdress, doing something as mundane as shopping for cereal at the grocery store? How would they react if they saw me eating Chinese food in China Town or taking pictures of buffalo at the National Zoo? How would they react if they saw me waiting in a Metro station or were riding in the same Metro car?

The performances will include a number of things that are simple, mundane, funny, political, over the top, satirical, ironic and even sad. 
 
The initial phase of this project will take place in the Washington D.C. and DC metro area. 

The purpose of this project is to raise questions about Native people, often viewed as a relic, and how they’re perceived in the modern age.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will help with obtaining the “traditional” outfit I will use, equipment needed for documentation and expenses to go along with it. I will be documenting this entire project through film and photography. This documentation will result in prints for upcoming shows as well a short film about the work and why it's relevant to art and the Native voice associated with it. 

The incentives to contributing funds will get you limited prints of the work, with larger donations receiving more and larger prints*. Another aspect to the 'perks' is being listed in the closing credits of the short documentary that will coincide with this project. This wouldn't happen without you.  

The Impact

I am aware of the subjective nature of art, but feel strongly about this work. This art campaign will force it's audience to engage the legitimacy of what they're seeing, where they stand, how it makes them feel, and what it means for Native people to exist, thrive and perpetuate their own culture in a society that has forced their assimilation. How do you feel about the Washington football team's mascot and why? How do you feel about gross caricatures of Indigenous people? How do you feel about the misconception of Native people, what they do, how they talk, and where they stand in the big scheme of things? These are real issues facing a socially-minded Native person. All of these scenes impact us in questioning our 'indianness', in how we are perceived, and in how we perceive ourselves. This will certainly be an incredible documented social experiment. 

*please note that the amount for the 'perks' will not match the cost of final prints once the project is complete.

story:
About Us

The Art Deco Festival was started in 1976 by the Miami Design Preservation League to attract visitors to Miami Beach's Art Deco Historic District and to raise awareness and appreciation of the arts and culture of the Art Deco Era (approx. 1925-1945). 

MDPL's success can be judged by taking a look at today's South Beach: the second most visited destination in Florida, attracting students and families, as well as models and celebrities, all drawn to Miami Beach for its natural beauty, rich diversity, and high quality of life. 

MDPL was the first Art Deco Society in the world. Back in 1970s South Beach, when MDPL's founder fought against all odd to save the Art Deco architecture from demolition, few could imagine the impact their activism would have on Miami Beach's future. MDPL continues to be a non-profit organization devoted to preserving, protecting and promoting the cultural, social, economic and environmental integrity of the Miami Beach Art Deco and throughout South Florida.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this year is to raise $10,000, you can help us meet our goal by becoming either a individual friends contributor or a corporate friends contributor. No other event in South Florida celebrates the architecture, history and culture of Miami Beach like Art Deco Weekend. For over 36 years, festival attendees have enjoyed fun-filled weekend of films and fashion, live music and lectures, vendors and visuals, parades and preservation that celebrates the era in which those gorgeous buildings were built. With your contribution we will be able to have another success Art Deco Weekend! The donated money helps us create free community events and educational programing during our annual Art Deco Weekend Festival. It would not be possible without your support, we thank you in advance.

If you become an Individual Friends contributor you will receive your name in the Art Deco Weekend 2014 Program Book. You will also receive an official Art Deco Weekend 2014 poster.

If you become a Corporate Friends contributor you will receive an autographed Art Deco Weekend 2014 poster and include a business card advertisement in the program, in addition to the recognition in the "Corporate Friends" listing.

The Art Deco Festival is an family friendly environment and welcomes people of all ages. During this weekend there will be a variety of FREE events to attend, this includes: Film Series, Lectures, Food Vendors, Musical attractions, a Fashion show, Theatrical performances, Dance Performances, Exhibits, Classic automobiles, and many more!

The Impact

The founders of Miami Design Preservation League wanted to create a festival that would attract people to Ocean Drive in order to bring attention to the gorgeous Art Deco buildings that live there. Now, millions have come to the district and Miami Beach enjoys some of the best preservation laws in the country. MDPL will host the 37th Art Deco Weekend with the same beautiful backdrop as the first Art Deco Weekend.
story_txt:
About Us

The Art Deco Festival was started in 1976 by the Miami Design Preservation League to attract visitors to Miami Beach's Art Deco Historic District and to raise awareness and appreciation of the arts and culture of the Art Deco Era (approx. 1925-1945). 
MDPL's success can be judged by taking a look at today's South Beach: the second most visited destination in Florida, attracting students and families, as well as models and celebrities, all drawn to Miami Beach for its natural beauty, rich diversity, and high quality of life. 
MDPL was the first Art Deco Society in the world. Back in 1970s South Beach, when MDPL's founder fought against all odd to save the Art Deco architecture from demolition, few could imagine the impact their activism would have on Miami Beach's future. MDPL continues to be a non-profit organization devoted to preserving, protecting and promoting the cultural, social, economic and environmental integrity of the Miami Beach Art Deco and throughout South Florida.


What We Need & What You Get
Our goal for this year is to raise $10,000, you can help us meet our goal by becoming either a individual friends contributor or a corporate friends contributor. No other event in South Florida celebrates the architecture, history and culture of Miami Beach like Art Deco Weekend. For over 36 years, festival attendees have enjoyed fun-filled weekend of films and fashion, live music and lectures, vendors and visuals, parades and preservation that celebrates the era in which those gorgeous buildings were built. With your contribution we will be able to have another success Art Deco Weekend! The donated money helps us create free community events and educational programing during our annual Art Deco Weekend Festival. It would not be possible without your support, we thank you in advance. 
If you become an Individual Friends contributor you will receive your name in the Art Deco Weekend 2014 Program Book. You will also receive an official Art Deco Weekend 2014 poster.
If you become a Corporate Friends contributor you will receive an autographed Art Deco Weekend 2014 poster and include a business card advertisement in the program, in addition to the recognition in the "Corporate Friends" listing.
The Art Deco Festival is an family friendly environment and welcomes people of all ages. During this weekend there will be a variety of FREE events to attend, this includes: Film Series, Lectures, Food Vendors, Musical attractions, a Fashion show, Theatrical performances, Dance Performances, Exhibits, Classic automobiles, and many more! 


The Impact
The founders of Miami Design Preservation League wanted to create a festival that would attract people to Ocean Drive in order to bring attention to the gorgeous Art Deco buildings that live there. Now, millions have come to the district and Miami Beach enjoys some of the best preservation laws in the country. MDPL will host the 37th Art Deco Weekend with the same beautiful backdrop as the first Art Deco Weekend.

story:
Aloha! 

We have returned to Maui as 5th place winners in the World Body Painting Festival...more updates and pictures soon! 

 

Behold, the Blacklight Wonder...

Aloha and welcome to the wonderful world of transformative body painting! Meet  Rachel Deboer, a visual artist involved in theater arts and body painting collectively for over 27 years. Over the past 11 years, Rachel has nurtured Maui's face and body painting community and started Next Level Theater Productions to share Polynesian culture in a blacklight theater medium. Rachel's next big goal is to bring her passionate team on a very special journey to the World Body Painting Festival in Austria to compete in the Fluoro (UV/black light) body paint category this summer.

15th Annual World Body Painting Festival       

The World Body Painting Festival in Austria is the mecca of body painting education, instruction and events and Rachel Deboer has been accepted as one of only 15 artists in the entire world to create a blacklight bodypaint performance for the UV world bodypainting competition. We have 3 minutes on the world stage to represent Maui and to present our unique vision of the theme (Inner Fears: Battling the Invisible) utilizing body paint, costuming, and props. 

This is the Olympics of body painting and the Fluoro division is one of the most interactive and intense categories; we are required go beyond body painting to create a visual spectacle. Theater and visual arts and black light body painting are the tools we use to make the private processes of human experience public. Using these tools of illusion, we present an exciting new level of reality. We take the ancient magic of storytelling and shine ultraviolet light onto our cast, props and costumes, creating memorable and transformative experiences for our audiences.

Body painting has been around as long as humans have been on this planet.

Our goal is to change and affect over 20,000 people on a global scale with our healing black light performance art vision for the future.

What We Need + What You Get = â¤

Our team consists of 4 members: two professional body painters, a performance artist, and a professional videographer/photographer to document the entire journey for inclusion in a body paint documentary film.

Although we have been invited to compete in this prestigious event, we are responsible for all costs associated with traveling to Austria to the World Body Painting Festival.  Check out the festival here: http://www.bodypainting-festival.com/en/general

Our costs for round trip airfare and lodging for four people to attend this esteemed championship in Europe require at least $16,000.  All funds raised go directly to physically transporting and housing our team during the 2 weeks needed for prep and festival week, not personal costs. We are deeply grateful for your consideration to help fund this art project.

We are excited to offer special artistic and custom perks for our supporters. Check them out! Special limited perks will be available during the campaign as well as exciting new media, photos, and updates on our progress.

Our Team of Artists

Rachel Deboer - Lead body painter

Melissa Bruck - Assistant body painter

Adelle Lennox - Performance artist

Nathan Stillmaker - Photographer & videographer

So many ways you can help!

Please spread the word about our body painting goals and journey to Austria.  Share this link with your circles of friends, family, and art patrons.  Together we can positively change the course of human destiny through arts and education.

Once you’ve made your donation, please help spread the word about our campaign.  Use the ‘share’ tools on IndieGoGo to tell others via Facebook, Twitter, etc.  Please also visit and SHARE our fundraising page, www.racheldeboerbodypainter.wordpress.com, which is also a great resource to get to know our team better!  We will be updating our supporters and community often so please chime in with comments.  We want to reach out to you! We love you, and thank you for sharing and promoting our project! 

â¤ MAHALO WITH LOVE FROM MAUI HAWAII â¤

We love you, and thank you for sharing and promoting our project!

story:
This year The Awakenings Project turns sixteen. Many of us in Awakenings who have been with it since the beginning have seen these years fly by.

  For sixteen years The Awakenings Project has had a singular intention: to support any person with a mental illness in his or her endeavor into the arts. Free-of-charge. For sixteen years The Awakenings Project has been crafting art shows and exhibits, ushering artists into other artistic venues, welcoming artists into our free art studio, publishing writers and poets in The Awakenings Review, hosting poetry slams, and now supporting musicians and playwrights. We’ve got a lot of bases to cover, and now we need your generous help to keep this essential work going.

  Finances have been a critical problem for us this year. We simply don’t have the revenue to accomplish the programs that need to be accomplished. Right now it looks like we may have to mothball The Awakenings Review, our critically acclaimed journal. We have hundreds of submissions but not enough money to publish it.

  Can you afford a donation to the Awakenings Project in the amount of $10, $25, $50, $100, or more? The Awakenings Project is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization — all donations are fully tax-deductible.

We’re counting on you.  This appeal is our most vital way to raise money.  We have a goal of raising $2,000 this campaign. Please help us make it!

  The Awakenings Project was founded by people with mental illnesses. We are all about people with mental illnesses. As you know, we are a stigmatized and under-served population. We serve hundreds of artists with mental illnesses and we bust stigma!

  We’re a volunteer organization, and our services are free.  Completely free. We have never charged for the use of our art studio. We have never charged an artist to join or be displayed in an art show. We have never charged a writer or poet to find a spot in The Awakenings Review. We don’t even have paid memberships!

  Therefore everything we do is and has been through donations from people like you. We’re counting on your generosity. We need your help.

There are exciting new developments at Awakenings. Drama is starting to get its feet off the ground.

Exciting things are happening in the realm of music, too. We are recording an Awakenings CD. It will feature original songs and poetry from over a dozen Awakenings artists. You can get your very own copy with any donation of $50 or over.

We have done a lot in sixteen years at The Awakenings Project but we have much more work to do. That’s where we need your help. Please dig deep. Donate all you can to The Awakenings Project. Whatever you give is tax deductible.

It’s our mission to support artists with mental illness in all the arts.  In 2013 and 2014 we’re moving in a strong way toward reaching that goal. But we need help.  Can you help? Please give to the Awakenings Project and know that you’ve given to a worthy organization that is making a difference in the lives of people with mental illnesses. Thank you so much for all your help.

story:
Summary

I'm Sophie, an artist working with and in response to the natural environment. I have been offered a place on an MA in Art and Environment in Falmouth and I very much want to take this next step in my creative journey. It will allow me to continue my artistic practice within a framework of guidance, to research and realise a project exploring the relationship between art and environment.

I believe a great potential exists in the interaction between art and environment. Environment relates to us all, it is what nourishes and sustains us, it is the air that we breathe and the water we drink. We are connected to and dependant upon our natural environment. Yet we are at a time of great concern, of imbalance. The destruction of natural environment resonates within us, loss of habitat echoes something of our own pain and loss. I want to look at creative ways of connecting and of understanding our connection to nature. I believe art has a role to play, creativity is the ability to imagine new ways, to visualise, art can respond and give voice to that which has no voice.

I want to particpate in this larger conversation about art's role in working for the environment. By supporting my work you will enable me to support myself and to progress with my artistic practice. Despite the difficulties I face in this quest, relocating myself with my two girls age 1 and 9, I see this as a great opportunity to contribute. When I question myself as to why take such a challenging path, the answer is clear: because I think that this is important and I am dedicated to this. I feel compelled to act, to do what I can, I have to respond. To carry out my work within the framework of this course will give me the opportunity to shine light on something that I became aware of, something that concerns me.

You can see and read more about my work so far here:

www.stwiss.net
www.stwiss.wordpress.com

Please help me to add my voice to this dialogue.

What I Need & What You Get

I have set my goal at £5000 and to raise this would be really amazing, it would allow me to take this next step with stability. My costs are:

  • The course fees which are £4995. 
  • Relocation and rent in Falmouth which looks to be about double what I currently pay (I'm looking into caravans as an alternative living arrangement but I'll get back to you on that...)
  • Nursery fees
  • Materials for the course

I do have some money saved and a part time job lined up in Falmouth. I will continue to work as an artist during the course selling what work I am able. I am also in the process of arranging a related work placement which will mean a reduction in the course fee.

What I am asking is that you support me by buying my work. I have been working as an artist for many years now and have a collection of drawings, paintings, prints and beautiful things that I offer you in return for your support. This is a like for like reciprocal arrangement, you support me by buying my work.

I am offering:

  • Original artwork, choose from the gallery here (tab at the top of this page). The work is arranged into three categories - Swallow, Owl and Ibis. The price includes shipping to anywhere you may be in the world. 
  • There are a limited amount of unique made especially for you artist books, mini kites and painted bird house gourds.
  • I can make you something special, a gift for the birth of a child, a birthday, anniversary, something special and unique commissioned for you. Choose a natural scenes or papercut or a drawing or painting. I will ask you to give me some starting point (we can communicate about this) and I will make something suitably special for you.
  • I also offer future artwork that I will create during the year I spend in Falmouth, either part of my final project or something else. It would be great to know that something special will come your way during the next year! 

Every perk will come with a special thank you surprise, the likes of which I don't know right now, it will be something handmade / hand drawn and suitably beautiful and special to convey the gratitude I feel for your support. 

And if I don't raise the whole amount please know that every little will help me along my way and that it is very much appreciated.

*The images in the gallery are original, when you select one of the perks let me know which image you would like and I will remove it from the gallery.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me to spread this campaign. 

I understand that not everyone can contribute but perhaps you can help in another way by telling your friends about it. There are links to share at the top of the page, I appreciate your efforts to spread this, the more people see it the more likely I am to get funding. 

Or perhaps you have some Falmouth tips for me?! I jump into the complete unknown and move far from my family and friends so any links or information is useful - got a spare caravan? need a house sitter / creative mind? know of a good nursery? or nice places in Cornwall? maybe you know a piano teacher who works in exchange for home cooked food and baked cakes? Really anything is useful, I appreciate any efforts to help me in this mission I undertake.

story:
Welcome to Dia De Muertos Singapore!

Dia De Muertos Singapore is an arts and music fiesta celebrating the Mexican holiday, Day of the Dead, in Singapore. The biggest of its kind in Asia, the event will feature art and music collaborations between leading Singaporean and Mexican artists and musicians as well as mouth watering Mexican food and drinks. 

We need your help to bring this project to life, to help in creating an event that is a platform to foster cross cultural music and art collaborations through the celebration of a festival celebrated on the other side of the world. 

We have spent months rallying a team of artists, musicians and volunteers across disciplines in Singapore to come together to make this event a reality. The whole intention is to exchange knowledge between the various different communities and cultures in Singapore and hopefully be the start of many many more successful collaborations and celebrations to come.

Dia De Muertos Singapore is a one day only event, November 7th 2015. Time: 7pm till late. Venue: Emily Hill, 11 Upper Wilkie Rd, Singapore 228120 

Admission is free so anyone and everyone will be able to join in the festivities.


Elements


Day of the Dead Altar

Day of the Dead altars are built during Dia de Muertos to honor the lives of those who have passed. They are often beautiful creations, constructed with love and care. Creating these altars is one of the most important traditions during Day of the Dead in Mexico.

As such, a whole section of the venue will be curated to look like a Day of the Dead altar, dedicated to iconic Mexican painter, Frida Kahlo featuring her interests, passion and other lifetime highlights. The Mexican community will be invited to contribute to this altar, providing a glimpse of this festivity to those not familiar with it as well as the life of international icon, Frida Kahlo.


Day of the Dead Artworks

Providing iconic Frida artworks as a base, local artists will be invited to reinterpret these pieces and this  will highlight a Singaporean take on a culture and be part of a festivity that’s celebrated on the other side of the world.

Artworks by:

  • Aeropalmics
  • Alicia Wee
  • Allison M Low
  • Arcadiainmayhem
  • Bettsy Garcia Montijo
  • Chris Chai
  • Christina Lourdes
  • Deonasaurus 
  • FraFraFrah
  • Lonerslugs
  • Marc Gabriel Loh
  • Mojoko
  • Moon Malek
  • NMA
  • Oak & Bindi


Music

Verano Peligroso (MX) x DJ K (SG), are a perfect example of a tried and tested cross continental collaboration effort birthed in Mexico City earlier in the year. They will headline the event and perform collaborative sets that will keep the crowd dancing and on their feet the entire night as they bring the distinct sounds of their cities together to create a brand new sound.


Food & Drinks

Mexican food and drinks loved by all will be sold outdoor street style like in Mexico  at this event, with various vendors lining the area, creating a festive bazaar atmosphere bring people from all walks of life together for this celebration.

Food and drinks will be available for purchase from 5pm till the end of event. 


Workshop

The Mexican Association of Singapore will be carrying out a workshop for children to teach them more about the celebration and to be part of it. These include making skull calaveritas out of cardboard, paper collage art and mask making.

This workshop is available for children from 5pm - 7pm at the event venue.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help in raising funds to defray costs of the event, including logistics, materials, equipment and token fees needed to pull off the show. 
 We don’t have much, but we have large amounts of gratitude and handmade and handwritten notes and tokens and the possibility of building a structure at the venue that would feature your names at the event to showcase our immense gratitude in helping us achieve our goal. 
In the event that we are unable to raise funds, we will have to unfortunately remove elements from the show and hold more fundraising events and efforts before and after the show to offset losses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to contribute, we completely understand, but please do come down and support the event!

If you do know of anyone who would be willing to contribute in any way, please do share this page with them. We appreciate every ounce of help.
