Moon Malek


NMA


Oak & Bindi



Music
Verano Peligroso (MX) x DJ K (SG), are a perfect example of a tried and
tested cross continental collaboration effort birthed in Mexico City earlier in the year. They will headline the event and perform
collaborative sets that will keep the crowd dancing and on their feet the
entire night as they bring the distinct sounds of their cities together to
create a brand new sound. 

Food & Drinks
Mexican food and
drinks loved by all will be sold outdoor street style like in Mexico  at this
event, with various vendors lining the area, creating a festive bazaar
atmosphere bring people from all walks of life together for this celebration. 
Food and drinks will be available for purchase from 5pm till the end of event. 
   

Workshop
The Mexican Association of Singapore will be carrying out a workshop for children to teach them more about the celebration and to be part of it. These include making skull calaveritas out of cardboard, paper collage art and mask making.
This workshop is available for children from 5pm - 7pm at the event venue.


What We Need & What You GetWe need your help in raising funds to defray costs of the event, including logistics, materials, equipment and token fees needed to pull off the show.  We don’t have much, but we have large amounts of gratitude and handmade and handwritten notes and tokens and the possibility of building a structure at the venue that would feature your names at the event to showcase our immense gratitude in helping us achieve our goal. In the event that we are unable to raise funds, we will have to unfortunately remove elements from the show and hold more fundraising events and efforts before and after the show to offset losses. 
    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you’re unable to contribute, we completely understand, but please do come down and support the event!If you do know of anyone who would be willing to contribute in any way, please do share this page with them. We appreciate every ounce of help.

story:
Hello, my name is Allison Wade, and I'm an artist and professor in New York City. Born and raised in Illinois and Iowa, and educated in New Mexico and upstate New York, I have a BFA in Photography, an MA in Education, and an MFA in Fine Arts. I am very fortunate to have ended up teaching at the Fashion Institute of Technology in NYC.

I recently received the best news! I was selected to attend the Vermont Studio Center Artist Residency Program this summer. But I need a little help to make this amazing opportunity possible. My campaign is to raise enough money to cover my tuition to attend this residency program in July. The opportunity to live and work in Vermont with 49 other artists and to be away from all the distraction of life in the city, focusing solely my artwork for four glorious weeks, will be extremely beneficial to my creative process and growth as an artist. And I'm not just thinking of my own development here. As an educator, it is extremely important to keep my own artistic practice flourishing, and in turn, share that energy with my students. A win for everyone!

I cannot express the magnitude of what your contributions, in any amount, will help me to achieve.

Please visitt http://www.vermontstudiocenter.org/ and allisonw.tv

 

What I Need & What You Get

Art is meant to be shared! So let me help you help me :)

I am trying to raise $3,100 to cover all tuition cost and any extra will go into art supplies such as canvas and paint. Tuition is $3,950 and $650 for painting supplies. I raised $1500 in part 1 of this canpaign!

Get excited because this campaign is a really great way to start collecting some artwork. With every contribution over $25, you will receive an original Allison Wade Photograph taken in Central Park (2012). The image captures a large soap bubble floating over the pond. The higher the contribution, the larger the photographic print you will receive.

All funds raised will go to the Vermont Studio Center for my residency.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the position to contribute, you can still help. Please get the word out about my campaign and make some noise. Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for taking the time to consider this request!

Allison

story:
*UPDATE*

Dear friends, family, and DOC NOW supporters:

It’s day 7 of our campaign and we’ve already reached our Indiegogo goal! We’re completely overwhelmed by your incredibly generous support, and we can’t thank all of you enough.

Even though we’ve hit the $5,000 mark, DOC NOW is a massive undertaking with a very large budget of over $25,000. Every extra contribution we receive will continue to help us on the road to realizing this festival.

If you’re able to help, please still do so knowing that we will put ALL the funds raised via Indiegogo to very good use for the festival.

Thanks again so much from all of us in the Documentary Media Program. We’re very excited to see you in the spring at DOC NOW!

What DOC NOW is (who we are, what we’re doing):

DOC NOW is a free multimedia festival developed and run by artists completing the Master of Fine Arts program in Documentary Media at Ryerson University. It showcases the first release of film, photography, and new media projects created over two years of intense focus and collaboration. This diverse group of artists has come together from Bosnia, Kenya, Sri Lanka, Egypt, Peru, Iran, Korea, the U.S., and across Canada to support and challenge each other’s work. The work appeals to an expansive audience through its diversity of topic and viewpoint, from the personal, social, economic, and political, to the metaphysical and philosophical.

The festival will take place in May and June 2014, offering free exhibitions at galleries across Toronto and screenings at the Bloor Hot Docs Cinema* and Ryerson Image Arts. This year marks the sixth annual DOC NOW, and we’d like to increase the festival’s public engagement by adding an outdoor site-specific screening and initiating a panel discussion series featuring acclaimed documentary filmmakers, photographers, and theorists.

(*Made possible by our sponsor Hot Docs Blue Ice!)

Why it’s important:

Documentary is integral to Canada’s artistic identity, and Toronto, as host to multiple festivals and industry groups, has claimed its identity as a documentary hub. DOC NOW is uniquely important because it is the only free multimedia artist-run documentary festival in Toronto. It is fundamental in providing a noncommercial space to introduce these innovative documentary works and an emerging generation of filmmakers, photographers, and visual artists concerned with representing reality.

Why we need help:

DOC NOW is organized and run by the artists themselves, and it is free to the public! This means the festival depends on our ability to raise funds. Contributions we receive will be directly applied to securing venues, producing promotional materials, and running the events, which are all essential to realizing this non-profit arts festival.

Please check out our funder’s incentives and consider contributing. You can also help us by spreading this fundraising page, telling everyone about DOC NOW 2014, and attending the festival in the spring!

The Documentary Media MFA Program:

Documentary has a rich history in Canada, and the Documentary Media MFA Program at Ryerson is the only graduate program devoted to documentary in the country. It attracts established and emerging artists from all over the world to study with acclaimed filmmakers and photographers, as well as scholars and historians in the field. Critically engaging with the history and contemporary landscape of documentary practice, students are empowered to create innovative work that challenges the boundaries of the documentary form.

If you're interested in becoming a major sponsor of this event or making an in-kind donation, please contact sponsorship@docnow.ca.

Participating Artists:

Saman Aghvami
Francesca Dasso
Jamie Day Fleck
Caitlin Durlak 
Simone Estrin
Zeinab Fattahi
Sarah Foy
Julie Gemuend
Liz Gibson-DeGroote 
David Henning 
Fraser Hogarth 
Jonas Jacobs
Thamilini Jothilingam 
Jordan Kawai 
Michael Kim 
Daniel Laurin 
Natalie Logan 
Nadia Marzouk
Nataša Nuhanović 
Emily Read 
Meghan Rennie 
Bindu Shah 
Alexena Weinstein

story:
My name is Dawn Bilyeu, and I am the owner and creator of Amberle Originals jewelry.

I started designing jewelry several years ago and found it to be something I truly have a passion for.  My family and friends have been my biggest supporters, and have encouraged me to keep designing and creating and to believe in myself.  I love working with colors and textures, and I delight in seeing people's faces light up when they see a piece they really like.  I have had several commission projects including a set for the mother of the bride, and matched jewelry sets for Christmas gifts and birthday presents.

THE CAMPAIGN

RAW: Natural born Artists (http://www.rawartists.org/) recently invited me to participate in their December Semi Final Event. This showcase is a single night event in Tulsa, Oklahoma where a selection of artists have the opportunity to showcase and sell their work without RAW taking any commission of the sales.

RAW is an independent arts organization, for artists, by artists, with a mission to provide independent artists within the first 10 years of their career with the tools, resources and exposure needed to inspire and cultivate creativity.

The Impact 

The RAW initiative is funded by ticket sales, so for artists to participate they have to commit to selling 20 tickets to the show and that's where you come in. By supporting this campaign you are making it possible for me to participate in the show. 

WHY $500?

To be in the show I have to sell 20 tickets or raise $300 in sponsorship, the remaining $200 will go towards framing for the artwork that'll be in the show.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR THE ARTIST?

RAW artists do not only get to join the showcase. They are also promoted on the RAW website, they receive a set of professional photos and a video with an interview to use for press releases after the show and also the opportunity to exhibit in one other US city later on.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My Project

My name is Claudia Gutierrez and I am a Latin-Canadian artist living and working Ottawa, Canada. I have been researching textiles and its history in Latin America for the past year and decided it was the right pivot for my practice. I applied to Arquetopia's residency program and was accepted!

At the residency, I will learn weaving techniques from fifth generation weaving masters. I will also be developing my personal body of work by translating forms and concepts I address in my paintings and prints into my woven works. By going to the capital of textiles in Mexico, I will submersed  in my heritage (coming from Mexican and Uruguayan parents) and bring back not only a practical skill but a part of my personal culture to share with my community in Ottawa, Canada. 

 

Why support my project?

While I am applying for grant funding for CARFAC artist per diums and travel expenses, this Indiegogo campaign will raise funds for the cost of the residency- including the instructional training and ancillary fees from Arquetopia. My goal is to raise $2,000 with your help. All you have to do it purchase some of my work!

By supporting this project you will receive the following:

$25 in support will receive a pack of Thank You cards created and illustrated by me

$50 in support will receive a pack of Thank You cards and an illustrated print by me

$100 in support will receive a pack of Thank you cards, illustrated print and a hand woven rug made by me (sized 24" x 36")

 

Long term goals

While developing my arts practice outside of my cultural work (ie my day job at the Ottawa Art Gallery) is the main goal for this project; I also hope this training will create opportunities for me to pass on what I have learned to my local community. In the spirit of promoting pluralism, I believe passing on the traditions and stories of my culture to my Canadian community will create a greater sense of connectivity and allow me to explore my place and role as first generation Canadian. 

 

Unable to support monetarily? No problem!

If you are unable to support with a pledge, your voice is an even greater help! Liking and/or sharing my campaign will be an enormous aid in making my project come to fruition. Even sending a message of encouragement means more than you know :) 

Other sharables:

Instagram: @claudialikesit

www.claudiagutierrezart.com

Thank you all! Gracias  a todos, habrazos!

story:
Who I am and what this is for

My name is Alex, I work full time in a print shop and and working on a degree in Anthropology at Wichita State. Evenings and weekends are consumed by art, its what I feel the days orient towards and support. I live with my fellow artist and girlfriend, Stacy Renee. 

This campaign is about soaking the costs of putting on an art show and its success means that the money from my day job can go towards food, rent, and other such necessities. With luck and studious development, campaigns like this can facilitate more ambitious endeavors.

Exactly what this show is and what you get for helping out

This is a digital show where I'll be producing high quality prints of my pieces as well as producing some video for the show and having food and drinks for the patrons who attend. This campaign is about funding my costs for putting on the show, none of this money goes to paying me. If this campaign falls short, I'll put up the remaining costs out of my pocket.

For helping to fund this show, there are a lot of rewards in store. At any perk level you get discounts on prints from the series and a thank you at the show and my website. Higher perks get free products like postcards and prints. Unfortunately, the perks that involve shipping can only be shipped within the United States.

    The philosophy behind the show and this campaign

    Insects are beautiful products of nature and far too many people see them as gross and don't take the time to look into the numerous wonders for which they are responsible. This show is about taking inspiration form the forms of insects, spiders, and the like and exploring them through an artists lens. The hope is that people who aren't into creepy crawlies will begin to see loveliness in them.
    This whole thing isn't just about easing the financial strain of putting on a show, but about getting people involved and providing rewards for doing so early. Its also about getting the word out there bit just about my personal ambitions but also about the importance of the subject matter. Insects and other such exoskeletal invertebrates are a vital part of any ecosystem and seeking greater understanding of our place in that will lead us into a brighter future.

    What will be on display at the show

    My plans for the show so far will be for 15 to 20 pieces, most of which will be 18x24". The prints will be available in glossy print or mounted on foam core boards. There'll also be some fun video weirdness too.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If this all seems worth the time, please share this campaign to anyone interested in art, ecology, bugs, or just looking to help someone realize their goals. Thanks so much for taking the time to take a deeper look into this endeavor.

      Twenty days left, here's a stretch!

      If we make the $700 goal , all contributors who claim the Shiny Ladybug perk and above will get a small coil bound artbook of the show. It will have the pieces from the show as well as the gallery space itself in addition to some production coverage.

story:
Soundwaves artist, Tim Wakefield, is relocating from the UK to the US, and has agreed to donate the profit from all of his remaining Soundwaves stock to his friends at the Bonnaroo Works Fund. Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival is the most amazing music and camping festival in North America, which takes place in Manchester, Tennessee. At the heart of Bonnaroo is a dedicated and caring philanthropic community. The Bonnaroo Works Fund, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, represents this charitable spirit and supports worthy causes nationally and regionally. 

In addition to these hand-signed prints by world famous artists from around the world, there will also be new, original Soundwaves Art pieces being added throughout the campaign. Be be sure to check back and see what is new!!

Somewhere near the top of our to-do list is “change the world.” So, in 2009, we created the Bonnaroo Works Fund, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. The Bonnaroo Works Fund supports regional and national organizations with a mission of making communities healthy in areas of the arts, education, and environmental sustainability; with the goal of local reinvestment and asset building for the communities where we live, work, and play.

We devote a lot of attention to middle Tennessee and, in particular, the Manchester and Coffee County communities. We support educational, arts and environmental programs as well as a variety of community projects. Since the inception of Bonnaroo, we have given back upward of $7 million to over 100 organizations. 

Visit http://www.bonnarooworksfund.org for more information and up to date news.

Tim is donating the profits from this amazing collection to The Bonnaroo Works Fund.

 Each piece will be accompanied by a letter of authenticity signed by the artist.

Tim has exhibited in cities all over the world from from Singapore to Los Angeles and worked with over 150 of the world's leading recording artists. 

As Tim's work becomes more collectable you will not only be helping a worthy cause in desperate need of your help but also be investing in a highly collectable piece of music history. At auction recently original pieces fetched in excess of $25,000.

Black Keys Singing in 2008

All of the images below represent the limited edition artwork you are purchasing. Every print has been hand signed by the musician and by Soundwaves artist, Tim Wakefield. These are not printed or facsimile signatures. Artwork will also be signed and numbered by Tim Wakefield. Limited Edition prints do not have the hand written lyrics which were only on the originals. 

Alice Cooper - School's Out (Black & Red)

Alice Cooper - School's Out (Black & Purple)

Brian Wilson - Good Vibrations and Love and Mercy (Black)

Brian Wilson - Good Vibrations and Love and Mercy (Blue)

Bee Gees - Staying Alive

Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Orange)

Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Green)

Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Black)

Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Blue)

Bon Jovi - Livin' on A Prayer 

Bryan Ferry - Slave to Love

Corinne Bailey Rae - Put Your Records On 

The Cure - Underneath the Stars

James Blunt - You're Beautiful

Jamie Cullum - Mind Trick (Black)

Jamie Cullum - Mind Trick (White)

Jamie Cullum - Mind Trick (Blue)

Joss Stone - Music 

Procol Harum - A Whiter Shade of Pale

Queen - Bohemium Rapsedy 

Stereophonics - Dekota (Red)

Stereophonics - Dekota (Orange)

Stereophonics - Dekota (Dark Red)

Stereophonics - Dekota (Black)

The Bonnaroo Works Fund, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, represents this charitable spirit and supports worthy causes nationally and regionally.  In addition to these hand-signed prints by world famous artists from around the world, there will also be new, original Soundwaves Art pieces being added throughout the campaign. Be be sure to check back and see what is new!! Somewhere near the top of our to-do list is “change the world.” So, in 2009, we created the Bonnaroo Works Fund, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. The Bonnaroo Works Fund supports regional and national organizations with a mission of making communities healthy in areas of the arts, education, and environmental sustainability; with the goal of local reinvestment and asset building for the communities where we live, work, and play.We devote a lot of attention to middle Tennessee and, in particular, the Manchester and Coffee County communities. We support educational, arts and environmental programs as well as a variety of community projects. Since the inception of Bonnaroo, we have given back upward of $7 million to over 100 organizations. Visit http://www.bonnarooworksfund.org for more information and up to date news.Tim is donating the profits from this amazing collection to The Bonnaroo Works Fund. Each piece will be accompanied by a letter of authenticity signed by the artist.Tim has exhibited in cities all over the world from from Singapore to Los Angeles and worked with over 150 of the world's leading recording artists. As Tim's work becomes more collectable you will not only be helping a worthy cause in desperate need of your help but also be investing in a highly collectable piece of music history. At auction recently original pieces fetched in excess of $25,000.Black Keys Singing in 2008All of the images below represent the limited edition artwork you are purchasing. Every print has been hand signed by the musician and by Soundwaves artist, Tim Wakefield. These are not printed or facsimile signatures. Artwork will also be signed and numbered by Tim Wakefield. Limited Edition prints do not have the hand written lyrics which were only on the originals. Alice Cooper - School's Out (Black & Red)Alice Cooper - School's Out (Black & Purple)Brian Wilson - Good Vibrations and Love and Mercy (Black)Brian Wilson - Good Vibrations and Love and Mercy (Blue)Bee Gees - Staying AliveBlack Keys - Just Got To Be (Orange)Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Green)Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Black)Black Keys - Just Got To Be (Blue)Bon Jovi - Livin' on A Prayer Bryan Ferry - Slave to LoveCorinne Bailey Rae - Put Your Records On The Cure - Underneath the StarsJames Blunt - You're BeautifulJamie Cullum - Mind Trick (Black)Jamie Cullum - Mind Trick (White)Jamie Cullum - Mind Trick (Blue)Joss Stone - Music Procol Harum - A Whiter Shade of PaleQueen - Bohemium Rapsedy Stereophonics - Dekota (Red)Stereophonics - Dekota (Orange)Stereophonics - Dekota (Dark Red)Stereophonics - Dekota (Black)

story:
(Update: PLEASE READ THE INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY AND SEND AN EMAIL BEFORE PAYING)

Lowlighter is going to NYC

I am going to be in New York starting this fall to study game design(!!!!), and I’m hoping to help my family out in any way in terms of costs. So, since I’ve been asked once or twice about it, I’ve decided to raise some funds by doing a few commissions for the summer. Thank you, in advance for any support!! <3

You can check out examples of my drawings here

Rules for Commissions

  • Animals count as characters.
  • As long as I can draw it, I will.
  • BUT NO BACKGROUNDS, BECAUSE I CAN'T
  • The HQ file is yours for personal use only.

Instructions

  • First and foremost, email me at sept.hodge@gmail.com with your request. After I confirm your request, you can contribute to this indiegogo campaign using your tumblr handle or preferred name, and I will get started on your commission.

Thank you!

If you have any questions about anything or further requests please email me at sept.hodge@gmail.com

Also, I am a little swamped right now so please be patient! Thank you!

story:
Thanks for stopping by

A little bit about me and the Project 

My name is Miriam Syowia Kyambi I’m a visual artist living and working in Nairobi.
In this work, I explore new paradigms for interdisciplinary collaboration by working with artist and choreographer James Mweu and dancers from the Kunja Dance Theatre to stage a choreographed live performance, creating material that examines contemporary viewpoints on themes that are central
to my practice: the body, gender issues and social perception.

What We Need

I have sourced 220,000 Kenya Shillings funds and need a remaining 250,000 Kenya Shillings. All funds go towards three main sections. 

  • Assisting the exhibition workshop sessions for youth groups, artists, general public and collectives the performers choose to work with such
    as ‘touch and glow’ based in Lunga Lunga estate. 

  • The set up for the live performance, including, mirrors, dresser, various costumes and shoes, floor mats, etc.

  • The documenting of the work, film and digital stills format to be able to further share with artistic community and contribute towards audience building in theimmediate future. 

          

          

Why I am doing this

In East Africa artists are in an environment with limited support and exploration in the discipline of live art and installation work. The idea of supporting a non-tangible creative experience is still a far-fetched ideal. 

Artist often pigeon hole themselves and create works for commercial value only, understandably so when having to make a living in this type of artistic conditions. 

This project will provide encouragement to think and fabricate outside of the box, it will build wider audience and hopefully encourage others to explore alternative exhibition platforms, methods of self-expression and the importance in freedom within creative platforms.

The workshops give participants first hand experience in the creative process behind installation and live art works. This will further encourage creative’s to look at alternative material and approaches in their environment. 

Please spread the word about the LIVE PERFORMANCE on 

5th July 2014, 5:30pm at the GoDown Art Centre, Nairobi.

And the Exhibition that will run from 14.06 - 19.07 2014


If you have full length mirrors, wooden washing pegs, kitsch chase sofa, stockings, high heels, underwear and undergarments/lingerie, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Check out the perks to learn how you can own one of these images and get  free tickets to the LIVE EVENT.

Share...

You can also support this campaign by helping us spread the word! Here are a few more ways you can help us succeed.

  • Click that "Share" button and post our campaign to your social pages!
  • Send our campaign page to your friends using the email link!
  • Have a blog? Please consider mentioning us in a post!

We Thank you for your Support.

story:
Hosted at various locations around NYC, this multi-disciplinary festival of Haitian art & culture will showcase the diversity, beauty and vitality of Haiti and its Diaspora – from the traditional to the contemporary.

Selebrasyon! will be the first of its kind in New York.

By partnering with different community groups, HCX is working to make this an accessible, dynamic festival that seeks to highlight the dynamic presence of Haitians in New York and build awareness, appreciation and conversation around the Haiti of NOW.  

Beginning on Haitian Flag Day on May 18th during Haitian Heritage Month, and running until the end of June which is Caribbean-American Heritage Month, Selebrasyon! will present events hosted in collaboration with different organizations, institutions and artists, such as:

  • Haitian Flag Day Selebrasyon!
  • An n’ Pale | Café Conversation with Mimerose “Manzè” Beaubrun followed by a LIVE performance with Boukman Eksperyans
  • La Rèn Solèy | U.S. Film Premiere, Panel Discussion & Live Musical Tribute to Martha Jean-Claude, Toto Bissainthe and Lumane Casimir
See these and more event details below.


We are seeking your support to make Selebrasyon! a festival to remember. 

We are looking to our community to help us meet a fundraising goal of $7,500. Funds raised will directly support our programming efforts and help make Selebrasyon! a landmark festival in New York City’s summer scene.

Our perks for giving include exclusive access to special Selebrasyon! events and hand-made totes and prints!


Buyu Ambroise • Alice Backer • Sabine Blaizin • Manolia Charlotin • Edwidge Danticat
Jeffrey Dessources •  Joel Dreyfuss • Ayinde Jean-Baptiste • Carine Jocelyn
Lorraine Mangones • Michèle Voltaire Marcelin • Jerry Philogene • Anthonine Pierre
Sam Pierre • Barbara Prezeau • Rose Pierre-Louis • Elsie Saint-Louis
Jessica St. Vil-Ulysse • Etienne Télémaque • Frantz Voltaire

There are so many ways to get involved in Selebrasyon!

Support the campaign by:

  • Donating today!
  • Volunteering on the Selebrasyon! outreach or program team
  • SPREADING THE WORD! The is YOUR festival! Let your friends know it! Share, tweet, and forward the Selebrasyon! campaign to your network.

    • #Selebrasyon #HCX

    Selebrasyon! Opening Night
    Saturday, May 17
    FiveMyles Gallery | 558 St Johns Place | Brooklyn, NY 11238

    Join us for a special evening of support for Selebrasyon! featuring performances by Brown Rice Family and poet Michèle Voltaire Marcelin, an art installation unveiling by Engels, a culinary demonstration and hors d'oeuvres, a special kick off toast, exclusive raffle prizes, and more…

    Haitian Flag Day Selebrasyon!
    Sunday, May 18
    Parkside Plaza | Ocean Ave & Parkside Ave on Prospect Park | Brooklyn, NY 11225

    A free outdoor celebration of Haitian culture with live music, traditional drumming, crafts, food, and dance workshops with CUMBE. Music by DJ Sabine Blaizin, Jocelyn Dorisme, and Nadïne LaFond. With co-hosts Rodneyse Bichotte, 42nd Assembly NY State Committeewoman & District Leader, poet Mr Jeff Dess, Elsie Saint-Louis of HAUP, and Carine Jocelyn of Diaspora Community Services.

    An n’ Pale | Café Conversation with Haiti-based singer & author Mimerose “Manzè” Beaubrun
    Friday, May 23
    FiveMyles Gallery | 558 St Johns Place | Brooklyn, NY 11238

    Join us for a conversation with Manzè Beaubrun, lead singer and co-founder of Boukman Eksperyans, about her new book Nan Domi: An Initiate’s Journey into Haitian Vodou, followed by a performance with Boukman Eksperyans.

    Lacaye HCX @ BAM | DanceAfrica
    Saturday, May 24
    La Caye Restaurant | 35 Lafayette Avenue | Brooklyn, NY 11217

    HCX and La Caye Restaurant team up at DanceAfrica for a special day of community fun with live music, Phoenix Refined (NYC’s 1st Haitian masquerade camp), and drink specials!

    La Rèn Solèy | U.S. Film Premiere, Panel Discussion & Live Musical Tribute to Martha Jean-Claude, Toto Bissainthe and Lumane Casimir
    Saturday, May 31
    ShapeShifter Lab | 18 Whitwell Place | Brooklyn, NY 11215

    The premiere screening of La Rèn Solèy, a film by Frantz Voltaire & Nitze Mathelier will include a post-screening discussion and live tribute performance with special female guest vocalists Riva Nyri Precil & Felina Backer accompanied by Buyu Ambroise & the Blues in Red Band.

    Vizaj Nou | U.S. Film Premiere
    Tuesday, June 3
    Kombit Restaurant | 279 Flatbush Ave | Brooklyn, NY 11217

    This documentary series by the talented actor & producer Gessica Généus cameos infamous Haitian artists Anthony Pascal (Konpè Filo), Viviane Gauthier, Odette Roy Fombrun, and Frankétienne with intimate conversations about their personal and creative lives.

    Lirik Ayiti: Rasin/Chimen
    Lyric Haiti: Roots/Routes
    Sunday, June 8
    Bowery Poetry Club | 308 Bowery | New York, NY 10012

    Join us for a night of spoken word where writers, poets, and artists come together to share Haitian stories and poems about their New York Haitian-American experiences.

    Creativity Unleashed | Istwa Djakout Mwen (The History of My Djakout)
    Saturday, June 14
    FiveMyles Gallery | 558 St Johns Place | Brooklyn, NY 11238

    Creativity Unleashed will offer individuals hands-on workshops led by Haitian and Haitian-American artists. As part of the festival, HCX initiated the Selebrasyon!Community Curated Project.HCX Advisory committee has proudly selects Gracie Xavier's workshop Istwa Djakout Mwen. In honor of Haitian Heritage Month, Istwa Djakout Mwen and Collage Workshop will utilize found objects and collage to help participants share stories of their immigrant experience to the United States.

    Atis Angaje Forum
    Wednesday, June 11
    Brecht Forum | 388 Atlantic Avenue | Brooklyn, NY 11217

    Artists of the "Atis Angaje" movement will discuss their experiences and political work during the Duvalier regime.

    Taste of La Caye
    Tuesday, June 17
    La Caye Restaurant | 35 Lafayette Avenue | Brooklyn, NY 11217

    Enjoy a special tasting menu with La Caye Restaurant's new Executive Chef Pierre Fervil.

    Mutation X062 | Installation & performance by Haiti-based artist Maksaens Denis
    Friday, June 20
    FiveMyles Gallery | 558 St Johns Place | Brooklyn, NY 11238

    Experimental digital and performance artist, Maksaens Denis will perform Mutation X0, and discuss his career while sharing his digital media technique.

    Krik? Krak! Storytelling & Songs
    Saturday, June 21
    Brooklyn Children's Museum | 145 Brooklyn Ave | Brooklyn, New York 11213

    This free family program is sure to entertain kids as well as their parents with classic Haitian tales. Storytelling will be led by Haitian authors, performers and musicians whose dramatic retellings will incite a love of Haitian myth and color children’s dreams with wonder.

    Selebrasyon! Installation Exhibition by Engels
    Saturday, May 17 – June 30
    FiveMyles Gallery | 558 St Johns Place | Brooklyn, NY 11238

    HCX commissioned an original installation piece to be mounted in front of our cooperative space in collaboration with FiveMyles Gallery. The piece will be on view through the duration of the festival.

    HCX | Open Studios Tour
    Sundays from May 25 - June 22
    Various Locations

    View new works and pieces by visiting the creative studios of Haitian and Haitian-American artists for an intimate opportunity to discuss their career, style, and inspiration. Confirmed artists include Francks Deceus, Shakespeare Guirand, and Sophia Domeville.

    #Selebrasyon

    Photo credit: Richard Louissaint & Tequila Minsky

story:
Low Show

Love Hate Los Angeles presents its fourth show in a series of 'open to all' public art shows.  The theme for this show is LOW.  I encourage all artists to get low- physically, emotionally, spiritually, low brow, etc.  Why?  Because there's no where to go from your lowest point but up.

  • Love/Hate Los Angeles' mission is to provide an opportunity for all to create and display artwork regardless of background and profession.
  • This campaign is to raise money to put on The Low Show.  Any extra funds will go towards future shows.
  • By contributing to this show you'll be participating in a truly democratic and professional community art project.  

$6500 is the goal

  • Almost half the money goes to the venue.  I'm so lucky to have Darring Studios available as a host for these shows and wouldn't be able to continue without them.
  • $1500 will go towards walls and hanging materials.
  • $1000 will go towards promotional materials and this indiegogo campaign.
  • $1000 will go towards hiring a gallery sitter, hors d'oeuvres, paying the band, and a few bucks for a cushion in case unforeseen expenses arise.
  • If I don't reach my goal the show will still go on with whatever funds that have been raised.

The Impact

These shows give everyone an opportunity to express themselves creatively regardless of their profession. 

  • Some folks bake for a hobby or play an insturment and I curate art shows.
  • These shows give me an opportunity to not only create large instillation pieces but also allow me to cultivate, curate, and install artwork from the community.
  • This is my fourth show, the first was a group show with the theme Love/Hate Los Angeles, second was Its Already Been Done and the last was a solo show by artist Bill Green.  These three shows were very successful and brought countless joy to all involved. Please check out lovehatelosangeles.tumblr.com to take a look at what has been shown in the past.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't contribute? No worries you can still help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Come join us! The show runs from May 23, 2014- June 1st at Darring Studios 4440 York Blvd, Los Angeles CA, 90041.
  • Contact lovehatelosangeles@gmail.com for questions or concerns.

story:
About

            My name is Jeffrey Sincich.  I have just graduated from the University of Florida with a BFA in Ceramics.  Choosing to study art has been one of the best decisions I have ever made.  I have found myself in some extraordinary situations because of it and could not be happier!  Alongside art is my passion for cycling.  I began cycling in high school by being introduced to track bikes and alleycats.  This love has spread to bicycle touring.  My love for art and cycling has culminated in an amazing opportunity: a three-week long bicycle tour from Portland, OR to San Francisco, CA to research tourism and the Great American West Coast for my future artwork starting on June 18.  I was awarded a Regina Brown Undergraduate Fellowship through the National Council on Education for the Ceramic Arts (NCECA) to help fund and complete this tour (alongside my longtime, best friend Derek).  As fantastic as this may be, I still need a little more help to make this dream a reality.  This is where you come in!

 

 What I Need

            To make this tour happen I am going to need another $800 from generous supporters like you.  As I am sure you already know, a recent graduate from college is the perfect storm of running out of money.  Things like travel expenses, cycling specific clothing/gear and the cold, wet Pacific Northwest weather, which requires specific camping gear, adds up quick.  I also plan to keep a blog throughout the duration of the trip so my friends, family and contributors like you can follow Derek and me along our journey.  Of course, this requires a lightweight, technological option, such as a tablet (i.e. iPad or similar device).  It is important for me that I can share this amazing experience with as many people as possible.

 

What You Get

            To make it easier for you to help me, I have added some great perks!  For just $10 you will be getting a personal postcard sent to you from somewhere awesome on our bike tour!  For $50 you will not only be getting a postcard, but a unique, never before seen to you (I hope!) souvenir or artifact from somewhere on the tour!  WOW!  This could include a trolley car bobble head from San Francisco or a giant pinecone from the Redwood Forest.  Imagine the possibilities…   Are you ready for this?  For $100 you will be receiving a postcard AND a handmade, by me, ceramic cup with a drawing inspired by the tour on it!!!  WHOA, BUDDY!  Imagine drinking out of a cup every morning/afternoon/night that was made especially for you!  If just one of these is not enough for you, which I can totally understand, for $200, you will receive a postcard, a handmade, ceramic cup and a souvenir!  Talk about the ultimate gift package!  And of course, I will appreciate everything and anything you can contribute, from $1 to $1000. 

 

 The Impact

            This tour is meant to help me explore the things that inspire my work the most.  My desire to travel, continue cultural traditions such as folklore and folk music and appreciate the land that we have in the good ol’ United States is what drives me to make the work that I do.  Bicycle touring is a unique form of tourism, with little environmental impact, time to smell the roses (literally) and a chance to interact with the local communities in a way that almost no other form of tourism provides.  On this trip, I plan to see the sights and sounds that attract others and me to the Mighty West Coast and translate this into my artwork, which can be seen at www.jeffreysincich.com.

            I hope that you can help me with this endeavor, whether it is through contributing what you can monetarily or by sharing this link on Facebook, email, word of mouth, Twitter or anything else you can think of.  Thank you for your time and I hope you follow my blog of the trip through my website!

story:
--- ENGLISH VERSION BELOW ---


Met alle donaties erbij die we direct op onze rekening hebben gehad staan we nu rond de 700 euro, we hebben nog zo een 300 euro nodig. Jij kan het verschil maken :)

DAT VERDIENT EEN BEELD

Nijmegen krijgt dit jaar tijdens de 4 daagse (16-19 juli) een multimedia standbeeld voor de '4 daagse wandelaar'. Een levend standbeeld met ingebouwde display, vertoont unieke beelden van wandelaars eerder die dag. Het beeld zal elke dag langs de route te vinden zijn.
 
Initiatiefneemster Ellen Mulders gaat het beeld ontwerpen: 'Elke dag 40 of 50 kilometer, zo een formidabele prestatie verdient gewoon een beeld'. Ellen, zelf voormalig Nederlands Kampioen Living Statue: 'De uitdaging is een beeld te ontwerpen, waarin de wandelaars zichzelf herkennen. Een levende verbeelding van de prestatie die zij neerzetten.'

Mede-initiatiefnemer Richard Schut van de 4 daagse filmcrew: 'Met de 4 daagse filmcrew, een groep van regionale en internationale filmmakers, maken we bijzondere reports en korte films tijdens de 4 daagse. Op de display van het standbeeld vertonen we korte interviews met deelnemers van eerder die dag. Het beeld komt dus letterlijk tot leven door de verhalen van de deelnemers.'

Wat hebben we nodig

Bij het maken van het beeld lopen we vooral tegen de materiaalkosten aan: speciale verf, de tablets die ingebouwd gaan worden. Daarnaast hebben we extra hardware/software nodig om het beeld zo snel mogelijk op de display te krijgen. We schatten al deze kosten bij mekaar op 1000 euro.

Wil je ons financieel steunen?

Iedereen de 4 daagse wandelaars op deze mooie manier wil 'eren' kan een kleine of grote bijdrage in de materiaalkosten doneren. Met jouw financiele steun kunnen we dit project echt mooi uitvoeren! In ruil voor jouw bijdrage hebben we verschillende 'bedankjes' bedacht. Kies hiernaast welke bijdrage het best bij jou past.

PS: heb je geen PayPal of creditcard?, dan kan je je bijdrage rechtstreeks storten op reknr 0120568322 tnv. Dat verdient een, Nijmegen. Stuur meteen een mailtje naar ikdoemee@datverdienteenbeeld.nl zodat we je emailadres hebben voor het bedankje!

Achtergrond info

De site van de ontwerpster van het beeld, Ellen Mulders, vind je op www.ellenprodukties.nl

Meer info over de 4 daagse filmcrew op www.facebook.com/4daagsefilmcrew

-- ENGLISH VERSION --

'That deservers a statue/image'

In Dutch the word 'beeld' means both 'statue' and 'image'. During the international 4 day marches in Nijmegen (16th-19th july) we like to honor all particpating marchers with a special multimedia statue. Our living statue will have a built in display showing images from the marchers earlier that day. The statue will be situated all marching-days at the route.

Initiator Ellen Mulders, former dutch champion living statue, will design the statue. 'Walking every day for 40 or 50 kilometer, that is an special achievement, that deserves a statue!'.

Co-initiator Richard Schut, of the 4 daagse filmcrew: 'on the built-in displays we will show short interviews from earlier that day, the statue will literally comes alive through the stories of the participants'.

What do we need

Mostly we need materials to build the statue: like special paint and tablets for the displays. We also need some additional hardware/software to get the images as soon as possible on the displays of the statue. We estimate 1000 euro for material costs.

Wanna support us financially?

Everyone who likes to 'honor' the participants of the 4 daagse in Nijmegen can make a small or bigger donation. With your financial support we can make this beautiful statue come alive!. To thank you for your support we gathered some great perks. Choose on the right the contribution that fits you most.

Background

Visit the site of the statue designer, Ellen Mulders, at www.ellenprodukties.nl

More info about the 4 daagse filmcrew at www.facebook.com/4daagsefilmcrew

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Mickie and I like to make things for people.

I've been designing, drawing, and creating my entire life. Additionally, I've always been a bit of a social butterfly and party girl. I've managed to bring those aspects of my life together through event design, planning, and production for private functions, corporate events, award shows, and fundraisers.

I am always the first to volunteer to help make a friend's event special through decor, fancy paper hats, and invitations. My love of creating for events has inspired me to launch an Etsy store dedicated to paper products for special occasions.

Your contribution will help me purchase a Silhouette CAMEO machine. The Cameo connects to my computer and cuts shapes and artwork I have created. I can design 3D products, ornate designs cut from paper or adhesive vinyl that I have drawn into Adobe Illustrator. This machine will enable me to create my own custom look and shapes. Additional funds will go to acquiring extra blades, cutting mats, paper, cover stock, and adhesives.

I am SO EXCITED to add this tool to my repertoire of creation!

What We Need & What You Get

My Wish List:

Silhouette Cameo: $299
Extra Blades: 3 @ $12.99 = 38.97
Extra Mats: 2 @ $19.99 = 59.97
Vinyl Starter Kit: $39.99
8.5x11 Colored Paper 10 Pack: 20 @ $2.50 = 50
8.5x11 Colored Cover Stock 10 Pack: 20 @ $3.75 = 75
A6 Colored Envelopes 10 Pack: 20 @ $3.50 = 70
A2 Colored Envelopes 10 Pack: 20 @ $3.25 = 65

Even if I don't reach my goal, any funds raised will be prioritized towards the purchase of the Silhouette CAMEO and tools.

RECEIVE MY VERY FIRST DESIGNS!
Contributors will receive custom designs as a thank you!

The Impact

In the past year, I have designed invitations for weddings and bar mitzvahs, I have decorated wedding showers and receptions, I created paper fascinators for a bachelorette party, and I won Best Informal Hat at the 139th Kentucky Derby party at The Bell House.

I want to keep the momentum going!
(I'd also love to be the reigning hat champion next year!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Use IndieGoGo's share tools to help connect your friends, family, and colleagues to this campaign. I appreciate all of your support, so much!

I'm excited to have you be a part of my next big adventure!

story:
OUR MISSION

The Museum of Neon Art (MONA) encourages learning, curiosity and expression through the preservation, collection and interpretation of neon, electric and kinetic art.

MONA has been a non-profit art museum in Los Angeles since our founding in 1981. Now in our 32nd year and only 18 months away from moving into our permanent, new home in the City of Glendale, we are focused on restoring some of the most challenging signs in the collection to display in the new facility.

THE STORY

In 2001 MONA and another museum were each set to receive one of the two neon dragon marquees upon their removal from the landmark Grauman’s Chinese Theater in Hollywood. For 43 years these iconic neon dragons graced the marquee with their glowing presence, entertaining visitors with their animation and illuminating a long list of well-known Hollywood movie premieres and celebrities.

However, when their take-down day arrived, word came that the owners had changed their minds, rescinded their donation and decided instead to keep the dragon signs for themselves in an outdoor storage yard.

Letters were written and a petition was signed by those who were concerned about the signs’ future. Yet nothing changed the minds of the signs’ owners to return to their original agreement and donate the dragons to MONA.

Although the marquees were in perfect, working condition when they were removed from the Chinese Theater, neglect took a heavy toll. The signs remained in a destructive limbo for six years with no maintenance, no protection from the elements or from souvenir hunters. After these many years, the dragons’ owners concluded the signs were unsalvageable and orders were given to remove them to a dump.

Like magic, the Neon Gods were watching over that landmark sign and word found its way to us that another attempt must be made to rescue those neon dragons or lose them forever.

In 2007, MONA finally came into possession of the neon dragons and immediately placed them in a protective indoor warehouse. Still, the damage had been done by the previous owner’s haphazard storage and neglect.

Today, MONA has retained the West-facing dragon and gifted the East-facing one to another local non-profit institution. With the opening of MONA’s new museum just around the corner, the restored dragon will have a new home in the public eye, greeting museum visitors.

To make that happen, we’re asking for your help in restoring the Chinese Theater’s dragon to its animated and glowing glory!

The task is a big one… but with your contribution, it will be done!


WHAT WE NEED TO DO

PHASE ONE:

  • Clean out decades of gunk both on the inside and outside of each 20’ section of the 40’ long dragon.
  • Restore and replace badly rusted and weak portions of the sign with new metal and reshape areas that had been damaged in haphazard storage condition.
  • Make paper pattern of the hand-painted design by working with the existing painted surface as well as photographically research its original paint scheme.
  • Remove as much of the existing surface paint as possible to smooth and prepare the dragons for new paint.
  • Prime the metal surface to prepare for the final painting.
  • Paint the dragon!

PHASE TWO:

  • Make paper patterns for the glass neon units.
  • Purchase the glass tubing and engage a skilled neon bender to fabricate and process the glass units....all 65 of them!  (Through research and by enlarging old photos and postcards of the Grauman's Chinese Theater, we have determined the original neon-tube colors that graced the dragon.)

PHASE THREE:

  • Recreate the exact animated sequencing. (The 1974 Mel Brooks classic "Blazing Saddles" will be used to view the animation of the neon tubing on the dragon and will help our restorers recreate the sequencing.)
  • Purchase neon supplies for installing the neon tubing, including transformers, animators and GTO wire.
  • Wire electricals and install all of the above.
  • Build a metal framework with wheels to support the dragon for exhibition.


COST BREAKDOWN
Approximately 20% of total goal will cover production of perks, mailing costs and fees. 80% of total goal will fund the three phases listed above. Additional donations, if any, will be spent on our ongoing restoration projects.

IMPACT
Your donation will help us to relight an icon of neon, Hollywood and theater architectural history! No other pictorial marquee of this scale, magnitude and importance has survived once it was removed from the original theater on which it stood. Help us relight the Chinese Theater dragon; make a donation today!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help! Share our website, our Facebook page, or use Indiegogo’s share tools on this page to help us get the word out! Word-of-mouth is one of the most powerful forms of support! We truly appreciate you for reading our story!  THANK YOU! 

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

WHAT YOU GET
$10  Virtual Dragon:  Image design by Kurt Wahlner for your computer dekstop!

$25  Mark the Dragon:  A bookmark!

$50  Magnify the Dragon:  Lenticular postcard showing the Dragon neon lit at night and unlit in daylight.

                             

$150  Wear the Dragon:  Black t-shirt with stunning and bold image of the dragon.

                  

$250  Attract the Dragon:  Laser-cut refrigerator magnet with a digital illustration by Endangered Architecture of Tucson.

$500  Capture the Dragon:  Limited edition giclee print by Tom Zimmerman Photography.

$1000  Walk the Dragon:  In addition to a walking tour of the Grauman Chinese Theater, you get a set of 4 customized magnets with your name on the marquee!

$5000  Time the Dragon:  MONA's very own neon clock by Curtis Clocks!

                              


$10,000  Ride the Dragon:  Your name acknowledged on metal plaque affixed to top of the sign. (Limited to 2 names per donation).

$500  Capture the Dragon:  Limited edition giclee print by Tom Zimmerman Photography.
$1000  Walk the Dragon:  In addition to a walking tour of the Grauman Chinese Theater, you get a set of 4 customized magnets with your name on the marquee!


$5000  Time the Dragon:  MONA's very own neon clock by Curtis Clocks!


                               

$10,000  Ride the Dragon:  Your name acknowledged on metal plaque affixed to top of the sign. (Limited to 2 names per donation).

story:
Hi everyone! I am a young art student who partnered up with my like-minded friend, and together, we are launching a new philanthropy/art organization called Creations for Concord. We currently have around 10 other like-minded people on board and we would love for you to hear our goal and advocacy out.


Our goal is to raise money for the maintenance of safety and tranquility in regions of the world currently ravaged by violence or danger. While many other non-profit organizations may share that dream, we aim to raise money for these causes differently. Proceeds to several different charities will be raised through our site through the creation, dissemination, and sale of creative works of art, music, photography, etc. that the Creators onboard at our site make; in other words, we also serve to be a community for anybody involved in a creative or fine arts discipline. Donors/customers can buy a “Creation for Concord” (CC), which can be either a print (based on a photo, drawing, or painting), a design (which can be featured on a t-shirt, mug, or website), or a song.



How will the charity system work?

We additionally pride ourselves in our coverage of philanthropy: one of our main tenets is to stay on top of the going-on’s in the world and acknowledge crises both widely covered and under-reported in the mainstream media. As of now, we are looking into several charities that support those affected in the Israel/Gaza conflict, Ukraine, Iraq, Thailand, Central African Republic, Venezuela, Thailand and in other locations that dearly need humanitarian assistance. Such charities include OCHA, Children for Peace, Chamos, Doctors Without Borders, and Hand in Hand for Syria. For the time being, we aim to hit the ground running with 5 charities. While initial charities are chosen by us, from there everything is decided by the community. Constant polling will decide what charities we covered: every month, the 3 out of 5 charities we cover that receive the biggest support or are determined to need the most long-term relief will we continued and the 2 charities that are phased out will be similarly replaced by the 2 most charities that people want to see covered on the site. However, it is important to note NONE of this is set in stone. Not only may an unexpected pressing issue be added to our charity coverage, we may also increase the number of charities we cover as we expand.

Stretch Goal: Barring administrative problems, we are considering adding an additional initial charity for every $200 we receive past our goal!


    How will the "Creations" system work?

    The theme of free choice playing a large role where proceeds are going makes us unique. Our site is grounded in an “Affiliation” system that we believe raises the autonomy and stakes involved in our proceed raising. For each individual work, Creators have a choice to make the work Affiliated or Unaffiliated. When a work is Affiliated, The Creator has a direct choice of what charity/cause ALL of the revenue for the CC goes to. For example, an artist can choose for all the revenue of a painting made to go to alleviating the Syrian crisis. This allows artists to voice their own opinions and pledge support for one cause directly through their work. Additionally, donors interested in a certain cause will be naturally drawn to an artist's work should it be affiliated to their advocacy with the knowledge that all their money and all the revenue raised by that work will go to the cause they support. However, if a work is Unaffiliated, there are two choices. An artist can take the “Liberté” route, in that any person buying the work can choose whatever charity partnered with “Creations for Concord” for their money to go to. While every purchasing option we offer gives donors a large degree of control over where their money is going, this option gives interested donors the most freedom. However, an artist can also take the “Démocratie” route, where all the money that is used to buy the unaffiliated painting will be given to the winning charity of a monthly poll held at the front page. This fosters a great sense of community decision-making and makes your participation in the polls all the more important. The poll will feature all covered charities for the first two weeks of every month. After the two weeks, only the two most popular charities will remain in the poll. For the rest of the month, those two charities will remain in the poll, and the more popular of the two will receive the earnings at the end of the month.


    What about Creators themselves?

    Creators receive 10% of earnings for every CC they sell, while 90% goes to charity. If you would like to become a creator or help with our project, feel free to contact us and send in some of your work/experience; we eagerly welcome anybody interested on board and we would love to have more artists, designers, and musicians join our budding community.


    Where will the money go?

    All raised funds will go towards website maintenance/upgrades, initial shipping/handling/printing (which can get expensive for large prints), and art supplies for creators who need them,  We may also offset payments to creators with raised funds - which means even more can go to charity!
    Math: Based on references (links below), prints will cost anywhere from $5 to $60+ depending on size and paper type. For simplicity, let's say $30 is the average price of a print (actual price of a 16x20 or 20x20 matte print), and bump it down to $25 for a bulk discount. Shipping in the continental US will average about $10 each purchase, according to the USPS. Therefore, each purchase will cost approximately $35 on our part. With $1,500, we could print and ship out around 42 creations. Given if around 2-3 purchases occur every week, we could eliminate all customer shipping, handling, and printing fees for the rest of the year!
    http://www.fineprintimaging.com/express/express_fine_art.htm
    http://www.skink-ink.com/

    What about Perks?

    $5 or more - You get a shout-out on our website!

    $25 - I will pencil-draw anything you request in any size and email it to you!

    $60 - Receive a print of your choice from my pieces featured on the website!

    $100 - Receive an oil painting of anything you request! (Limited Quantity)

    Each print and oil painting comes with a thank-you card, and each email also comes with a thank-you note.



    Some Final Words

    In the future, we plan to add a wide variety of new features, including but not limited to the creation of an account system, an extended voting system, and commissions/requests.

    Please check out our website, which includes more details, future plans, and business models! All creators so far have galleries or music playlists, along with contact info, up on the site, so feel free to check them out!

    http://creationsforconcord.com/

    Email us at: creationsforconcord@gmail.com

    Check us out on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/creationsforconcord

    Please be sure to check back on our project often! If you cannot contribute, sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or other forms of social media will also be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance for all the support!

  What about Perks? $5 or more - You get a shout-out on our website!

story:
Why Use Indiegogo?

This campaign is important to me because it gives me a chance to bypass finding grants, sponsors, and publishers in the efforts to produce these artbooks. These other avenues although valuable to the arts bring into play a certain amount control over content and how it is presented. As I am growing as an artist I want to feel able and capable to delve into taboos in the future projects as well as maintain a sense of artistic integrity. Losing control of the quantity produce, inserting ads, and editing content to suite a company interest are something I don't want to sacrifice. For example the artbook SYBL I am taking the time to hand detail each of them to give each book its' own sense of uniqueness. This would not be able to happen going through a publisher. Using an avenue like Indiegogo allows me to deliver pure art content straight to you the supporter. 

 

LALA EATS LALA Artbooks and Other Perk Information

Seven Years Bad Luck /// SYBL /// 1st Edition Limited /// 50 Copies

300 pages /// 28cm x 21.5cm /// Madness Portfolio Documentation Book

Seven years bad luck is composed of three sections Dirty South, Ghost Island, and Polski Kryzys. Dirty South dives into the infamous Fireproof Gallery and its' many shows and installations. Ghost Island explores the strange terrain of Taiwan. Polski Kryzys joins some polish travelers knocking on doors for work in Norway. The full book is hand detailed through the book to give each book it's own uniqueness as well.  Composed into a strange avant-garde artbook of photos, art, and stories that encapsulates the seven years between 2009-2016 of art making with LALA EATS LALA. 

for more info and preview http://lalaeatslala.com/Seven-Years-Bad-Luck-Ar...

 

Learning To See Blue /// LTSB /// 1st Edition Limited /// 100 Copies

218 pages /// 17.5cm x 26.5cm /// Avant-Garde Body Painting Book

Learning To See Blue is an art-book project. This avant-garde artbook was developed around the idea of blurring the specifications of sexuality through conversation and body painting. Finding the complexities of individuals and letting them sink it surreal scenery. It will be composed of a compilation of body-paintings, illustrations, and sex/lovestories.

for more info and preview http://lalaeatslala.com/Learning-To-See-Blue-Ar...

 

By The Way The Bird Flies /// 1st Edition Limited /// 50 Copies

104 pages /// 10.25cm x 13.5 cm /// Story Portrait Artbook

only available free with purchase of SYBL artbook

This is an ongoing project that was started in 2011 of documenting people I have met while traveling and working as an artist. Each portrait is comprised of the story that was shared with me. Stories are a reflection of humanity and the door that give us humility.

for more info and preview http://lalaeatslala.com/By-The-Way-The-Bird-Fli...

 

LALA EATS LALA Print Sets

print sets include 3 high-quality digital prints each 21cm x 29.7cm

Drawing Series Set 1

Drawing Series Set 2

Drawing Series Set 3

LTSB Series Set 1

LTSB Series Set 2

LTSB Series Set 3

LTSB Series Set 4

LALA EATS LALA Postcard Sets

Postcard sets come with 3 signed postcards

LTSB Postcard Set 1

LTSB Postcard Set 2

LTSB Postcard Set 3

SYBL Postcard Set 1

SYBL Postcard Set 2

SYBL Postcard Set 3

Drawing Postcard Set 1

Drawing Postcard Set 2

Drawing Postcard Set 3

for a preview of each set http://lalaeatslala.com/LALA-EATS-LALA-Postcards

LALA EATS LALA Tshirts

(Left) Drunk Runner (Right) Happy Ass

 

LALA EATS LALA Sticker Pack

each set contains 10 postcard size stickers

 

Artist Bio

LALA EATS LALA formally known as Zachary Widgren is an avant-garde underground artist hailing from the Smoky Mountains in the USA.  The subtle qualities of his work mixed with his attention to detail make for strange yet strangely seductive work. Known for being prolific and working in a variety of media he has certainly produced powerfully unique artwork throughout his career. He attended the University of Tennessee for painting. Following his graduation after curating at a local bar he wanted to provide an open platform for non-traditional artists to showcase their work. He then opened the infamous Fireproof Gallery with some like minded collaborators which was a two year series of seasonal large scale collaborative installations where he featured his work as well as many other artist and musicians.

He is currently based in Taipei, Taiwan where he is working on a variety of projects with local and other foreign artist. He has been featured in Milk Magazine a Hong Kong based magazine for his paintings and illustrations. As well as featured and interviewed in Collectif lifestyle magazine from Belgium for one of his projects By The Way The Bird Flies. As his popularity has grown so has his international patronage. In the future he sees himself working to grow and explore the international art community while maintaining an effort to always keep a constant stream of interesting projects in progress.

story:
Send Me to San Francisco 

Hello, my name is Kiersten Mercado and I am an Artist. As an Art student, the summer between my Junior and Senior year is going to be extremely important for me. This is the only time I'll have left to tighten up my skills and create a well-developed portfolio.

I have one chance and ONLY ONE CHANCE to attend San Francisco Art Institute PreCollege Program this summer. This is a five-week, six-college-credit course of study.

I Applied last year to this very same program and I was over the moon when I was accepted! But I was unable to go because I didn't have the funds. I was devastated, but I didn't let it discourage me.

I applied to SFAI PreCollege Summer Program again this year. I just received the news I was selected to attend. I am super excited, but I know I have to raise money so I can go.

This is my LAST OPPORTUNITY to attend SFAI PreCollege Summer Program. I've worked sooo hard to reach this point. 

Send me to San Francisco to study with Art teachers at one of the oldest and most prestigious Art Colleges in the country. I will reward you with ART!

What I Need

Raising $5,000 will go towards food, housing and the cost of SFAI Precollege Summer Program Classes. If I exceed this goal, any additional funds will help cover my airfare to San Francisco, transportation, Art supplies needed for the program and shipping/handling fees of artwork.

Here's the breakdown:

  • $3,000- Tuition for two studio courses, including six units of college credits, Friday workshops and Art in Context.
  • $2,000- Room and board (Includes a $250 cafe cash plan)
  • Airfare: $500 estimated
  • Per diem: $300 (museums, transportation, S&H artwork)

What You Get

DONATIONS- Here's what you'll get:

  • $10 or more- 4x6 photo I will personally take just for you in San Francisco
  • $25 or more- the above item+ 1 color silk screen inspired by this program
  • $50 or more- the above items+ 1 multi-colored silk screen (limited edition)
  • $100 or more- all of the above items+ Scholastics Art and Writing National Silver Medal award winning print "LA" (Limited edition)
  • $500+ WOW! You're AWESOME! All of the above items + an ORIGINAL acrylic painting on canvas inspired by San Francisco

Other Ways You Can Help

I can't let this once in a lifetime opportunity slip through my fingertips. I really need your support to help cover the cost. Every little bit helps!

If you are unable to donate, you can still help by spreading the word and sharing this link with others. 

Thank you for your time and support. Let's make this dream a reality!

story:
ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN

Dear friends, colleagues and supporters,

This campaign is to raise money to fund the production of new work for an artist in residence program at the Skowhegan School of Painting & Sculpture this Summer.  

Skowhegan's artist in residence program is one of the most prestigious in the country.  The residency provides a safe space for artists to live and make work in Madison, Maine.  Artists are provided studios and facilities.  You are encouraged to come to the residency without a specific idea or project in mind to allow artistic growth, development and exploration.  Skowhegan's residency is renowned for being a transformative, life-changing program. This year the visiting faculty includes a stellar line up of artists including Roni Horn, Jennie C. Jones, Jeffrey Gibson, Sigrid Sandstrom, Sheila Hicks and Yoshua Okon, among others!  

There is a tuition fee and I have been fortunate enough to have 80% of it covered by Skowhegan.  A small portion of the funds will also go towards covering the remainder of my tuition.  

Contributors will help me get to and from my destination, develop new work and ideas and participate in an invaluable experience. 

GOAL & PERKS

I need to raise $4500 in three weeks.  
Roughly 80% will go towards the cost of film, development, photo paper and other materials such as negative sleeves, miscellaneous materials that will help me experiment with installation in my studio space. 
Remaining funds will go towards a round-trip flight ticket and the production of a zine based on my experience at Skowhegan to including new photographs, documentation of my process and writings.  
In return, I am offering the following:
  • Editioned inkjet prints in the size of 8 x 10, 11 x 14 & 16 x 20 (Please view image gallery tab for selections).
  • Post Cards
  • A limited edition zine done based on the residency period. 
  • Portrait commissions for those in the New Haven, New York City and Washington, D.C. Metropolitan area.  
All prints are editioned & archival inkjet prints on Epson matte paper with a quarter inch border on top and sides.  All content comes signed with a personal thank you note.    

THE IMPACT

Skowhegan will be an incredible, life changing experience for me.  As an artist who has grown up and always made work in an urban community, living in Madison, Maine will allow me to completely challenge my process in art making.  This will be an important part of my lifetime education as an artist and help me prepare for thinking outside of my own confines for graduate school.  Being surrounding by artists at all different points in their careers and mediums will enrich my perspective and process immensely.  

CAN'T DONATE? Help Spread the word!

Please email this campaign to people who would be interested in contributing and collecting my work.  Please also post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Blog pages. Spreading the word is equally as effective as donating!

ABOUT JOHN EDMONDS

John Edmonds is a photographer and visual artist based in Washington, D.C.  He received his BFA in Photography from the Corcoran College of Art + Design and will be attending Yale University in the Fall to pursue an MFA in Photography.  His work and self-published photobooks are in the permanent collections of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, FOAM Museum Amsterdam Library, The George Eastman House Library, The Indie Photobook Library and the National Library of Australia.  

THANK YOU

Thank you all very much for your continued support, donations and sharing this campaign.  Special Thanks to Rebekah Purcell and Carlos Vargas of VSION, LLC for the amazing artist profile video and Deshaundon Jeans for working with me!
story_txt:
ABOUT THE CAMPAIGNDear friends, colleagues and supporters,This campaign is to raise money to fund the production of new work for an artist in residence program at the Skowhegan School of Painting & Sculpture this Summer.  Skowhegan's artist in residence program is one of the most prestigious in the country.  The residency provides a safe space for artists to live and make work in Madison, Maine.  Artists are provided studios and facilities.  You are encouraged to come to the residency without a specific idea or project in mind to allow artistic growth, development and exploration.  Skowhegan's residency is renowned for being a transformative, life-changing program. This year the visiting faculty includes a stellar line up of artists including Roni Horn, Jennie C. Jones, Jeffrey Gibson, Sigrid Sandstrom, Sheila Hicks and Yoshua Okon, among others!  There is a tuition fee and I have been fortunate enough to have 80% of it covered by Skowhegan.  A small portion of the funds will also go towards covering the remainder of my tuition.  Contributors will help me get to and from my destination, develop new work and ideas and participate in an invaluable experience. GOAL & PERKSI need to raise $4500 in three weeks.  Roughly 80% will go towards the cost of film, development, photo paper and other materials such as negative sleeves, miscellaneous materials that will help me experiment with installation in my studio space. Remaining funds will go towards a round-trip flight ticket and the production of a zine based on my experience at Skowhegan to including new photographs, documentation of my process and writings.  In return, I am offering the following:
Editioned inkjet prints in the size of 8 x 10, 11 x 14 & 16 x 20 (Please view image gallery tab for selections).

Post Cards
A limited edition zine done based on the residency period. 

Portrait commissions for those in the New Haven, New York City and Washington, D.C. Metropolitan area.  

All prints are editioned & archival inkjet prints on Epson matte paper with a quarter inch border on top and sides.  All content comes signed with a personal thank you note.

story:
Please remember that donations at ANY level help us get this thing built and out to the playa!(Scroll down to see pictures of all of our perks)


Guild of Mile Higher Knowledge

The team who brought the Midway project out to the playa last year is back with a new granted art project for Burning Man 2016!!  This year the theme is DaVinci's Workshop and we have been asked to create Guilds that will circle the Man with artists, makers, tinkerers, and craftspeople to operate workshops for the delight and edification of the citizens of Black Rock City.  Colorado pitched "The Guild of Mile Higher Knowledge" and was accepted!  This year's project is *4*  times the size of the project we brought last year so we need your help!!  Please check out our campaign and consider giving your support!! Any sized donation helps!  If everyone who looked at this page gave $10 we would be funded in the span of a week!  


A first drafting of the front of our Guild by Vince Kenney.

The Guild of Mile Higher Knowledge is A "present" workshop and a "past" workshop connected by a time portal that you have to figure out clues to get the past to open up to you. Workshops led by tons of Colorado folks and a Da Vinci Code adventure that will take you all over the playa to meet and mingle with Colorado camps. Our space is broken up into 3 areas. In the front you have a present day workshop where we will be teaching modern workshops like LED helicopters, making a solar stove, Tesla cell phone chargers, etc. If you want to tap into ancient technology, you can pass through the time portal into a workshop from the Renaissance era. The time portal will have an interactive clue aspect that you have to figure out in order to get the past to open up to you. In the past we will teach classes like kite building, leather mask making, carving a spoon out of a branch, wooden camp chairs, etc. Some of the workshops, like kite building and LED helicopters we will take the group out after the workshop and fly them together. We have tons of Colorado folks who teach regular workshops and we want to give as many of them a chance to lead workshops on playa as we can. The front of our booth is designed to look like an ancient building, but Burning Man style with LED lit columns and a couple of incredible murals.

Rhino artwork by Ton Varani will be part of the mural on the front of our project.

Our side project, the Da Vinci Code Capade, will involve picking up a cypher card in front of the booth and figuring out clues to take you on an adventure around the playa. This will allow many of the Colorado theme camps to host our adventurers along the way. People can bring their completed card back at any time during the burn week to pick up a fantastic prize.

What We Need

  • TRANSPORTATION! This is a really big project and will require quite a bit of space for transportation.  This means we need to rent a box truck or a truck and trailer.  Either way, transportation to the playa is a major cost.  We anticipate that we will need a minimum of $2000 for this.
  • BUILDING MATERIALS! This year we were given 4 times the space of the project we had last year.  We are building to fill a 20'x40' space.  That is 800sf of space!  This project is very ambitious and we are looking at a minimum of $1500 for the building materials.
  • WORKSHOP MATERIALS! We have to fill 12 hours a day with workshops over the course of 6 days in two workshop spaces that will be running simultaneously.  This means we need to come up with 144 hours of workshop (building/crafting/creating) materials for hundreds of people.
  • THE FUTURE! If we manage to raise over our goal, we will be putting the money toward our long term goal of buying a large trailer for transportation of the  Regional project each year.  Interest in making this an annual endeavor has grown and we see this project continuing for years.
  • DONATIONS!  We need donations of all kinds of supplies!  This includes lumber, plywood, arts and crafts supplies, etc.  We are partnered with a non-profit that will be collecting donations for us so that donations can be a tax write off.  Please send us a message at coburners@gmail.com if you have something to donate or would like more information.

Please remember that donations at ANY level help us get this thing built and out to the playa!  We set our goal low, so that we would actually make it and be eligible for Indigogo's InDemand promotions that you can only get when you meet your goal, but this year we are trying to raise a minimum of $10,000.  This is a huge goal!   Please give at any level to help us out!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are interested in getting involved with the build or teaching workshops out on playa, please shoot me an email at coburners@gmail.com If you want more information keep reading.
  • Share this campaign far and wide!  (But, don't just repost the campaign with no words of your own.  Please make sure to tell people why this matters to you.)

Perks

Our Eternal Love and Gratitude


Sticker Madness


The Man as Zoltar Pendant


Postcards from the Playa


Patch you up #1, #2, #3, and Patch Gifting Pack
(pick one of these designs or a combo of both)

Patch You Up #1


Patch You up #2 

Patch You up #3 is one of each.
Patch gifting pack is 25 of either design or a mix of both.


Pendant Power Up!


Pendant Mania -Huge Pendant/Keychain #1


Pendant Mania -Huge Pendant #2

(The small pendant in this picture is the size of the one from the Pendant Power up Perk.  It is included to give you a size reference. The Pendant Power Up picture shows the size of the smaller one with someone wearing it.)  Use it as a Flav-a-flavesque oversized Burning Man pendant or attach it to your bike, art car, or art project!

Zoltar in your House!

Super Dope Chopper Bike!
