story:
Nancy Pelosi is turning 80 on March 26th and because she keeps her wits sharp by solving the New York Times crossword every day, I thought it would be nice to make a custom, illustrated, elaborate tribute crossword puzzle for Nancy Pelosi that is mostly about her, and covers the arc of her career as a politician, wife, mother and just general badass.

Nancy Pelosi is a tough cookie with a long, distinguished career as a politician who has stood for truth, justice and the American way - despite tsunamis of BS and blather from the other side of the aisle - and the White House. 

This birthday crossword is a gesture to thank Speaker Pelosi for standing tough in the eye of many storms, and for taking the path of the righteous woman while beset on all sides by the inequities of the selfish and the tyranny of evil, incompetent men. 

Blessed is she...

(I have a weird, savant ability to make crossword puzzles - a trait I might have inherited from my Grandpa Clifton Tuttle, who was a Kodak physicist in the 30s and 40s and codebreaker during World War II who helped crack the Japanese Naval Purple Code.

The codebreaker brain is the crossword brain.  During World War II the London Times and New York Times would have crossword competitions and the intelligence services would contact the winners and recruit them as codebreakers.

I have made custom crosswords for SURFER Magazine, for champion surfer Kelly Slater, for the actresses Jane Leeves and Nia Peeples (see below) for a Google exec who shall remain nameless, a famous New York hotelier/restaurateur who shall remain nameless, and even some non-famous people.)



For Nancy Pelosi's puzzle I have hired an illustrator in Mexico named Ariel Medel to produce some illustrations for a crossword with the working title:

 

 WHOSE HOUSE? NANCY'S HOUSE!

                 A Birthday Crossword to Celebrate the XXXXXXXXtraordinary Nancy Pelosi

We did a custom crossword puzzle for the actress Jane Leeves and I asked Ariel to produce an illustration of her famous, million dollar face to put on a 20 pound note. 

Ariel nailed it. He's very good and a pleasure to work with.

It's possible I dream up these goofy ideas just to work with the hombre and challenge him with new projects.


Ariel is very talented and I have some ideas for decorating this crossword with Nancy Pelosi illustrations that I don't want to share publicly, but if you chip in we can communicate and I will share the ideas - and even show you the raw puzzle - if you're interested.

Okay here's one illustration I want to commission. Remember the final scene from Seinfeld? I want Ariel to re-create this, but with Team Trump behind bars: Donald, Ivanka, Donald Junior. Eric. 

And maybe Kimberley Guilfoyle shaking the bars and screaming.

Barron Trump separated from Melania in his own cage, pouting for his mom?

Evil!

Fun? You betcha!

I want to properly pay Ariel Medel the illustrator and art director Joni Casimiro who will lay the puzzle out - these crosswords are a pain to lay out properly.

We are going to print one version at 16" x 22" for Madame Speaker to fill out and another at 20" x 30" for her to hang on the wall of her office - hopefully.

And possibly pay for some photos and other costs.


 

So if you believe in Nancy Pelosi and all she has stood for and withstood, pitch in a little and we'll send you a full-sized, full-color copy of the puzzle, either electronically or by mail.

And let you in on the creation process if that interests you.

And also add your name and email to a list of contributors that could go on the back of the puzzle that is submitted to Madame Speaker.

(And if you want one of these custom crosswords for the Word Nerd in your family, let me know.)

They're fun to create and fun to give and fun to receive and I hope Nancy Pelosi will enjoy hers.

Madame Speaker's custom crossword will look something like this crossword the husband of Jane Leeves commissioned me to do. 

(She had it hanging in her dressing room while she was shooting Hot in Cleveland. Her English parents do the London Times crossword every day. They loved it and sent me a thank you card - because they are English and that's how they roll.)

I can only hope Madame Speaker hangs her crossword proudly, and that some impressionable, rioting mullet-head doesn't break in and steal it.

This will be fun. Join us!

They loved it and sent me a thank you card - because they are English and that's how they roll.)I can only hope Madame Speaker hangs her crossword proudly, and that some impressionable, rioting mullet-head doesn't break in and steal it.This will be fun. story:
Get BRG To the Playa

  • In 2016, Black Rock Gladiators' unique mix of frenetic art, consensual combat and shitshow parties first descended on SOAK and Burning Man. This year, we're artsier, savager and shittier than ever, and we want to bring the ruckus to the 4:30 Plaza in Black Rock City.
  • We hope to raise $3500 to cover the expenses of travel, fuel, supplies and our fundraising efforts to date (including our sweet fundraiser party on July 8th, which if you attended, thanks!)
  • Your contribution will make our dream of bringing BRG to the playa in 2017 come true.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $3500 gets us diesel, gas, propane, fluffing supplies, repair materials for our equipment, materials to improve safety on our Joust platform, materials to upgrade the Hurt Feelings Infirmary, and (oh so importantly) the liquor Vandango needs to serve its hundreds or thousands of thirsty patrons it serves throughout the week of Burning Man.
  • If we don't reach the full goal of $3500, all funds will still be applied to our journey out there - but we will struggle to make it unless we reach almost all of our goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, please help us get the word out and share with your Burner friends. Any bit of exposure helps!
story_txt:
Get BRG To the Playa

In 2016, Black Rock Gladiators' unique mix of frenetic art, consensual combat and shitshow parties first descended on SOAK and Burning Man. This year, we're artsier, savager and shittier than ever, and we want to bring the ruckus to the 4:30 Plaza in Black Rock City.
We hope to raise $3500 to cover the expenses of travel, fuel, supplies and our fundraising efforts to date (including our sweet fundraiser party on July 8th, which if you attended, thanks!)
Your contribution will make our dream of bringing BRG to the playa in 2017 come true.


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

$3500 gets us diesel, gas, propane, fluffing supplies, repair materials for our equipment, materials to improve safety on our Joust platform, materials to upgrade the Hurt Feelings Infirmary, and (oh so importantly) the liquor Vandango needs to serve its hundreds or thousands of thirsty patrons it serves throughout the week of Burning Man.
If we don't reach the full goal of $3500, all funds will still be applied to our journey out there - but we will struggle to make it unless we reach almost all of our goal. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please help us get the word out and share with your Burner friends. Any bit of exposure helps!

story:
If I had to go with the simplest description I could think of, I'd say Pot Pourri is a collection of collections, a way to put together the work i'm proudest of, and the themes i've found myself the most eager to explore in the last few years. As an artist based on social media, there's something comfortable about patterns, and buying this book, you'll be able to see the backbone of what makes me excited about art.


My relationship with illustration has been, and shall always be, to explore and create within the concepts I trust to be meaningful, such as the language of the flowers, wonders of the universe and so on! I believe colors have powers and imagery can bring on feelings we'd love to express but are not always sure how.

I'm carefully assembling this book to be an exciting visual journey and to have at least one page that will make you smile! Being someone who found no short amount of pleasure from printed artbooks, it would be the culmination of a sucessfu landmark on my carreer to give you the possibility of flipping through actual pages of delicately organized art!



Despite having the majority of my carreer being placed upon companies and friends I made online, It's the first time I'm truly reaching out for the audience I grew over the time i've been posting my artwork, and I truly need your help to make this book possible!

And if you are unable to help me with money, never fear! Sharing this campaign with friends or anyone who you think might enjoy my work it's also super helpful! ♡

Pot Pourri is a 130 pages high-quality hardcover artbook, and the costs to envision such in a small amount tend to skyrocket! In order to reduce pricing and increase the level of excellence I wish for the finished product to have, I'd have to not only raise the copies to a big number but also take off some time from freelancing to devote myself to produce exclusive content and cool as hell extra goodies! 


You'll be able to see all my favorite pieces and series, paired together with new and exclusive art and notes that clarify not only my step to step process, but also what's on my mind when I try to approach certain topics creatively! And as much as I've tried to broach this topic before, this will be the first time when I'll be able to talk about my creation process so thoroughly.




I'll be adding traditional and digital sketches, small visual narratives in the form of comics, previews on some of my favorite personal projects and brief tutorials! The main theme is flowers (couldn't you tell?) so there's some very special content dedicated to it! But what I believe most of all is that if you enjoy my artwork, you are gonna love Pot Pourri!

Most images shown (mainly the book mockups) are for illustration purpose only! If funded, the actual artbook will have the same content as mentioned, but with much better page layouts and design.
And since we're going all in with products I always wanted to make, I've developed some cool perks to share with you, including PDF's, print packs, enamel pins, originals and commissions! I am really excited about all the stuff that I'm finally going to be able to offer in exchange for your ever present support end generosity!

  • hard enamel pin designs (flower skull (rosé gold) & pizza starship (gold): 1,2'' inches, mergnome (gold): 1,6'' inches)

  • an exclusive 3-print-pack collection featuring 19cmx19cm 300 g/m² artwork

(by buying one of the pieces in this bundle, you'll get to receive the original regarding the number you chose! so please make sure is the correct one before the purchase! ♡) 

  • original art on the theme "matrioshka" (A5 sheet / 14,8 × 21 cm / 5.8 × 8.3 in) paper is Hahnemüle 190 g/m² acid free & age resistant, ink is lightfast faber castell ecco pigment + copic marker.

  • original art on the theme "pot pourri" (A5 sheet / 14,8 × 21 cm / 5.8 × 8.3 in) paper is Hahnemüle 190 g/m² acid free & age resistant, ink is lightfast faber castell ecco pigment + copic marker.

(by buying one of the pieces in this bundle, you'll get to receive the original regarding the number you chose! so please make sure is the correct one before the purchase! ♡) 


  • original art on the theme "flower hair" (A5 sheet / 14,8 × 21 cm / 5.8 × 8.3 in) paper is Hahnemüle 190 g/m² acid free & age resistant, ink is lightfast faber castell ecco pigment.

(by buying one of the pieces in this bundle, you'll get to receive the original regarding the number you chose! so please make sure is the correct one before the purchase! ♡) 

  • digital commission, complexity must be within' the examples for this tier. (max 2 characters)

if you know my work, then you're probably aware of the fact that i don't do robots, nsfw, violent or highly realistic anatomic depiction! please take my style and previous submissions in consideration when envisioning what you'd like for an commissioned piece (characters and portraits are ok!)

  • traditional ink commission (A5 sheet / 14,8 × 21 cm / 5.8 × 8.3 in) complexity must be within' the examples for this tier. (max 2 characters)

if you know my work, then you're probably aware of the fact that i don't do robots, nsfw, violent or highly realistic anatomic depictions! please take my style and previous submissions in consideration when envisioning what you'd like for an original piece (characters and portraits are ok!)


Stretch goals are one of the most amazing things a crowdfunding campaign has to offer! They are new milestones that can be used as a way to thank backer's continuated support! After reaching our main goal (YES! THANKS!) of bringing the book to life, what we'll be doing now is just making it better, more complete and with more cool items for all of you!

  • "Flower Skull" sticker sheet (if the goal of 14k is reached, every backer who bought perks from Pepperoni Pizza (third tier/artbook only) + up will receive the sticker sheet with their copy of "Pot Pourri" (UNLOCKED)
     
  • Backers from tiers Pepperoni Breadsticks and Cheese Pizza will receive a high quality PDF file of the sticker sheet & permission to print as long as it's for personal use. (UNLOCKED)

​

  • "Hardcover" upgrade!!! If the goal of 16k is reached, every backer who bought the softcover artbook + up will receive a free upgrade to a luxurious hardcover! (Avalable for backers from Pepperoni Pizza (third tier/artbook only) +up) (UNLOCKED)

  • + 10 pages of sketches/thumbnails (if the goal of 20k is reached, every backer who bought the artbook + up will receive 10 extra pages! which also applies for PDF buyers.) (UNLOCKED)

The total funds are divided in printing the books, the Indiegogo fee, credit card & paypal fees and additional prizes to upgrade the perks. I found it best not to include the shipping in my fee, for that would most likely jeopardize the funding effort and minimize my control over how the packages are going to arrive in your lovely hands.

We will be working with quality product suppliers and printhouses for both the artbook and the extra items, and worldwide shipment will be overseen by a major e-commerce fullfillment company! All of it to make sure that the book will be delivered perfect and on time.



Regarding the risks of backing this project, I'd like to make it clear that i'm not doing this alone! My superhero of an agent is overseeing every possible aspect that could go wrong and tackling it mercilessly! We're not a publishing house nor a millionaire investment, so we're bound to learn something with any possible rocks along the path, still I think we're as prepared as it's humanly possible.
story_txt:
If I had to go with the simplest description I could think of, I'd say Pot Pourri is a collection of collections, a way to put together the work i'm proudest of, and the themes i've found myself the most eager to explore in the last few years. As an artist based on social media, there's something comfortable about patterns, and buying this book, you'll be able to see the backbone of what makes me excited about art.

My relationship with illustration has been, and shall always be, to explore and create within the concepts I trust to be meaningful, such as the language of the flowers, wonders of the universe and so on! I believe colors have powers and imagery can bring on feelings we'd love to express but are not always sure how.
I'm carefully assembling this book to be an exciting visual journey and to have at least one page that will make you smile! Being someone who found no short amount of pleasure from printed artbooks, it would be the culmination of a sucessfu landmark on my carreer to give you the possibility of flipping through actual pages of delicately organized art!Despite having the majority of my carreer being placed upon companies and friends I made online, It's the first time I'm truly reaching out for the audience I grew over the time i've been posting my artwork, and I truly need your help to make this book possible!And if you are unable to help me with money, never fear! Sharing this campaign with friends or anyone who you think might enjoy my work it's also super helpful! ♡
Pot Pourri is a 130 pages high-quality hardcover artbook, and the costs to envision such in a small amount tend to skyrocket! In order to reduce pricing and increase the level of excellence I wish for the finished product to have, I'd have to not only raise the copies to a big number but also take off some time from freelancing to devote myself to produce exclusive content and cool as hell extra goodies! 

You'll be able to see all my favorite pieces and series, paired together with new and exclusive art and notes that clarify not only my step to step process, but also what's on my mind when I try to approach certain topics creatively! And as much as I've tried to broach this topic before, this will be the first time when I'll be able to talk about my creation process so thoroughly.
I'll be adding traditional and digital sketches, small visual narratives in the form of comics, previews on some of my favorite personal projects and brief tutorials! The main theme is flowers (couldn't you tell?) so there's some very special content dedicated to it! But what I believe most of all is that if you enjoy my artwork, you are gonna love Pot Pourri!Most images shown (mainly the book mockups) are for illustration purpose only! If funded, the actual artbook will have the same content as mentioned, but with much better page layouts and design.And since we're going all in with products I always wanted to make, I've developed some cool perks to share with you, including PDF's, print packs, enamel pins, originals and commissions! I am really excited about all the stuff that I'm finally going to be able to offer in exchange for your ever present support end generosity!
hard enamel pin designs (flower skull (rosé gold) & pizza starship (gold): 1,2'' inches, mergnome (gold): 1,6'' inches)


an exclusive 3-print-pack collection featuring 19cmx19cm 300 g/m² artwork

story:
We've updated the video above to reflect some of the changes from our original Winter Waite deck, to our 2019 revised edition. Original is on the left, and updated version is on the right.

We're busying ourselves making new additions to the cards, and will share them throughout the campaign. Some of the images mostly stay the same as the imagery from 2018, but others have undergone quite extensive changes.

This Winter Waite revised edtion is a borderless version of the deck. This year we're crowdfunding the deck in the hopes that we won't have to to use POD (print on demand) anymore (or at least for awhile). The cost of POD has become practically unaffordable over the years with places like "Printer's Studio" and "Make Playing Cards" charging around 12.00  USD just to add a tuckbox onto a deck order.  We would like to get a large printing of our deck to lower the cost to customers from 60 USD to 45 USD (the price of our Trippin' Waite for example). A large print run will make this possible.

If successful our customers will be able to purchase the deck, including a tuck box at a much lower price this year, Which brings me around to how backers will benefit supporting our campaign.  If you back the campaign and select the Early Bird Special, you will be getting the deck at the lowest price available while helping Independent Tarot artists continue bringing you unique tarot products. Our eventual cost on site will not be lower than the Early Bird Special.

Key features / changes so far

The Deck will be Borderless

The Deck will come with a box (if fully funded)

Some of the Court Kings and Queens will be kitted out with royal ermine.

Chariot card will be based on the original Chariot from the Waite Smith deck (our 2018 version featured elf children on a sled)

story:
We are North Alabama's Premier Doctor Who Convention!

We just completed our fifth year and are looking to make the next five even bigger and better. Every contribution comes with a wonderful perk. If you can't contribute, please share this campaign. 
We are a not for profit organization that gives back to local charities every year. Every penny we earn rolls into the next year. 

For more information about us, check out www.conkasterborous.com

story:
Short Summary

As an abstract landscape artist I find myself most inspired while participating as an artist in residence. Whether within the US or abroad, every experience forces me to create a new visual language to express what I see and feel. This summer I would like to travel to Sicily as an artist in residence with Officina Stamperia del Notaio. The residency is located in the village of Tusa and is shared with 3 other artists in residence.  I will be painting on location throughout the countryside and in the historic Sicilian cities of Tusa and Palermo.  Visiting Palermo will allow me time to explore my Sicilian heritage and reflect on the anniversary of my father's death. The 18 day+ residency is 570 euros and covers my living quarters, studio space and exhibition. I will also have international flight, material, and shipping expenses, meals and other in-country travel expenses.  I am offering "painting perks from Sicily" as a thank you to my supporters.

story:
1/3/16 UPDATE:

THANK YOU FOR MAKING THIS SUCH A SUCCESSS!

Did you miss out on our online fundraiser? Did you really want some of these rewards? Want to join the co-op? All is possible.

Visit us at 841 Massachusetts St. and you can make an in-person contribution. We'll be able to give donation rewards to anyone who donates before Jan 10th. Beyond that, you will always be able to join the co-op, so just ask! See you in the shop!


Wonder Fair

Wonder Fair is an art gallery and shop in Lawrence, Kansas. We recently moved from our cozy location above the Burger Stand to a large and beautiful street-level space at 841 Mass St. It’s a big, scary leap and the rent is a whole lot higher and that’s why we’re recruiting some help.

When we asked our patrons what they wanted as Wonder Fair expands our operations, nearly all votes were for a downtown art supply. So let’s do it!

We’re excited to serve up knowledge and equipment to hardworking local artists---and to offer an alternative for those of you whose values aren’t represented by the other art supply businesses in town (we’re looking at you, Hobby Lobby).

On top of adding art supplies to our resume, our retail and gallery spaces are now bigger and better, and our new location will soon host the headquarters for the Secret Order of the Black Diamond. With a permanent base of operations, we intend to expand the activities for this not-so-secret art/adventure club.

What Even is Money?

Your donation to this campaign will help with the startup costs for expanding Wonder Fair and opening our new art supply.

Estimated costs:

  • Build-out (create new custom fixtures, gallery renovation, refinish floors, clean, paint, haunt bathroom, etc.): $25,000
  • New inventory (for art supply and expanded retail): $30,000

Wow. That’s a lot. Thanks for helping!

Fine Rewards

In exchange for your financial assistance, we've devised a reward scheme through which you can obtain some fine physical items that will forever remind you of your generosity in helping our little business reach new heights. 


How Will The Co-Op Work?

We’re still figuring things out, but the co-op will function like a buyer's club where members will get special discounts on their art supply purchases. Your lifetime co-op membership gets you access to:

  • 10% off all your art supply purchases
  • special coupons
  • discounts on workshops
  • at least two opportunities per year to order art supplies at a special discounted rate
  • and probably more things we haven't thought of yet

Offline Support

We are simultaneously running an analog version of this fundraiser. Stop by our shop and you can make a direct donation for any of the perks you see here online. BONUS: You also won't be charged shipping fees and we'll save some money on fees by handling your donation ourselves (rather than through Indiegogo). Plus, we'll get to see your face.



What Is Wonder Fair?

"Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful." - William Morris

Wonder Fair is a gallery and retail space (and soon an art supply shop) in Downtown Lawrence, Kansas. We typically host 5 to 6 high quality gallery exhibitions each year featuring a mix of regional and national artists. Our primary focus is on printed matter, a process we honor for its egalitarian tradition of making beautiful art at affordable prices.

The spirit of Wonder Fair lies in the conviction that creativity is essential for the wellbeing of individuals and their community. Wonder Fair believes in the power of the handmade, the connecting and transformative properties of art, and the importance of shared experience.

Our practical commitment to these beliefs is to maintain a gallery, a site for social dialogue and creative exchange. Through the gallery and our rigorous exhibition schedule and a diverse range of special events, we form a hub of interconnectivity, a link between family, friends, and like-minded strangers within Lawrence and beyond. Through our shop, we approach these beliefs with entrepreneurial verve empowering artists and enriching the community.

Here are some fast facts:

  • We directly support artists financially: Wonder Fair has paid over $120,000 paid to artists over the past 4 years. The majority of these artists live in or near Lawrence, KS.
  • Wonder Fair co-founded Lawrence Print Week with the Lawrence Arts Center in 2013, and created Letter Writing Club (2014-present), an old-fashioned social network with monthly meetings at Decade Coffee.
  • Since 2011, we have helped organize Lawrence Sip & Shop, an annual holiday event where local artists exhibit and sell directly to the public.
  • Wonder Fair curator Meredith Moore was recently awarded a grant from the Charlotte Street Foundation to create a podcast to expand and investigate public-oriented creative work and written discourse in the KC region. THRUST Podcast launches late 2015. Meredith is also an East Ninth Artist. 
  • Wonder Fair has hosted and/or curated events for Free State Festival (2014, 15), Lawrence Public Library’s 2015 Read Across Lawrence program, Art+Feminism’s Wikipedia Edit-a-Thon (2015), Riptide Comedy Festival (2015), KU Printmakers Fundraising sale (2011-present), Field Day Fest (2014), Parcel Magazine Anniversary (2013), and more.
  • Our volunteer/internship program has provided mentorship and experience for nearly 20 local artists (mostly KU students). We also serve as mentors to many of the artists who sell their work at Wonder Fair to assist them in refining their products for market. 

Risks & Challenges

Lots of em, but hey, Ad Astra Per Aspera.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help support our move in other ways besides giving money, then here are some things could use help with:

  • Spread the word! Know people who might think a downtown art supply is a good idea? Let them know about our fundraiser. 
  • Volunteer! Wonder Fair is occasionally looking for dedicated individuals who are invested in our mission and willing to work regular shifts in the shop and gallery.
  • Bring us pie.

Keep Up With Wonder Fair

Here are our recommendations for how to stay “in-the-know” for all things Wonder Fair, including our progress on the art supply.

  1. “Like” our Facebook page and then select “Get notifications” from the “Liked” drop down menu.
  2. Follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Tumblr.

Spread the word! Know people who might think a downtown art supply is a good idea? Let them know about our fundraiser.

story:
Project Summary

Hi my name is Shari Tranchina, creator and one of the producers of a new TV show project called Mad Turn Up!  Myself and the producers at 4 Lion Productions welcome you to our IndieGogo fundraising page.

I'd like to share with you my story...

I’ve spent the last 20 years working with kids of all ages and have felt so much joy being around their happy energy!  

One summer years ago Mad Turn Up!  was born to me while enjoying the teens in my Performing Arts Summer Camp program do sketch comedy and improv skits during our weekly drama class. They had so much fun and were hilarious! They cracked each other up with creative and off the wall ideas.

I said to them…"You guys need your own show!"  Of course the silly little hams loved that idea!

After years of stage performances with them featuring dance, comedy and singing, here we are!

Mad Turn Up! is a hilarious comedy/variety show involving an all teenage cast of actors and performers that we know is unlike any other show for teenagers and young adults out there today.

It speaks to them in their language. It’s real to them, something they can relate to and totally get because it gets them!  It's edgy yet clean, not raunchy, not too adulterated and inappropriate, yet not too "tween-silly" (like shows perfect for a younger 8-15 year old audience.)  Mad Turn Up!  targets the 16-21ish age demographic.  Think Saturday Night Live and In Living Color with a few extra unique and inspiring segments!

I am so grateful for the many special years I’ve spent laughing with my acting and dance class students.  I would love for the world of teens and all appropriate ages to enjoy their talent as I have.

 

About Mad Turn Up!

Mad Turn Up! will mostly feature sketch comedy, musical and variety performances, and celebrity actors and musical guests, plus...a few other bit segments sprinkled throughout the episode that serve to unite, inspire and empower other young people.  The show explores teens from other cultures and will feature our cast involved in community.  You will also enjoy fun, entertaining reality-type segments that bring our audience closer to our cast and the Mad Turn Up! production.

 

Our Project's Impact

Mad Turn Up!  is mostly about laughing! 

Mad Turn Up!  is a supportive family who lifts spirits helping to release stress so often felt by teens today and creates unity through being related to each other’s experiences!

With so many pressures of school, hormones and life growing up with family and friends, it’s great to laugh and just let go for a bit.  

Laughter is important!  People love to laugh. It recharges the inner battery which enables us to tackle the challenges that make us stronger!

Mad Turn Up!   inspires living happy, healthy and powerfully!

My intension is to encourage young people to develop greater understanding, acceptance, kindness toward others and most importantly, love and acceptance of themselves.

My vision is that the Mad Turn Up!  cast is a powerful model of an influential group of responsible and caring teens which will serve to empower teens and young people worldwide!

 

Producing Quality - The Production Company

4 Lion Productions is the regions most promising entertainment firm operating as a full service production company. 4 Lion Productions holds the rights and manages a broad spectrum of television, film, and video projects, screenplays, reality series, and luxurious event properties.

4 Lion Productions has organized production, management and marketing teams, consisting of a diverse combination of small and big screen producers, experienced meeting and conference planners, marketing and P.R. professionals, and small business managers with over 50 years of total industry related skills.

4 Lion Productions was born in 2014. It is the brainchild of Chris Kelly and Paul Tucker. They were both owners and Co-Executive Producers for a successful television show that aired in 2012, on the CW Network: “Dance City”. Post Dance City, the two had formed such a good friendship and working relationship in their last venture, they discussed collaborating on shared visions for future creative projects, hence, the birth of “4 Lion Productions”.

 

Conclusion

Please help us make the taping of our pilot closer to reality! Every contribution will be acknowledged and appreciated according to the information provided on our page. Thank you for your time and support!  Remember to keep laughing and….”TURN UP!”
story_txt:
Project Summary
Hi my name is Shari Tranchina, creator and one of the producers of a new TV show project called Mad Turn Up!  Myself and the producers at 4 Lion Productions welcome you to our IndieGogo fundraising page.
I'd like to share with you my story...
I’ve spent the last 20 years working with kids of all ages and have felt so much joy being around their happy energy!  
One summer years ago Mad Turn Up!  was born to me while enjoying the teens in my Performing Arts Summer Camp program do sketch comedy and improv skits during our weekly drama class. They had so much fun and were hilarious! They cracked each other up with creative and off the wall ideas.
I said to them…"You guys need your own show!"  Of course the silly little hams loved that idea!
After years of stage performances with them featuring dance, comedy and singing, here we are!
Mad Turn Up! is a hilarious comedy/variety show involving an all teenage cast of actors and performers that we know is unlike any other show for teenagers and young adults out there today.
It speaks to them in their language. It’s real to them, something they can relate to and totally get because it gets them!  It's edgy yet clean, not raunchy, not too adulterated and inappropriate, yet not too "tween-silly" (like shows perfect for a younger 8-15 year old audience.)  Mad Turn Up!  targets the 16-21ish age demographic.  Think Saturday Night Live and In Living Color with a few extra unique and inspiring segments!
I am so grateful for the many special years I’ve spent laughing with my acting and dance class students.  I would love for the world of teens and all appropriate ages to enjoy their talent as I have.
 
About Mad Turn Up!

Mad Turn Up! will mostly feature sketch comedy, musical and variety performances, and celebrity actors and musical guests, plus...a few other bit segments sprinkled throughout the episode that serve to unite, inspire and empower other young people.  The show explores teens from other cultures and will feature our cast involved in community.  You will also enjoy fun, entertaining reality-type segments that bring our audience closer to our cast and the Mad Turn Up! production.

 
Our Project's Impact

Mad Turn Up!  is mostly about laughing! 
Mad Turn Up!  is a supportive family who lifts spirits helping to release stress so often felt by teens today and creates unity through being related to each other’s experiences!
With so many pressures of school, hormones and life growing up with family and friends, it’s great to laugh and just let go for a bit.  
Laughter is important!  People love to laugh. It recharges the inner battery which enables us to tackle the challenges that make us stronger!
Mad Turn Up!   inspires living happy, healthy and powerfully!
My intension is to encourage young people to develop greater understanding, acceptance, kindness toward others and most importantly, love and acceptance of themselves.
My vision is that the Mad Turn Up!  cast is a powerful model of an influential group of responsible and caring teens which will serve to empower teens and young people worldwide!

 
Producing Quality - The Production Company

4 Lion Productions is the regions most promising entertainment firm operating as a full service production company. 4 Lion Productions holds the rights and manages a broad spectrum of television, film, and video projects, screenplays, reality series, and luxurious event properties.
4 Lion Productions has organized production, management and marketing teams, consisting of a diverse combination of small and big screen producers, experienced meeting and conference planners, marketing and P.R. professionals, and small business managers with over 50 years of total industry related skills.
4 Lion Productions was born in 2014. It is the brainchild of Chris Kelly and Paul Tucker. They were both owners and Co-Executive Producers for a successful television show that aired in 2012, on the CW Network: “Dance City”. Post Dance City, the two had formed such a good friendship and working relationship in their last venture, they discussed collaborating on shared visions for future creative projects, hence, the birth of “4 Lion Productions”.
 

Conclusion
Please help us make the taping of our pilot closer to reality! Every contribution will be acknowledged and appreciated according to the information provided on our page. Thank you for your time and support!  Remember to keep laughing and….”TURN UP!”

story:
The War Rug Project

Fundraising Campaign Launched!
This fall, on the 10th anniversary of the September 11th attacks, I will be making a War Rug installation at the Grand Rapids Art Museum.  It is a momentous opportunity for reflection and commemoration, and I have resolved that the installation will be my most ambitious project yet.  It is part of the 2011 Art Prize competition, and I could use your help...

I'm trying to raise $5,000 to cover costs associated with the exhibit:  Framing three large spice monoprints.  Creating a platform for the new 9/11 war rug.  Shipping the artwork.  Documenting the creation and the destruction of the installation.  Creating a War Rug Project trading card.  Producing a book about the whole project.   All of these add up to a great exhibit, and a bit of an investment.  If you can help with a gift of anywhere from $10 to $5,000, I have a gift for you, along with my eternal, heartfelt gratitude.    You can see the various options on the right. 
Project Background

When the Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan in the late 1970s, Afghan women weavers began to incorporate pictures of weapons into the traditional floral, animal and geometric patterns of their carpets.  At first it was the subtle inclusion of a grenade here, or a bullet there, but soon Kalashnikov and AK-47 rifles, tanks, rockets, helicopters and landmines dominated these strange textiles, erasing centuries of previous motifs. 

Adding to the significance of the cultural phenomenon of War Rugs is the fact that most are woven by Afghan women, who face great restrictions their whole lives.  Often unable to be in public unescorted or unveiled, they have had little or no voice in their society.  The War Rugs are one of their few outlets for expression, and are complex cultural artifacts.

Decades after the Soviets withdrew, and shortly after the US invaded Afghanistan, I began making art installations inspired by the war rugs of Afghan women and the sand mandalas created by Tibetan Buddhist monks.  I recreated war rugs using spices instead of sand, as temporary artworks whose construction becomes a meditative exercise.  I have made 8 war rugs like this since 2002.

Spice war rugs take up to a week to create, and are completed when the fringe (with "popper" firecrackers) is attached.  Existing only temporarily, they are touched, inhaled, and sometimes even walked upon.

Early spice war rugs I swept up into jars at the end of each exhibition. Now I record the pieces as “monoprints,” fixing the remaining spices to cloth with clear medium and pulling editions of three.  The prints retain much of the color and aroma of the rugs, as well as the pattern of footprints and other incidents that the installation endured.  
Ten Years After
  In the decade since 9/11, it is important to commemorate the lives impacted by the war, and the voices of Afghan women weavers.  This fall's recreation of a 9/11 Afghan War Rug at the Grand Rapids Art Museum will be a temporary installation, on view from September 6 through October 21, 2011, including during the Art Prize competition.  I'll be giving a talk on 9/11, upon completing the installation.    I hope you will support my effort and perhaps even come to Grand Rapids to take part in it.
  Why Art Prize?   

My brother invited me to Grand Rapids last year for Art Prize, an open, city-wide art exhibition and competition.  I was amazed to see over 100,000 people walking all around and talking about art.  Families, couples, kids.  For days on end.  I decided Art Prize was an excellent opportunity to expose thousands of people to this project -- the war rugs, the Buddhist mandalas, the voices of Afghan women -- to generate conversation about the effect of war on culture.   
So, I will recreate a 9/11 War Rug, using spices, and display monoprints of an earlier, Soviet-era War Rug.  War Rug Trading Cards will be distributed with valuable information, and a book will be produced documenting the entire project.   I've made 8 war rugs so far -- you can see them here -- and I'd like to create a book that documents the project. 
The Impact

  The War Rug project honors the women of Afghanistan -- the original weavers who responded to wars and occupations that impacted them but they did not initiate -- and gets people talking about the more subtle impacts of war on culture, whether it is war rugs in Afghanistan or video games here at home.
Your gift will help with framing the prints, making the platform, printing the trading cards, and documenting the project with photographs and a book.  All together, it will cost about $10,000, and I'd like to raise half that now.    If I win Art Prize, a percentage of the proceeds will go to charities that help Afghan women.  If I don't win, its still a great opportunity to broaden the dialogue about the war on the 10th anniversary of September 11, 2001.

Spread the Word  
If you like this project, please share it with others.  Spread the word and make some noise.  Share it on Facebook and Twitter if you can.  And by all means, come on out to Grand Rapids to see the installation and/or the Art Prize festivities!  If you are planning the trip, let me know and maybe we can connect.  koenen@gmail.com

Thanks for your interest and your support.  It means a lot.

story:
My Story

Hello!  My name is Zena Verda Pesta and I am an artist and educator currently residing and working in Brooklyn, New York. My work is primarily made of the ancient stuff that takes billions and billions of years to come into existence and spans across the globe, CLAY!  I am very passionate about this mud, so much so, I have dedicated the last 8 years to touching it, molding it, throwing it, mixing it, and even making it gold.  I work primarily in a method called slip-casting, a high production level process but make small runs of edition pieces.  My largest and most prolific project to date consisted of a 1,000 piece installation at Socrates Sculpture Park in Long Island City, NY.  Making 36 pieces every day for 36 days = 1080!!!!! Below is a link.

http://www.socratessculpturepark.org/exhibitions/cityscape10.php

http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/05/01/looking-at-and-questioning-nature/

http://tmagazine.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/06/04/public-spectacles-art-in-plein-air/

 

 

 What I'm Doing

I have been invited to take part in a 3 week residency program in May at The Pottery Workshop in the "Porcelain capital of the world", Jingdezhen, China.  This residency is situated on the site of an old National Porcelain Company, which has been making porcelain ceramics for over one thousand years. This experimental factory is surrounded by hundreds of independent craftsmen and artists with every kind of ceramic skill imaginable; clay producers, throwers, sculptors, mould makers, blue and white decorators, over glaze decorators, and color shops, kiln firing workshops, brush makers, black smiths, box makers, and shippers.   Objects are from fingernail size to twelve feet high, all in porcelain. The possibilities for me are endless and the fountain of knowledge is overflowing, waiting for someone like me to scoop it up!  I can't express how excited I am just typing this out and thinking about this summer!  

This opportunity to travel and explore goes hand and hand with gaining knowledge, experience and is a wonderful creative outlet which would not just benefit me but further the education of many others in my community through the techniques I will learn and share This residency/workshop will allow me to further explore both handmade and mass produced through historical and culture context.  As an advocate of the handmade, and as someone who deals daily with the mass produced, this adventure would be a great discovery into a city built on the crossover between this dichotomy.   

 

What I Need & What You Receive in Return

Sadly, I am unable to fund this trip alone, and need help from all of you.  I am asking for your support to assist in helping to keep the spirit and excitement of the handmade alive! Your donation will be greatly appreciated and also compensated with some wonderful perks!

Donations will go towards the following expenses:

Flight from NYC to Shanghai:  1,300

Transportation to Jingdezhen:  100

Room and Board includes meals (except Sun), studio and translators to get you around the city: 1,150

For a grand total of.....2,550 to raise by the beginning of May.

 

I am a firm believer in,  “EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS” , so 1 dollar to even 20 dollars is a gracious gift!  

 

If all of this money is not raised, my trip will be shortened.


 

SPREAD THE WORD!!!!!!

In your company, amongst your friends and family, on your Facebook pages, Twitter accounts, and even by snail mail if you so wish - you never know who might stumble upon this campaign and decide it's worthy of their support.

story:
My brother just got a teaching position at a school for troubled kids in the inner city where he will be teaching art. They have no supplies due to the previous teacher taking them all (sounds like the teacher was also troubled). The program is called the "I'm ready program" and is located off Lyell Ave in Rochester, NY.  This school is a last resort for many teenagers in the Rochester area who have had trouble in traditional city schools. They only have a budget of $100 for supplies and as any of us art people know, that's not going far. Any supplies above and beyond the $100 budget will be coming out of my brother's pocket, any amount of donation is much appreciated as we all know Art is therapy and can certainly help these kids in grades 7-12. Thank you! :)

You may also email artsuppliesforkids@gmail.com if you would like a location to drop off supplies or donations can be dropped off at the school C/O Chris Blaine

Here is a link to the school http://www.rcsdk12.org/imready

story:
SEXPRESSION727 is dedicated to helping up and coming artistic minds such as authors, film makers, documentarians, photographers, painters, and sculpters bring their work into mainstream society.

My dream is to be able to search the country for the best and brightest minds in the erotic art industry and turn their art into a huge compilation book complete with interviews and pictures. Their art shouldnt have to sit in basements and attics just because it's different. I am so excited to do this project and be able to showcase their hard work and dedication to the world!

Your donations will go a long way in making their dreams a reality. Donations will go to the creation, publishing, marketing, promotion, and distribution of the book. If my project fuels over 100% (which i hope it will) I will be using it to fund my cross country trip to see and meet all the artists behind the work, photo document it and start work on book two! This project means a lot to me and every dollar counts! Help me help make their art known!

story:
We are taking our revered online platform,"Oden Gallery", and creating a physical presence in Vancouver, B.C. The gallery will be a modern inspired showcase of handcrafted home furnishings from North American Artisans and a place for discerning clients and art patrons to source, purchase and commission work. 

Oden will offer a collection of work from Oden's furniture artisans, as well as promote professional artists in the community and expand our offerings to include wall art, and furnishings made in metal, textile and ceramic. 

We hand-pick and represent artisans who have fine-tuned their craft. The work produced is rich in detail, seductive to the touch, employs the finest materials, and truly shines when experienced in person. Until now, potential clients could only source our work online, which kept them from experiencing the work first hand. A physical location will help us meet our artisans need for representation and product distribution as well as curate a full and empowered purchasing experience for clients.

  


Oden Gallery was founded in 2012 by artist, furniture maker, and entrepreneur Meredith Nicole. She built Oden on the dream to help professional artisans have a thriving, purposeful career by connecting their work to lovers of fine home furnishings. Currently, there are 12 Oden Artisans that reside in British Columbia, Ontario, California, Minnesota, Nebraska and Alaska. We are traditionally-trained or follow traditional building practices, and strive to offer this quality in fresh contemporary inspired one-of-a-kind or limited edition works.

We believe we are stewards of the earth and seek to leave it better than when we arrived. We do this by offering sustainable, non-toxic furniture made with intention and designed to last generations. Many of us have won awards for our work, are avid contributors to industry publications and teachers of our craft. Most importantly, we are professional, sincere and passionate about what we do.


Here are a few places we have been seen in and supported by! We deeply appreciate the support from media.

Hello! I'm so happy you are reading this because it's not just your-  financial support, but also your genuine interest that creates the possibility for this project to be a success! Possibility is my driving force, the sparkle in my eye and my favourite topic of conversation. I believe there is always so much more possibility than what's seen at the surface of any situation and I love to dive in to see the light! 

For me, Oden is about the possibility for artisans to have a radiant and flourishing career, and the opportunity to add value to the societal tapestry of economics, culture, community and legacy. It is about the clients who want furniture to serve a greater purpose than mere function but also act as a time capsule which ages gracefully with every scratch and spill of wine.  The artisan creations are for people who recognise and appreciate unique and fine craftsmanship in their lives. 

I love knowing our work holds the possibility to be the future antiques and heirlooms. I also love to throw a good party! I'm an avid participant in Vancouver's art community and come equipped with years of event planning experience. You can trust I will personally take great pleasure in hosting vibrant viewing nights at the gallery where people can engage with the work and artisans. So, look forward to radiant, educational and inspiring events!

See how the Ford Car company supports Meredith and her work.





It takes a community to build a community. Every dollar raised (after covering these incredible perks, and campaign fees) will be directed towards realising our goal of opening a physical gallery space. Specifically the funds will go towards:

  • 6 week business development program called Kick, which operates in 9 cities.  
  • Develop marketing and distribution channels for works by the artists.
  • Business plan development including financial model and sales strategy.
  • Marketing tools.
  • Partnership development with law firms, tech firms, accountant and gallery partners. 
Stretch Goal.

As we reach our $10,000 goal we will be able to take move faster and more independently through the next phase! 

$15,000- Secure gallery space.

$20,000- Complete the gallery space renovations.

$25,000- Secure our entire first order of product from artisans and artists!

WE LOVE YOU! Here is a special love note to our supporters for helping us reach $10,000! 



All of the perks on this campaign are provided or created by Artists and Artisans! They are inspired and brought to you with love and deep gratitude for believing in us and being an ambassador of North American craft. Here are just a few of them!


 


The incredible musicians on our Compilation CD!  




Share and Win our Ambassadors are Awesome Draw!

Please promote our campaign to your friends, facebook and twitter community. After connecting to our twitter and facebook page you will receive furniture care tips, updates and other fun surprises and we'd love to see you share them. Visibility and action are key to a successful campaign! Because you are so amazing we created an 
Ambassadors are Awesome Draw!

We are so excited to offer you the chance to win this sweet elegant handcrafted table light by Oden Artisan and head editor of Canadian Woodworking, Rob Brown! 



Earn 1 entry for the Ambassadors are Awesome Draw every time you share our campaign through your unique campaign link and someone clicks through to see what you are raving about!

Important Notes for entering the Ambassador Draw: To track your  share efforts you will need to be logged into the Indiegogo account when you use the Share Tools. You can also copy and paste the campaign URL displayed in your browser's address bar, as long as you are copying the URL that displays when you are logged into your Indiegogo account.

Without an Indiegogo account, you can still have your referrals tracked once you've contributed to our campaign. You will be presented a special URL immediately after contributing (on the completed contribution landing page, under "Spread the word!") just copy that link and share with your network.


A few special mentions to people who have already supported us!

Thank you for your time and love. 

-Erik Paulsson for the video. Erik's Website here

-Jenn Brisson for the animation on our video. See Jenn's art here!

-Sierra Elmore for our SM sharables! See Sierra's graphic design site!

- Kelly Warren at Pressing Media for your support with our CD Website

Until now, potential clients could only source our work online, which kept them from experiencing the work first hand. A physical location will help us meet our artisans need for representation and product distribution as well as curate a full and empowered purchasing experience for clients.  
Oden Gallery was founded in 2012 by artist, furniture maker, and entrepreneur Meredith Nicole. She built Oden on the dream to help professional artisans have a thriving, purposeful career by connecting their work to lovers of fine home furnishings. Currently, there are 12 Oden Artisans that reside in British Columbia, Ontario, California, Minnesota, Nebraska and Alaska. We are traditionally-trained or follow traditional building practices, and strive to offer this quality in fresh contemporary inspired one-of-a-kind or limited edition works.

We believe we are stewards of the earth and seek to leave it better than when we arrived. We do this by offering sustainable, non-toxic furniture made with intention and designed to last generations. Many of us have won awards for our work, are avid contributors to industry publications and teachers of our craft. Most importantly, we are professional, sincere and passionate about what we do.
Here are a few places we have been seen in and supported by! We deeply appreciate the support from media.


Hello! I'm so happy you are reading this because it's not just your-  financial support, but also your genuine interest that creates the possibility for this project to be a success! Possibility is my driving force, the sparkle in my eye and my favourite topic of conversation. I believe there is always so much more possibility than what's seen at the surface of any situation and I love to dive in to see the light! 

For me, Oden is about the possibility for artisans to have a radiant and flourishing career, and the opportunity to add value to the societal tapestry of economics, culture, community and legacy. It is about the clients who want furniture to serve a greater purpose than mere function but also act as a time capsule which ages gracefully with every scratch and spill of wine.  The artisan creations are for people who recognise and appreciate unique and fine craftsmanship in their lives. 

I love knowing our work holds the possibility to be the future antiques and heirlooms. I also love to throw a good party! I'm an avid participant in Vancouver's art community and come equipped with years of event planning experience. You can trust I will personally take great pleasure in hosting vibrant viewing nights at the gallery where people can engage with the work and artisans. So, look forward to radiant, educational and inspiring events!
See how the Ford Car company supports Meredith and her work.
It takes a community to build a community. Every dollar raised (after covering these incredible perks, and campaign fees) will be directed towards realising our goal of opening a physical gallery space. Specifically the funds will go towards:

6 week business development program called Kick, which operates in 9 cities.  
Develop marketing and distribution channels for works by the artists.
Business plan development including financial model and sales strategy.
Marketing tools.
Partnership development with law firms, tech firms, accountant and gallery partners. 

Stretch Goal.
As we reach our $10,000 goal we will be able to take move faster and more independently through the next phase! 
$15,000- Secure gallery space.
$20,000- Complete the gallery space renovations.$25,000- Secure our entire first order of product from artisans and artists!WE LOVE YOU! Here is a special love note to our supporters for helping us reach $10,000! 
All of the perks on this campaign are provided or created by Artists and Artisans! They are inspired and brought to you with love and deep gratitude for believing in us and being an ambassador of North American craft. Here are just a few of them!

 





The incredible musicians on our Compilation CD!  





Share and Win our Ambassadors are Awesome Draw!
Please promote our campaign to your friends, facebook and twitter community. After connecting to our twitter and facebook page you will receive furniture care tips, updates and other fun surprises and we'd love to see you share them. Visibility and action are key to a successful campaign! Because you are so amazing we created an Ambassadors are Awesome Draw!

We are so excited to offer you the chance to win this sweet elegant handcrafted table light by Oden Artisan and head editor of Canadian Woodworking, Rob Brown! 

Earn 1 entry for the Ambassadors are Awesome Draw every time you share our campaign through your unique campaign link and someone clicks through to see what you are raving about!
Important Notes for entering the Ambassador Draw: To track your  share efforts you will need to be logged into the Indiegogo account when you use the Share Tools. You can also copy and paste the campaign URL displayed in your browser's address bar, as long as you are copying the URL that displays when you are logged into your Indiegogo account.


Without an Indiegogo account, you can still have your referrals tracked once you've contributed to our campaign. You will be presented a special URL immediately after contributing (on the completed contribution landing page, under "Spread the word!") just copy that link and share with your network.


A few special mentions to people who have already supported us!
Thank you for your time and love. 
-Erik Paulsson for the video. Erik's Website here-Jenn Brisson for the animation on our video. See Jenn's art here!-Sierra Elmore for our SM sharables! See Sierra's graphic design site!
- Kelly Warren at Pressing Media for your support with our CD Website

story:
Hi! I'm Derrick. I'm an artist raising money for his future:

(1) A camera with a large digital sensor to make large photographic based artwork

(2)  travel expenses to Long Island to attend, perform, photograph and install artwork and sculpture @ the Fire Island Artist Residency (FIAR) in Mid-July

(3)  to work in collaboration with a large format printer, in order to print, mount and frame photographic work conceived at the FIAR, for exhibitions at the Center on Halsted in August & The ACRE Residency exhibition in September.

(4) and a studio space to realize ambitious projects to be exhibited nationally & internationally, that are currently beyond the means of an emerging artist.

As a current Chicago resident, my artwork: photography, performance, social practice, sculpture and installation, most often deals with my engagement with my surroundings. The forms of activism ingrained in the political landscape of Chicago, the city I call home, are not only those centered on civil rights seeking justice for people marginalized because of the color of their skin, but also robust action on behalf of LGBTQ rights, as well as the rights to one’s own body and sexual freedom. It is within this politically minded culture that my artistic practice has developed over the past 3 years. And yet, even within these  margins there exists prejudices suggesting who and what should be considered desirable, which has lead to even further marginalization of those people deemed non-normative. As an African American person who identifies as Queer, my personal investigations through art making are situated at the intersection of sexuality and race, intends to bring greater awareness & visibility to those facing stereotyping & prejudices.


(Above) From the Series: A Tale of Three Women, Cover Photograph- Additional subject as all inclusive as the negative - positive system of color (2015)


As a maker, I often draw from personal history, and examine the locations of homoerotic activity, racialized violence  and their relations to the mainstream ideals of masculinity circulating in American visual culture. I engage with people on a daily basis,  activating dialogue about gender identity, and race relations, suggesting to them, that their identities are not fixed and instead, constructed through their navigation of preconceived ideals. By doing so my intent is to gain insight into this exclusionary structure, understand better how it functions and further destabilize these fixed notions through my multimedia approach to art making.  


(Above)¨On Tuesday, October 12th, the room was red” (2016),  Letterpress mounted between glass with wooden frame (12” x 15”) 


My belief that the process of making art should possess social function has resulted in exhibitions and projects that challenges the audiences to consider where they place themselves in relation to manifestations of ideologies of race, of normative masculinity, and of sexuality. Doing so is my passion, and I have been extremely blessed that people are interested in supporting my mission and goals thus far.


(Above) From the series, The Whitewash Project, Marcus, known as a “philanthropist” - Courted in a Wrigleyville bar while intoxicated. (27:32 of courtmenship) (2014), Pigment Print, 38” x 52”


It had always been a dream of mine to study at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC), and at the time, I knew I would have to forego the financial stability I had achieved while living in Boston-leaving behind an organization (TERC) that inspired me on a daily basis. I did so, with their support of education, and wish that I never stop following my dreams.


(Above) From the Series, A Wild: "Only Because You Let Me" (2013-2014), Archival Inkjet Print, 24" x 36"


I am proud to say that as of May 2016, I have completed my MFA at the School of the Art institute of Chicago. While at SAIC, I worked exclusively with the amazing equipment and topnotch facilities that were available to me. Now that I have graduated, I am working to get the minimum parts in place to be able to produce my work: camera, access to printing, funds to acquire specific objects for installations and space. I hope that, the funds raised here will  help me situate and further prepare for more  amazing opportunities I have coming up for my future:


  • My First International exhibition: A Group Show @ Xpace Cultural Centre, a membership driven artist-run centre supported by the OCAD Student Union and dedicated to providing emerging and student artists and designers with the opportunity to showcase their work in a professional setting in Toronto, ON, from June 24th - August 6th
  • The Fire Island Residency(July 23rd- August 18th), the first residency in the United States exclusively for artists identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender or queer. Located in the secluded community of Cherry Grove, NY, an historic LGBTQ settlement of Fire Island, five emerging artists share a live/work space for a four-week program marked by intimate studio visits with, and public lectures by, renowned leaders in contemporary art and curation.
  • A Solo exhibition @ the Center on Halsted in Chicago (Opens August 19th) The Center on Halsted is the Midwest's most comprehensive community center dedicated to advancing community and securing the health and well-being of the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer (LGBTQ) people of Chicagoland. More than 1,000 community members visit the Center every day, located in the heart of Chicago's Lakeview Neighborhood.
  • The ACRE Residency exhibition (Opening in September),  an artist-run non-profit based in Chicago devoted to employing various systems of support for emerging artists and to creating a generative community of cultural producers. ACRE investigates and institutes models designed to help artists develop, present, and discuss their practices by providing forums for idea exchange, interdisciplinary collaboration, and experimental projects.
  • *** and a host of other opportunities I have currently applied for and haven't quite heard back from (I will update this page as I get more news)

(Above) No,We Mustn't Be / As They are / Without You (II) (2015) (multiple iterations) - treated railroad tie, varnish, lacquer, polyurethane, & black eyed peas,  9”(H) x 7”(D) X 96”(W) 

Fundraising Goals:

I’ve geared my fundraising goals into (4) tiers. My hope is that each tier function to accomplish a goal, and that each successive goal reached lead to accomplishing the next tier.

Tier 1 

As I develop a stable art practice, it is important for me to get the minimum parts in place to be able to produce my work: A camera with a large digital sensor to make large photographic based artwork ($4000), a small proofing printer ($300) and a dependable light kit ($300). This equipment would be used while attending the Fire Island Artist Residency to make new artwork centering on the ways I navigate this culture in the present day and would be foundational to my making in the future.


Tier 2 

 It's an honor to be invited to attend FIAR, but it is up to me to raise the funds for travel ($1000). For me this destination is key to realizing my upcoming art projects. Steeped in the history of the gay liberation movement, Fire Island is embedded in the history of a community that continues to forge a way for civil rights. My hope is to invoke the history of this place, bringing the past into heavy context, with its present state. One component of the sculptures I am developing, consist of nostalgic memorabilia from the past such as classic red wagons, rocket ships and other electronics and another component brings in close contact historically southern cuisine such as black eye'd peas with large scale objects ( together the amassing of these components cost an estimate of $1000).


Tier 3 

At SAIC, I have had access to state of the art printing facilities. As I develop a stable studio practice apart from those resources, it is important to me to work with locally owned and operated printers such as Document Printing Services and Latitude Chicago to realize future work. I am looking to produce (6) large-scale acrylic mounted photographs, developed from my experience at the Fire Island residency. Printed, mounted & framed these piece will cost roughly $400 each to produce for the exhibitions opening in the Fall: the Center on Halsted in August & ACRE residency exhibition in September.


Tier 4 

 Much of my art that has been well received in the past several years has been at the intersection studio photography and sculpture. As I have transitioned to life after graduate school, it is important for me to secure workspace in Chicago, where artist's studios are roughly $1.35 per square foot. In order to have a work area to be able to complete multiple projects (both sculptural & photographic), I need to budget approximately $3000 annually ($250 Per Month). My goal is to move into a studio upon my return from Fire Island this fall.


(Above) From The Series, A Tale of Three Women, Disappearing Reflectance Spectrum - 18% gray - In comparison to all things color ( Self-Representation as Venus) (2015)  (Diptych) 78” x 52”

My goals are to develop thought provoking images in the present in hopes that the future holds a place where we welcome people of all orientations and identifications. With your support you are allowing me to follow my passions and to help give greater visibility to marginalized people within our community. Whether I barely meet my goal, or get twice as much, I hope that you'll come to realize that I am highly appreciative to anyone and everyone who has taken the time out of their day to browse this page. If you are financially unable to give, and you feel so moved, please help spread the word.

Thank You,
Derrick Woods-Morrow

story:
Introduction

We are the BAM! Toronto Youth Slam Team for 2013-2014, otherwise known as BTdot. We consist of many talented poets with many accolades and slams under their belt. We have been invited to compete at Youth Speaks - Brave New Voices 2014 in Philadelphia! With the help of our coaches Patrick De Belen and Brian Millado we're hoping to bring crazy fire to Philadelphia this year at Brave New Voices and the other events we hope to competing at! This is a dream come true for all of our poets and we would appreciate any help that you can provide to help us get there! 

Here is a little bit about our members:

Ray Abergas is an 19 year old poet from Scarborough, Ontario, Canada. He was the captain of the 2012-2013 National Youth Slam team, BTdot. He is also the BAM! Toronto Youth Grand Slam Champion for the 2013-2014 season. He combines his relentless passion of helping others, poetry and performance to mold the person he is today. Ray has performed for a number of organizations like UNITY charity, UNIFFECT, RISE Poetry and and competed at Brave New Voices. When asked about why he loves spoken word poetry, he replies: "I think words can save lives and that's what I want to do".

Saredo Mohamed is a 18 year old poet from London, Ontario, Canada. She ventured into spoken word poetry in Grade 11, where she continued to present and compete at BAM! Toronto Youth Slam. Saredo became the BAM! Toronto Youth Slam Grand Slam Champion for the 2012-2013 season, and has been featured in an article by Metro newspaper. Saredo uses her experiences with race, immigration and travel as inspiration for her work, and hopes to inspire others with her poetry.

Ida Sophia is a 19 year old MC and spoken word poet from Toronto, Ontario. She was first introduced to the spoken word scene at 16, attending the Drake Hotel to compete and watch others perform. Ida's inspiration thrives through her love of music and Hip Hop. Quick wordplay and crafty tongue twisters give her poetry a distinct rhythm and flow. Aside from music, her team mates continue to inspire her artistic growth. In 2013 she competed for a spot in the Toronto Poetry Slam team at the finals and is now an active member of Bam Youth Slam 2014

At the age of 18, Berma is a wordsmith who's passion cannot be questioned. As a member of Spoken Ward, UNIFFECT, and the 2013 National youth championship team, BTdot, he has honed his ability to perform and enjoys spilling his soul on the stage. At a young age, Berma encountered many hardships only to come out stronger. He uses his words to speak out on issues that affected him and to help those who are dealing with the same things. Whether its talking about sports, music, or even the weather, Berma is a character that can't be missed.

Hailing from Toronto, Ontario, Karel La Guardia is a spoken word artist who's goal is to bring light to the stage. He is a member of the BAM! Toronto Youth Poetry Slam team, BTdot, who've recently competed in Brave New Voices and placed first in Canada's national youth slam, YouthCanSlam. Trying to take inspiration from his ever changing generation, Karel's poetry radiates the personality, attitudes, and energy of today's youth. When he's not out making his audience smile with his poetry, Karel is an avid music listener, tv show binger, and breakfast eater. If he's not bringing joy to others in his performance, you can be sure Karel is out somewhere making somebody's day, awesome.

Brian Lanigan is 19 years old and reads poetry to anyone who will listen in Toronto, Ontario. Though new to the poetry scene, Brian has already performed at numerous competitions across the GTA as both a competitor and featured artist (alongside the BTdot team). Brian has led poetry workshops at his high school and enjoys showing his peers that anyone make a living out of doing what they love. He also hopes to use poetry to reach out to those in need of a creative outlet. Both Brian's passion for poetry and drive to succeed make him someone to remember

The Breakdown

The $1500 that we hope to raise will go towards:- Event Registration Fees (Fun fact: Brave New Voices, the largest youth slam festival in the world, has a $1250 team registration fee alone!)
- Transportation
- Lodging
- Food, supplies, etc. 

Funds collected will be divided up towards the fees (registration, lodging, travel, etc.) of the following spoken word events and festivals:
- SLAMtario: July 11th-12th(Toronto)
- Brave New Voices: July 16th-20th
- Canadian Festival of Spoken Word YouthCanSlam: August 20-25 (Ottawa)
- And more to be announced!

The Impact

Spoken word poetry is an artform that almost anybody can do and is accessible to everyone. You don't even need a pen and paper. All you need are your thoughts. Spoken word poetry can cover any issue: race, violence, immigration, you name it. Your voice is the most powerful tool that you can ever use. As poets, we want to show youth that you can use poetry to save yourselves from the problems that you have on a daily basis. Spoken word poetry saves lives, and some of our poets are living examples of that. 

By supporting us, you're helping us show the world our voices. You're supporting a cause that is trying to change lives for the better and maybe even save a life. We are trying to raise awareness on topics that we feel aren't getting enough attention, as well as telling our stories and the stories of people who have inspired us and moved us in so many ways. 

Other Ways You Can Help

- Follow us on twitter! twitter.com/BTdot for future updates!
- Spread the word! Word of mouth is the best way to raise awareness! 
- Check us out on Youtube! Youtube.com/user/SpokenWard ! Like, comment, share, subscribe! Any help will be greatly appreciated!
- Share this page! We can use all the help we can get! 

SUPPORT THE B.TDOT / BAM! TORONTO YOUTH POETRY SLAM TEAM OF 2013-2014!
