story:
Our Story

San Quentin's Prison Arts Project is a role model of community arts programming, funded by the William James Association, a non-profit which has supported arts in California prisons since 1977. The Prison Arts Project at San Quentin has continued despite the ending of the 30-year-old state supported Arts-in-Corrections program in 2010. Inmates who participate regularly in arts programming have significantly lower recidivism (return-to-prison) rates and fewer behavioral problems in prison, which saves the public significant money and is more humane. Since 90% of inmates will parole to our communities, it's important that they've had the opportunity to grow, change and develop skills and self-esteem. (Please visit www.williamjamesassociation.org for more information.)
 
The inmate designed mural depicts a fantasy town, providing a beautiful and comforting image for the dining hall; the design is by Scott McKinstry, who will be heading the mural crew for this work. Under the supervision of Patrick Maloney, who has taught at San Quentin for 24 years, the inmates will create a 64' x 7' mural in acrylics. It continues a tradition of dining hall murals, since there is a fantastic historically preserved 600' 6-part mural already there created by Alfredo Santos 60 years ago. (http://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/19/arts/design/1...) The mural crew has tremendous talent and experience, and some samples of their previous San Quentin work is in the 'gallery' tab.

The Impact

Mural art in prisons helps reduce tension in a very tense environment. The mural crew and studio also offer a rare sanctuary in prison, where inmates, who are normally segregated by race and other factors, work side by side in peace. The opportunity to create a beautiful, permanent artwork will provide great personal growth for the artists, and help improve the quality of life for the thousands of incarcerated viewers and correctional staff.

What We Need & What You Get

The mural will be done in acrylic paint, and Utrecht Art Supply in Berkeley is offering a 20% discount and free delivery to support this project. All funds will go directly to art supplies through the non-profit William James Association, a 501(c)3. The Marin Community Foundation has again offered a grant to help support the Prison Arts Project, and the grant requires matching funds, so the donations here are doubled by the MCF!
 
For a $10 contribution, WJA will send you a postcard of thanks; for $25, WJA will send you a 4x6 photo of the mural proposal; for $50, you'll receive a 5x7 photo. For $100 you will receive an original print from the printmaking workshop at San Quentin! Also, Peter Merts, a volunteer photographer will be documenting the mural and its progress, and those images will be posted here and ultimately on the WJA website.
 
Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this way to help support a great community art project to your friends through Facebook and email and however else you can!

story:
Our Story

Coffee Talks is the title of a project that aims to open up a discussion about the state of arts in public space of the city of Zurich. The intention is to seize the opportunity to create temporary interventions in the urban landscape of the city. This project started from a conversation between Candida Pestana (curator), Susana Pedrosa (artist) and André Catalão (artist). The main idea started in a coffee shop during a random discussion about the need to research and approach public space. Lately this necessity of presence in the space created a link involving the artists Cornelia Heusser and Niklaus Rüegg.  

As site-specific and event-driven, Coffee Talks aims to address multiple audiences, shake up the city dynamics by occupying and creating small-scale events in the public domain, and open up the possibilities for sharing the vision behind those events, specifically through performative actions, with anyone who takes part. 

The proposals of the involved artists challenges the public by raising urgent questions about the limits of the law. It is important to discuss public space as something that we are used to sharing. However, normally there are no references telling us how far we can go. The methodology applied in this collaboration is based on an exhaustive investigation about the relevant legal parameters centered predominantly on legal institutional entities; these are related to the notion and practice of justice, to the Swiss constitution, and to the cultural and subcultural urban groups whose primary nature is rooted in the visual arts. The research permits integration between the artistic context, on the one hand, and the context of the public law on the other, thus creating a natural platform for dialogue concerning the aforementioned issues.

The artists are working with a clear collaborative spirit, investing in strong community engagement as a part of their operations. This engagement will define the outcome of their joint work. The resulting work will manifest itself publicly in a series of events: a exhibition at Perla-Mode: message salon, located in one of core and fast-living areas in the city of Zurich (Langstrasse). This urban zone - an ideal location for critical observation of the issues of legality and power in public space - has been intentionally chosen as a main punctum of the final display. Given its local reputation (known for immigration, prostitution, second-hand shops, and art galleries) it becomes a zone of transformative potential, inevitably connected to the everyday life practices rooted in the politics of the place.


The Impact

For this project to happen in these dimensions, it needs financial support. The involved parties already invested all available resources for this project to transpire. Without your help this project cannot achieve the proportions that we are working for, including the live events, the symposium, and the publication. Thanks to the true commitment of all artists involved and the other participants, this project has developed even further. At the moment we are working on a low cost basis: we already created a web-platform, and we are now looking to local sponsors, and to the goodwill of our associates, in order to finance the necessary materials.

We need your help to make this idea grow and to make it visible to the public, to be seen, to be discussed, and to create an impact in the local culture.  Finding the resources to do a publication will permit an expansion of this local experience onto an international level. In advance I would like to thank all possible collaborators for believing in this idea.

 

What We Need

Our main financial goal is to pay for all of the material for this project, which includes:

Flyers (design and print): $200

Booklets (design and print): $300

Design: $300

Material for the artists: $200

Symposium: $500

Resources to document all the events: $200

Travel costs: $200

Transportation of the pieces: $100

Total: $2000

If the goal is not reached the money will be used to cover the material for the artists and the transportation. The project will still happen but it will be limited according to the financial conditions.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This project will take place in Zurich, and everyone is invited to participate and to be part of it. If you want to collaborate with us please email us at coffeetalkszurich@gmail.com and we will update you about when and where the events will take place. Please also share this project with all your contacts. For further information please consult our blog: http://coffeetalkszurich.wordpress.com/

 

 

Design by Renato Silva

story:
Public health matters, and public art is powerful. Let's bring them together in Naco, Mexico and Bisbee, Arizona.

In these two communities we have an amazing opportunity to promote better health along the border. We've been working on this project for five months and it's time to be there in person and help see this through.

Hi! My name is Nathan Hewitt and I am a fourth-year student at the University of Kentucky, currently studying Music Performance and Arts Administration. (I'm also the General Manager of WRFL, the University's student-run radio station, a Fellow at the Gaines Center for the Humanities, and the Founder of the UK Arts Administration Society.) 

This spring break (March 16-21), I plan to travel to Naco, Mexico to start laying the groundwork for an exciting new project. But I need your help!

Here are the basics:

The Naco-Bisbee Mural Project

The Naco-Bisbee Mural Project is a new bi-national public art initiative, focused on promoting better public health at the US-Mexico border and bringing two communities together through artistic collaboration. Grade school students and community members from both towns will work through local artist Pablo Pencil to design and paint murals which will  promote good health.

Pablo has laid out an amazing framework, through which school children from both sides of the border will be able to help formulate the murals' designs. Next, community members will take part in the physical creation of the mural with Pablo's help. This creates greater community ownership and increases the murals' impact.

The project is a recipient of support through the Clinton Global Initiative University program, but funds will be directed towards the murals, not travel, and will not be received until later this year.

Project Leaders

Here's a rundown of who else is is leading the project: 

My main partner in the project is fellow student Kaylee Hicks an International Studies and Biology major at the University of Kentucky. With undergraduate experience in civic deliberation and public health systems research, Kaylee is in the process of publishing her second paper on community health needs assessments quality. Her goal is to serve rural communities in Latin America through culturally sensitive education and preventive care. Kaylee is a Junior Fellow at the Gaines Center for the Humanities and is a member of UK’s Honors Program, Phi Kappa Phi Honor Society, and Alpha Delta Pi Sorority.

Our contact in Bisbee, Tom Carlson, leads the Naco Wellness Initiative (NWI) alongside several leaders in the community. During his years in Bisbee, Tom has become increasingly concerned with his Mexican neighbors’ limited opportunities for well-being. However, he knew that providing them with acute care would not be enough to stop the socioeconomic causes of Naco’s main illnesses. So, in true public health spirit, he set about forming NWI with numerous partners on both sides of the border. NWI’s notable successes include educational workshops, exercise classes, a blood glucose testing program, and a community gardens project.

Our artist/facilitator for the project is Pablo Pencil, a cornerstone of the Bisbee arts community. From painting murals on historic buildings to creating the flyers for local events, his artistic mark is all over town. In his pre-Bisbee life, Pablo worked as a professional scenic and lighting designer, and a technical director in the theater world and was employed as an assistant to designers at the Boston Ballet Company and the Opera Company of Boston. He taught drawing and sculpture at Plymouth State College and was Artist-in-Residence for the state of New Hampshire. 

Pablo has resided in Bisbee for the last 20 years, and he keeps himself busy with creative activities such as a cartooning, caricature drawing, mural painting, and building. Here is a taste of the sort of amazing work he plans to do through the project: 

We have contacts in Naco through the Naco Wellness Initiative and have made contact with the mayors of both communities. Additionally, we are receiving advisement from the University of Arizona, the University of Kentucky, and through the Clinton Global Initiative.

Our Beginnings

The Naco-Bisbee Mural Project began as a summer trip in July 2015. Kaylee was working with Naco Wellness Initiative, a community health nonprofit, when she was struck by the prevalence of mural advertisements in Latino communities. She wondered how we could use that medium to make a positive impact on the community’s health.

On that same trip, Kaylee made our first mural (see below). She received a lot of great positive feedback from nearby community members.

What Now?

The project we now propose is a continuation of the work Kaylee began this summer. The first step for us in the concrete execution of the project is to travel there again and get the ball rolling. Through Tom, I will be able to meet with many different members of the community and begin to select mural sites. 

The Budget

flight: $340 (CVG-AZA rountrip, Allegiant)

travel airport-Bisbee: $160 ($80 each way)

(lodging will be provided)

total: $500

The Bottom Line

I need your help to make an impact in Naco and Bisbee. In order to solidify the project, it is important for me to travel to speak in person with the community members involved. Please consider donating or sharing this campaign so that we can start building momentum towards the painting of these murals in the summer or fall of 2016! No contribution is too small.

Adelante! 

Nathan
story_txt:
Public health matters, and public art is powerful. Let's bring them together in Naco, Mexico and Bisbee, Arizona.


In these two communities we have an amazing opportunity to promote better health along the border. We've been working on this project for five months and it's time to be there in person and help see this through.


Hi! My name is Nathan Hewitt and I am a fourth-year student at the University of Kentucky, currently studying Music Performance and Arts Administration. (I'm also the General Manager of WRFL, the University's student-run radio station, a Fellow at the Gaines Center for the Humanities, and the Founder of the UK Arts Administration Society.) 

This spring break (March 16-21), I plan to travel to Naco, Mexico to start laying the groundwork for an exciting new project. But I need your help!


Here are the basics:
The Naco-Bisbee Mural Project
The Naco-Bisbee Mural Project is a new bi-national public art initiative, focused on promoting better public health at the US-Mexico border and bringing two communities together through artistic collaboration. Grade school students and community members from both towns will work through local artist Pablo Pencil to design and paint murals which will  promote good health.
Pablo has laid out an amazing framework, through which school children from both sides of the border will be able to help formulate the murals' designs. Next, community members will take part in the physical creation of the mural with Pablo's help. This creates greater community ownership and increases the murals' impact.
The project is a recipient of support through the Clinton Global Initiative University program, but funds will be directed towards the murals, not travel, and will not be received until later this year.


Project Leaders


Here's a rundown of who else is is leading the project: 



My main partner in the project is fellow student Kaylee Hicks an International Studies and Biology major at the University of Kentucky. With undergraduate experience in civic deliberation and public health systems research, Kaylee is in the process of publishing her second paper on community health needs assessments quality. Her goal is to serve rural communities in Latin America through culturally sensitive education and preventive care. Kaylee is a Junior Fellow at the Gaines Center for the Humanities and is a member of UK’s Honors Program, Phi Kappa Phi Honor Society, and Alpha Delta Pi Sorority.


Our contact in Bisbee, Tom Carlson, leads the Naco Wellness Initiative (NWI) alongside several leaders in the community. During his years in Bisbee, Tom has become increasingly concerned with his Mexican neighbors’ limited opportunities for well-being. However, he knew that providing them with acute care would not be enough to stop the socioeconomic causes of Naco’s main illnesses. So, in true public health spirit, he set about forming NWI with numerous partners on both sides of the border. NWI’s notable successes include educational workshops, exercise classes, a blood glucose testing program, and a community gardens project.




Our artist/facilitator for the project is Pablo Pencil, a cornerstone of the Bisbee arts community. From painting murals on historic buildings to creating the flyers for local events, his artistic mark is all over town. In his pre-Bisbee life, Pablo worked as a professional scenic and lighting designer, and a technical director in the theater world and was employed as an assistant to designers at the Boston Ballet Company and the Opera Company of Boston. He taught drawing and sculpture at Plymouth State College and was Artist-in-Residence for the state of New Hampshire. 
Pablo has resided in Bisbee for the last 20 years, and he keeps himself busy with creative activities such as a cartooning, caricature drawing, mural painting, and building. Here is a taste of the sort of amazing work he plans to do through the project: 


We have contacts in Naco through the Naco Wellness Initiative and have made contact with the mayors of both communities. Additionally, we are receiving advisement from the University of Arizona, the University of Kentucky, and through the Clinton Global Initiative.



Our Beginnings

The Naco-Bisbee Mural Project began as a summer trip in July 2015. Kaylee was working with Naco Wellness Initiative, a community health nonprofit, when she was struck by the prevalence of mural advertisements in Latino communities. She wondered how we could use that medium to make a positive impact on the community’s health.

On that same trip, Kaylee made our first mural (see below). She received a lot of great positive feedback from nearby community members.

What Now?
The project we now propose is a continuation of the work Kaylee began this summer. The first step for us in the concrete execution of the project is to travel there again and get the ball rolling. Through Tom, I will be able to meet with many different members of the community and begin to select mural sites. 
The Budget
 flight: $340 (CVG-AZA rountrip, Allegiant)
travel airport-Bisbee: $160 ($80 each way)
(lodging will be provided)
total: $500

The Bottom Line

I need your help to make an impact in Naco and Bisbee. In order to solidify the project, it is important for me to travel to speak in person with the community members involved. Please consider donating or sharing this campaign so that we can start building momentum towards the painting of these murals in the summer or fall of 2016! No contribution is too small.
Adelante! 
Nathan

story:
Bref résumé

Les contributeurs financent des idées qui leur plaisent et des personnes en qui ils ont confiance. Voici quelques pistes à suivre dans cette section :

Le BAM est une occasion pour réunir les différentes formes d'art de la scène de Québec. Les étudiantEs du Conservatoire d'Art Dramatique de Québec, du Conservatoire de Musique de Québec, de L'École de danse de Québec, de l'École de Cirque de Québec ainsi que du programme en Théâtre de l'Université Laval sentent le besoin de se découvrir entre eux!  C'est pourquoi une équipe formée d'étudiantEs provenant de chaque écoles travaille à l'élaboration d'un évènement qui permettrait à la relève des différents milieux de dialoguer dans le cadre d'une création multidisciplinaire/transdisciplinaire/interdisciplinaire.

Pendant une fin de semaine, les étudiantEs sélectionnéEs auront accès à différents espaces du complexe Méduse.

Les chanceux seront groupés en quatre équipes et devront (pendant une fin de semaine seulement!) créer un spectacle dans un espace du complexe Méduse. Attention! Pour leur rendre la vie un peu plus difficile, des contraintes vont leur être attribuées. Ça va mettre un peu de piquant!

Parrainées par des experts de différents milieux des arts de la scène, les équipes créeront un court spectacle et présenteront le fruit de leur travail à l'ouverture du Festival de Théâtre de L'Université Laval (FTUL) le 8 Mars 2016.

Les experts pour cette année sont :

Keith Kouna

Véronika Makdissi-Warren

Harold Rhéaume

Olivier Normand


Cette année, c'est la première édition du BAM. Et on veut que ce soit gros. On veut que les milieux se mélangent. Chaque forme artistique a beaucoup à apprendre de l'autre. Ça fait longtemps qu'on attend ça. On veut que ça revienne. Chaque année jusqu'à l'infini.

Nous, étudiants provenant des différentes écoles des arts de la scène, on est tous d'accord: on ne se mélange pas assez entre nous! Le BAM sera l'occasion pour nous de dialoguer avec les autres, mais surtout, de créer ensemble. Une première pour la relève à Québec.


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

On utilise les locaux du Complexe Méduse, on a des techniciens à payer, des mentors à payer, du transport à prévoir (un décor mettons, ça se déplace souvent difficilement à bout de bras), un budget à fournir aux équipes pour leurs créations, des imprévus. Ça nous prend de l'argent! On aimerait aussi, éventuellement, réduire les coûts de participation à la création. Cette année, les étudiants inscrits devront débourser 40$ pour participer à la fin de semaine de création.

En plus, on va vous donner quelques gâteries en échange de vos dons: faites le bon choix!

D'autres façons d'aider

C'est un évènement qui va fesser! On aimerait tellement ça que vous veniez! Pis que vos amis viennent aussi! Ah pis votre famille un coup parti!

Bon, maintenant que tout le monde que vous connaissez viennent, faites en sorte que les autres aussi:

https://www.facebook.com/BOUILLONMULTI/

aimez, partagez, mais surtout : parlez-en!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Del of Del's Doodles. I'm both an avid illustrator and proponent of copious sass and swearing. I'm combining both of these loves into a colouring book full of beautiful, profane, high-attitude mandalas!


The book will be titled "I Colour So I Don't Kill People" and will contain thirty hand-drawn, original mandala designs, each with a fun subversive slogan for the days where the world can go eat itself, the days where you are the most fabulous creature on earth, the days where you just don't give a crap.


What I Need & What You Get

I need to draw. Drawing requires time, art supplies, cats, and coffee (lots of coffee). The money raised will help me pay for all of those things and, of course, will cover the costs of a print run of the book through a local printing service and postage for me to send you your very own copy. I'm using an actual proper honest-to-goodness local print service for this book. They're close enough that I can liaise with them personally about paper quality and general aesthetic finish of the book, to make sure that the end product is as freaking beautiful as it deserves it to be for your maximum colouring pleasure.

You can choose from several fun rewards - a small digital download pack, a digital pack of the full book, the full physical print book - and even a special, personalised and signed copy.


Book Features:

  • 30 original, unique mandala designs each containing a sassy, subversive phrase
  • Square format, 22cm x 22cm
  • Heavy front and back cover that's also colourable
  • Thick, good quality, bright white paper suitable for a range of colouring media; pencils and fineliners will be fine, and the paper will be thick enough to support alcohol-based markers (Sharpies, Copics, Spectrum Noir, etc.) without bleeding over the lines (though given their nature they will bleed through to the other side, which is why I'll be printing just one image per side).


Shipping:

I live in South Africa and the book is being printed here, so unfortunately it's a little spendy to ship overseas. 
  • Local shipping within South Africa will cost $10 USD
  • Worldwide shipping to anywhere else in the world will cost $15 USD

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, don't worry - you can still help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share the campaign page on Twitter, on your Facebook wall, in your colouring groups. Let all of your colouring friends know where they can pre-purchase these awesome, original designs!
  • IndieGoGo has built-in tools for sharing to make your life easier - just look for the social media icons at the top left of the page and click away!

story:
LoveProjections.com

         Is a website my family and I are trying to launch this spring. Zen J. Jackson; a visual artist, children's book author, and husband to Denise Clarke; a musician, visual artist, author, screenwriter, and break-dancer. Both parents to Rosslyn; a 7-year-old children's book author, painter, and break-dancer with newcomer Sol, due to be born on May 10,2014.

         LoveProjections.com will host all of our years of collected works. You will be able to order prints, t-shirts, books, albums, and much more, all designed and hand-crafted by our family, friends, and loved ones; all projecting Love and a Universal message. This campaign will allow us to launch our first website allowing us to spread Love across the world.

         Contributors will assist us in expenses towards initial, website launching, such as copyright fees, trademark fees, design fees, and web-hosting fees. Once the website is launched, proceeds from our sales and creations will build schools here in America, and all across the globe in third-world-countries. We also will be donating our proceeds to children who have been abused and neglected across the world. Help us make a difference! Help us spread the message of Love, peace, unity, and positive change!

         Your donations, no matter the amount, will go directly towards the launching of LoveProjections.com and its initial fees to get started. You will receive website thank-yous, original artwork, and be the first to experience autographed, visual art, prints of our books and paintings, or clothing and promotional merchandise depending on the size of your donation. Again, we will not stop until our mission is complete, so your one dollar will be a contribution towards future schools for children in need.

       Want to experience the value of our message first-hand? Denise Clarke has music videos on youtube.com. Simply search Denise Clarke. Also you can download her music FOR FREE at deniseartista.bandcamp.com

story:
Για βίντεο στα Ελληνικά πατήστε Εδώ 

CYCLE 4 SUSTAINABILITY – THE TOUR BEGINS  (Ακολουθεί το κείμενο στα Ελληνικά  Αυτόνομος Ποδηλάτης -Πετάλι για το φώς)

 Who Am I

My name is Spyros Tsiknas, I live in Athens, I have a son, and I have studied and work in the fields of renewable energy sources and representative arts.

I am a member of Spithari-Walking Life, a project located in the suburbs of Athens (Marathon area). We are a group of people working on a testing ground which is desertified by fires. For the last three years, we put our great effort into the creation of a sustainable environment that will enable us to cover our needs in energy, food, and lodging while sharing the knowledge of above scopes.   

I am involved in the coordination of a workshop for sustainability & art which will take place in the Solidarity, Sustainability and Creation Festival. Moreover, I participate in the production of the theatrical play titled The Final and will be presented in theatre of Vyrsodepsio.  Both projects explore the field of sustainable art and their electricity needs will be fully covered by the cycle power generator.


Why Cycle 4 sustainability?

The direct relation of human power to electricity production / consumption is a starting point for opening discussions and increasing awareness on environmental and social issues. With activism immerging to art, I will ride the cycle power generator and start a tour shedding light on events related to sustainability and social ecology. The tour will start in two months. 

TheCycleTouring

 30-31-01 May 2014.The first stop of the tour is on the three day Solidarity, Sustainability and Creation Festival, a free entrance event located on the coastal suburbs of Athens (Camping Voula), a place which is due to privatization under terms defined by local- global economic interests. The Festival includes numerous workshops for practicing towards the sustainability of the environment, the society and our selves. A workshop for construction of the cycle power generator will be organized, which will illuminate a children’s (theatrical) interactive play under the trees.

June 2014. The second stop is at the Contemporary Greek Writers platform in the Theatre of Vyrsodepsio, where the theatrical play titled “The Final”, which I wrote in 2013, will be presented.  It is a story about a family leasing- from a SEZ (Special Economic Zone) - a cycler with a cycle generator so as to watch the football final from the energy produced by the cycler. However, the children of the family have a different perception of the situation....

Autumn 2014: In Autumn 2014, the presentation, application and use of Cycle Generator in schools for educational and artistic purposes will be forwarded such as the collaboration with fellow artists and activists.

Needs

This campaign aims to gather the amount of 1500 euros, which will be spent as follows:

Ø  Construction of the base and the mechanism of the cycle generator (including labour cost)

Ø  Capacitor with volt meter

Ø  Lights

Ø  Cables, switches, diodes, etc.

Ø   Extra equipment: Inverter or Battery or Battery charger

Ø  Also a part of the touring travel expenses and support of the fellow artists creating the video and the poster will be covered. Plus the Ιndiegogo platform fees and any other fees for the transactions. 

Social Impact & Future Aims

As a member of the Spithari –Walking Life I have worked for the completion of free entrance -open source- seminars in the fields of natural farming, permaculture, biodynamics, natural building, renewable energy sources, trying to spread the news about other ways to cover our needs.  I find joy when humans are able to work with nature such as to work with each other in peace. 

As an actor I enjoyed working, for a short period, with children with special abilities – needs, in the theatrical group of Very Special Arts Athens. Thus, I want to present Cycle for Sustainability to this group and also I would like to approach social groups which are oppressed or marginalized by the majority, as a part of the project’s tour.

Moreover, I want to collaborate with artists & activists in order to explore the field of sustainable art, namely a field where art and activism immerge. An approach to the Academy of Arts has already taken place, and I am in close contact with several teams of activists.  I believe that it is crucial to connect the movement of social ecology to art so as to upgrade aesthetic and awake awareness in our lives. As an example, we can organize artistic events of neighborhoods, showing people how to make a roof permaculture garden in apartment blocks, or presentations of the application and use of the cycle generator, which will give the opportunity to anyone who has no electricity access to consider this even low efficient way to light up his/hers space on demand, while keeping fit.

Through Cycle 4 Sustainability, I want to express what is alive in me. Seek after – and shed light on answers related to the everyday struggle of people who try to cover their basic needs.

Other ways you can help

Not everybody has the ability to help out financially, but you can also…

  • Tell your friends about this project.


ΑΥΤΟΝΟΜΟΣ ΠΟΔΗΛΑΤΗΣ - Πετάλι για το φως

Ποιός είμαι

Ονομάζομαι Σπύρος Τσίκνας, ζω στην Αθήνα, έχω ένα γιό, έχω σπουδάσει και εργάζομαι στους τομείς των ανανεώσιμων πηγών ενέργειας και των παραστατικών τεχνών.

Είμαι μέλος του Σπιθάρι –WalkingLife, το οποίο είναι ένα ομαδικό εγχείρημα στα περίχωρα της Αθήνας (περιοχή του Μαραθώνα). Διανύουμε τον τρίτο χρόνο δράσης σε μια έκταση ερημοποιημένη από τις φωτιές του 2009, επικεντρώνοντας τις προσπάθειές μας στην κάλυψη των αναγκών μας στους τομείς της ενέργειας, της διατροφής και της στέγασης, διαδίδοντας ταυτόχρονα τη γνώση στα παραπάνω πεδία. 

Συμμετέχω στη διοργάνωση του ανοιχτού Φεστιβάλ Αλληλεγγύης, Βιωσιμότητας & Δημιουργίας,στο πεδίο της Βιώσιμης Τέχνης. Επίσης, συμμετέχω στην παραγωγή του θεατρικού έργου «Ο ΤΕΛΙΚΟΣ»- το οποίο θα παρουσιαστεί στο θέατρο Βυρσοδεψείο. Και τα δύο projects εξερευνούν το πεδίο της βιώσιμης τέχνης και οι ενεργειακές τους ανάγκες θα καλυφθούν πλήρως από την ποδήλατο – γεννήτρια.   

Τι σημαίνει Αυτόνομος Ποδηλάτης;

Ο άμεσος συσχετισμός ανθρώπινης ενέργειας και παραγωγής / κατανάλωσης ηλεκτρικής ενέργειας είναι το εναρκτήριο σημείο ανοικτών συζητήσεων και αυξανόμενης ευαισθητοποίησης πάνω σε περιβαλλοντικά και κοινωνικά ζητήματα. Ενώνοντας ακτιβισμό και τέχνη, θα ανεβώ στο ποδήλατο –γεννήτρια και θα ξεκινήσω μια πορία, ρίχνοντας φως σε δρώμενα που σχετίζονται με τη βιωσιμότητα και την κοινωνική οικολογία. Το ταξίδι θα ξεκινήσει σε δύο μήνες.

30-31-01 2014 Μαΐου: Η πρώτη στάση του ταξιδιού είναι το Φεστιβάλ Αλληλεγγύης, Βιωσιμότητας & Δημιουργίας, το οποίο διοργανώνεται στο Camping Βούλας, σε παράκτιο μέρος, που, λόγω διαδικασιών ιδιωτικοποίησης, ελέγχεται υπό τους όρους τοπικών-παγκόσμιων οικονομικών συμφερόντων. Το Φεστιβάλ είναι ανοιχτό στον κόσμο και περιλαμβάνει εργαστήρια σε τομείς που σχετίζονται με την βιωσιμότητα του περιβάλλοντος, της κοινωνίας και του εαυτού μας. Στα πλαίσια του Φεστιβάλ θα πραγματοποιηθεί εργαστήριο κατασκευής ποδηλατογεννήτριας, με την οποία θα φωταγωγήσουμε μια  διαδραστική παιδική παράσταση κάτω απ τα δέντρα.

Ιούνιος 2014: Η επόμενη στάση είναι η πλατφόρμα Σύγχρονων Ελλήνων Συγγραφέων στο Θέατρο Βυρσοδεψείο. Εκεί θα γίνει παρουσίαση του έργου «Ο ΤΕΛΙΚΟΣ», το οποίο έγραψα το 2013. Είναι η ιστορία μιας οικογένειας η οποία μισθώνει, από μια Ειδική Οικονομική Ζώνη (Ε.Ο.Ζ.), έναν ποδηλάτη και μια ποδήλατο-γεννήτρια ώστε να τους παράγει ρεύμα για να δούνε το τελικό ποδοσφαίρου. Τα δύο παιδιά της οικογένειας όμως έχουν διαφορετική αντίληψη των γεγονότων…

Φθινόπωρο 2014: To Φθινόπωρο του 2014 θα προωθηθεί η παρουσίαση, εφαρμογή και χρήση της ποδήλατο – γεννήτριας στα σχολεία για εκπαιδευτικούς σκοπούς καθώς και η συνεργασίαμε καλλιτέχνες και ακτιβιστές. 

Τι χρειάζομαι:

Αυτή η καμπάνια έχει ως στόχο να συγκεντρώσει το ποσό των 1500 Ευρώ, τo  οποίo θα χρησιμοποιηθεί για τα παρακάτω έξοδα του εγχειρήματος:

Ø  Κατασκευή βάσης  και μηχανισμός Π/Γ (περιλαμβάνοντας το εργατικό κόστος)

Ø  Πυκνωτής με ποτενσιόμετρο

Ø  Φωτισμός

Ø  Extra εξοπλισμός: Αντιστροφέας, ή μπαταρία, ή ρυθμιστής φόρτισης

Ø  παρελκόμενα : καλώδια , διακόπτες, δίοδοι κτλ.

Ø  Επιπλέον θα καλυφθεί μέρος των εξόδων ταξιδίου και λειτουργίας του εγχειρήματος καθώς και ενίσχυση των φίλων καλλιτεχνών που δημιούργησαν το βίντεο και την αφίσα, πλέον των αμοιβών της Πλατφόρμας Ιndiegogo και λοιπών εξόδων συναλλαγών.

Κοινωνικό Αντίκτυπο & Μελλοντικοί Στόχοι

Ως μέλος του Σπιθάρι WalkingLife  έχω εργαστεί στη διεξαγωγή ανοιχτών, προς τον κόσμο, σεμιναρίων στους παρακάτω τομείς: φυσική καλλιέργεια, περμακουλτούρα, βιοδυναμική, κατασκευές με υλικά φυσικής δόμησης, ανανεώσιμες πηγές ενέργειας, προωθώντας τη διάδοση εναλλακτικών τρόπων κάλυψης των βασικών αναγκών μας. Νιώθω χαρά όταν βρίσκομαι ανάμεσα σε ανθρώπους που μπορούν να εργαστούν με τη φύση και να συνεργαστούν μεταξύ τους με ειρηνικό τρόπο.

Ως ηθοποιός εργάστηκα- για σύντομο χρονικό διάστημα -, στη θεατρική ομάδα παιδιών με ειδικές ανάγκες- ικανότητες της Very Special Arts Athens. Συνεπώς, θα ήθελα να παρουσιάσω τον Αυτόνομο Ποδηλάτη σε αυτή την ομάδα, καθώς και να προσεγγίσω κοινωνικά ευπαθείς ομάδες οι οποίες είναι καταπιεσμένες ή περιθωριοποιημένες από την πλειονότητα. 

Επίσης επιθυμώ να συνεργαστώ με άλλους καλλιτέχνες & ακτιβιστές με σκοπό να διερευνήσουμε το πεδίο της βιώσιμης τέχνης ως σημείο συνάντησης ακτιβισμού και τέχνης. Έχω ήδη προσεγγίσει τη Σχολή Καλών Τεχνών και είμαι σε στενή επαφή με πολλές ομάδες ακτιβιστών. Πιστεύω ότι είναι κρίσιμο να συνδεθεί η κοινωνική οικολογία με την τέχνη, προκειμένου να βελτιωθεί η αισθητική στις ζωές μας και να αφυπνιστεί η συνείδησή μας.  Για παράδειγμα, μπορούν να διοργανωθούν καλλιτεχνικά δρώμενα σε γειτονιές, δείχνοντας στους ανθρώπους πώς να φτιάξουν έναν λαχανόκηπο στην ταράτσα μιας πολυκατοικίας, ή να γίνουν παρουσιάσεις της εφαρμογής και χρήσης της ποδήλατο – γεννήτριας, οι οποίες δίνουν τη δυνατότητα σε κάποιον που δεν έχει ρεύμα να καλύψει τις βασικές του ανάγκες να γνωρίσει αυτόν τον, παρ’ ότι χαμηλής απόδοσης, τρόπο παραγωγής ηλεκτρικής ενέργειας ώστε να ηλεκτροδοτήσει  το χώρο του, κάνοντας ποδήλατο και κρατώντας τη φόρμα του.

Μέσα απ το εγχείρημα «Αυτόνομος Ποδηλάτης» επιθυμώ να εκφράσω αυτό που είναι ζωτικό μέσα μου. Να αναζητήσω και να ρίξω φως σε απαντήσεις που σχετίζονται με τον καθημερινό μας αγώνα για την κάλυψη των βασικών μας αναγκών.

Άλλοι τρόποι να βοηθήσετε

 Αν δεν μπορείτε να ενισχύσετε οικονομικά , μπορείτε να  το πείτε σε φίλους και γνωστούς.
story_txt:
Για βίντεο στα
Ελληνικά πατήστε Εδώ CYCLE 4 SUSTAINABILITY – THE TOUR
BEGINS  (Ακολουθεί το κείμενο στα Ελληνικά  Αυτόνομος Ποδηλάτης -Πετάλι για το φώς)


 Who Am I 

My name is Spyros
Tsiknas, I live in Athens, I have a son,
and I have studied and work in the fields of renewable energy sources and
representative arts. 
I am a member of Spithari-Walking Life, a project located in
the suburbs of Athens (Marathon area). We are a group of people working on a
testing ground which is desertified by fires. For the last three years, we put
our great effort into the creation of a sustainable environment that will
enable us to cover our needs in energy, food, and lodging while sharing the
knowledge of above scopes.   
I am involved in the coordination of
a workshop for sustainability & art which will take place in the
Solidarity, Sustainability and Creation Festival. Moreover, I participate in
the production of the theatrical play titled The Final and will be presented in theatre
of Vyrsodepsio.  Both projects
explore the field of sustainable art and their electricity needs will be fully
covered by the cycle power generator. 

Why Cycle 4
sustainability?

The direct relation of
human power to electricity production / consumption is a starting point for
opening discussions and increasing awareness on environmental and social
issues. With activism immerging to
art, I will ride the cycle power generator and start a tour shedding
light on events related to sustainability and social ecology. The tour will start in two months.  

TheCycleTouring
 30-31-01 May
2014.The first stop of the tour is on the three day
Solidarity, Sustainability and Creation Festival, a free entrance event located on the
coastal suburbs of Athens (Camping Voula), a place which is due to
privatization under terms defined by local- global economic interests. The Festival
includes numerous workshops for practicing towards the sustainability of the
environment, the society and our selves. A workshop for construction of the
cycle power generator will be organized, which will illuminate a children’s
(theatrical) interactive play under the trees.June
2014. The second stop is at the Contemporary Greek Writers
platform in the Theatre
of Vyrsodepsio, where the theatrical play titled “The Final”, which I wrote
in 2013, will be presented.  It is a
story about a family leasing- from a SEZ (Special Economic Zone) - a cycler
with a cycle generator so as to watch the football final from the energy
produced by the cycler. However, the children of the family have a different
perception of the situation....

Autumn
2014:
In Autumn 2014, the presentation, application and use of Cycle Generator in schools
for educational and artistic purposes will be forwarded such as the
collaboration with fellow artists and activists. 

Needs 

This
campaign aims to gather the amount of 1500 euros, which will be spent as
follows:

Ø 
Construction of the base and the mechanism of the cycle
generator (including
labour cost)
Ø 
Capacitor with volt meter
Ø 
Lights 
Ø 
Cables, switches, diodes, etc.
Ø 
 Extra equipment: Inverter
or Battery or Battery charger 
Ø 
Also
a part of the touring travel expenses and support of the fellow artists
creating the video and the poster will be covered. Plus the Ιndiegogo platform fees and any other
fees for the transactions.  

Social
Impact & Future Aims 

As a member of the Spithari –Walking Life I have worked for
the completion of free entrance -open source- seminars in the fields of natural
farming, permaculture, biodynamics, natural building, renewable energy sources,
trying to spread the news about other ways to cover our needs.  I find joy when humans are able to work with
nature such as to work with each other in peace. 
As an actor I enjoyed working, for a
short period, with children with special abilities – needs, in the theatrical
group of Very Special Arts Athens. Thus,
I want to present Cycle for Sustainability to this group and also I would like
to approach social groups which are oppressed or marginalized by the majority, as
a part of the project’s tour. 
Moreover, I want to collaborate with
artists & activists in order to explore the field of sustainable art,
namely a field where art and activism immerge. An approach to the Academy of
Arts has already taken place, and I am in close contact with several teams of
activists.  I believe that it is crucial
to connect the movement of social ecology to art so as to upgrade aesthetic and
awake awareness in our lives. As an example, we can organize artistic events of
neighborhoods, showing people how to make a roof permaculture garden in
apartment blocks, or presentations of the application and use of the cycle
generator, which will give the opportunity to anyone who has no electricity
access to consider this even low efficient way to light up his/hers space on
demand, while keeping fit. 
Through Cycle 4 Sustainability, I want to express what
is alive in me. Seek after – and shed light on answers related to the
everyday struggle of people who try to cover their basic needs. 
Other ways you can
help
Not everybody has the
ability to help out financially, but you can also…

Tell
     your friends about this project.

ΑΥΤΟΝΟΜΟΣ ΠΟΔΗΛΑΤΗΣ - Πετάλι για το φωςΠοιός είμαι
Ονομάζομαι
Σπύρος Τσίκνας, ζω στην Αθήνα, έχω ένα γιό, έχω σπουδάσει και εργάζομαι στους
τομείς των ανανεώσιμων πηγών ενέργειας και των παραστατικών τεχνών. 
Είμαι μέλος του
Σπιθάρι –WalkingLife, το οποίο
είναι ένα ομαδικό εγχείρημα στα περίχωρα της Αθήνας (περιοχή του Μαραθώνα).
Διανύουμε τον τρίτο χρόνο δράσης σε μια έκταση ερημοποιημένη από τις φωτιές του
2009, επικεντρώνοντας τις προσπάθειές μας στην κάλυψη των αναγκών μας στους τομείς
της ενέργειας, της διατροφής και της στέγασης, διαδίδοντας ταυτόχρονα τη γνώση
στα παραπάνω πεδία.  
Συμμετέχω στη
διοργάνωση του ανοιχτού Φεστιβάλ
Αλληλεγγύης, Βιωσιμότητας & Δημιουργίας,στο πεδίο της Βιώσιμης Τέχνης. Επίσης, συμμετέχω στην παραγωγή του
θεατρικού έργου «Ο ΤΕΛΙΚΟΣ»- το οποίο θα παρουσιαστεί στο θέατρο
Βυρσοδεψείο. Και τα δύο projects εξερευνούν το πεδίο της βιώσιμης τέχνης και οι
ενεργειακές τους ανάγκες θα καλυφθούν πλήρως από την ποδήλατο – γεννήτρια.   

Τι σημαίνει Αυτόνομος Ποδηλάτης;
Ο άμεσος
συσχετισμός ανθρώπινης ενέργειας και παραγωγής / κατανάλωσης ηλεκτρικής
ενέργειας είναι το εναρκτήριο σημείο ανοικτών συζητήσεων και αυξανόμενης
ευαισθητοποίησης πάνω σε περιβαλλοντικά και κοινωνικά ζητήματα. Ενώνοντας
ακτιβισμό και τέχνη, θα ανεβώ στο ποδήλατο –γεννήτρια και θα ξεκινήσω μια πορία,
ρίχνοντας φως σε δρώμενα που σχετίζονται με τη βιωσιμότητα και την κοινωνική
οικολογία. Το ταξίδι θα ξεκινήσει σε δύο μήνες. 
30-31-01 2014
Μαΐου: Η πρώτη στάση
του ταξιδιού είναι το Φεστιβάλ
Αλληλεγγύης, Βιωσιμότητας & Δημιουργίας, το οποίο διοργανώνεται στο Camping Βούλας, σε παράκτιο μέρος, που, λόγω διαδικασιών
ιδιωτικοποίησης, ελέγχεται υπό τους όρους τοπικών-παγκόσμιων οικονομικών
συμφερόντων. Το Φεστιβάλ είναι ανοιχτό στον κόσμο και περιλαμβάνει εργαστήρια
σε τομείς που σχετίζονται με την βιωσιμότητα του περιβάλλοντος, της κοινωνίας
και του εαυτού μας. Στα πλαίσια του Φεστιβάλ θα πραγματοποιηθεί εργαστήριο
κατασκευής ποδηλατογεννήτριας, με την οποία θα φωταγωγήσουμε μια  διαδραστική παιδική παράσταση κάτω απ τα
δέντρα.

οικογένειας όμως έχουν διαφορετική αντίληψη των γεγονότων…

story:
As humans dig deeper into reality, an abstract array of minimalism appears. Basic geometry shapes the world around us. It  reveals a new but familiar emotion when correctly executed in art.

Bodlar pushes those emotional borders forth into the observers’ psyche. Causing the core geometry, mathematics, and creativity of life itself to surface through visionary canvas construction. As these forces pour through Bodlar, a piece of his soul is infused into the piece.

As Bodlar progresses beyond the emotional borders he wishes you to find, a prolific trail of emotive abstraction is left behind. Pieces born through both umbrellas of fear and love constitute themselves in our world, causing reactions to stir in higher consciousness.

Bodlar brings forth emotional sentiments unlike any other artist, allowing both positive and negative to surface. The sinister holds it’s power in the observer, whether it be an image or a word.

Bodlar forces you to face that unique power. Using art as the question. Using art as the answer.

Completing a full run of prints can be risky, and expensive.  I have been unable to raise the funds myself, so I've decided to turn to crowd funding.  With your contribution you will receive a print of this amazing piece and you will also help me continue to make more beautiful work.

The world needs more art, and more passionate artists making art.  I've been an artist my whole life, and have been painting full time for the last two years.  It's a perpetual struggle, but I must keep painting.   I have no other option, my demons refuse to allow it.

If you love the work, but cannot afford to buy a print right now.  Please share the campaign with everyone you can.  Every bit helps!
Cheers,
Bodlar
update: You will receive a print whether the campaign reaches its funding goal or not since it's a flexible funding campaign. The price includes shipping.

story:
• My name Yuniel Delgado Castillo, I am Cuban artist I have 29 years I am a graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts San Alejandro in Cuba. I live in Boston, MA United States. I am a lover of the arts and supporter of modern art.
  • The objective of this project is open a study in the city of Boston, where art shows a different and natural energy. This study will help launch my artistic career and that of other young artists of my country Cuba, as well as achieve a different cultural exchange that precent this country and mine, and that artists are disclosed in my country are the the government chooses not desir therefore wants to be the only, the most prominent, or true art, my idea is descrubir human street art, organic. The consolidation and development of this project would be one of the first steps to publicize the true art, later the idea is to launch a digital magazine produced by young artists from Cuba.

         Funds acquired by this project will be used for qualifying and function of  art.

Arrive at this country through a project called The Wall to develop which help other artists from my country Cuba, we exhibit works in a gallery in New York, Cuban Art Center, where WAS for 3 months. Completed this project I moved to Boston and from here I am struggling to open this studio where boost my career and that of other artists, the studio will be open for all artists who want to learn a little more about our culture, art classes will be taught for people of any age.
story_txt:
My name Yuniel Delgado Castillo, I am Cuban artist I have 29 years I am a graduate of the Academy of Fine Arts San Alejandro in Cuba. I live in Boston, MA United States. I am a lover of the arts and supporter of modern art.


The objective of this project is open a study in the city of Boston, where art shows a different and natural energy. This study will help launch my artistic career and that of other young artists of my country Cuba, as well as achieve a different cultural exchange that precent this country and mine, and that artists are disclosed in my country are the the government chooses not desir therefore wants to be the only, the most prominent, or true art, my idea is descrubir human street art, organic. The consolidation and development of this project would be one of the first steps to publicize the true art, later the idea is to launch a digital magazine produced by young artists from Cuba.




         Funds acquired by this project will be used for qualifying and function of  art.Arrive at this country through a project called The Wall to develop which help other artists from my country Cuba, we exhibit works in a gallery in New York, Cuban Art Center, where WAS for 3 months. Completed this project I moved to Boston and from here I am struggling to open this studio where boost my career and that of other artists, the studio will be open for all artists who want to learn a little more about our culture, art classes will be taught for people of any age.

story:
MULHERIN galleries are looking for support.


In 1998, a couple of months after graduating from art school, I, Katharine Mulherin opened BUSgallery in Toronto, working collaboratively with artists to share their ideas and works. In 1999, I opened a second location at 1080 Queen Street West, when the neighbourhood wasn't nearly as developed as it is now. By late 2000, I had developed 4 empty storefronts into galleries along Queen Street West. I've always had lots of energy for emerging and mid-career artists, and I love presenting their works in an exhibition context and trying to introduce their works to collectors.
In 2009, I ventured to Los Angeles where I ran a satellite platform for a year, before moving to New York and starting a gallery there, all the while maintaining a rigorous program of exhibitions by local and international artists in Toronto.

I have been credited with being a key player in the development of a vibrant art scene in Toronto.


MULHERIN galleries have now been operating for 6 years in two cities and 17 years in total, often presenting several critical exhibitions at a time, and also participating in international art fairs.  As most of you know, the art business is a tricky one to keep afloat, and it has been no different for me.

While the galleries have had many successes over the years, I am very aware that the financial situation for my projects is now more strained than ever, perhaps because of a shifting market, or perhaps because I tried to grow too much, or too fast.
The reality is that I had to walk away from my lease in New York for 8 months (starting now), so that I can try to strengthen operations in the original Toronto location.
The goal is to keep both spaces going in the long run. But for now, I have a $50,000 debt load that is getting more and more difficult to carry, and feels like a crack in the foundation of my business.
My only goal is to lighten the stress of the debt and get the project on stronger footing.
The perk for contributors is that  any amount that is donated can be applied later to the purchase of an artwork, or any smaller multiple or product that the galleries carry.
My hope is to do this work forever, and as I have already given 17 years of my life to it, I am obviously not a quitter or a flash in the pan.
The last thing I want to do is be forced to fold my operations because of a bad year.
If I can reach my $50,000 goal,  I will be able to continue the galleries in both cities, while reducing the debt load that has created these tough times.
This may require that I move the galleries to different spaces in Toronto and New York. I will do whatever it takes to keep them alive, because I believe that the energy of the gallery doesn't come from the room as much as from the quality of the art itself.

If you are in a position to help out, and believe in my projects, I would forever be grateful. If you can't, perhaps you can share my campaign with someone who can.


Forever yours,
Katharine Mulherin

story:
The Lake Chapala Projects

My name is Catherine Armbrust— I am a mixed media/assemblage artist who works with found objects, knitting/crocheting, and more.  After receiving my MFA from the University of Missouri in December 2012, I was invited to be the first artist-in-residence at 360 Xochi Quetzal in Chapala, Mexico. Thanks to a previous Indiegogo campaign I was able to spend an inspiring month in Mexico absorbing my surroundings and making vibrant work.  While in Chapala I had hoped to produce a series of outdoor installations, but realized that a month was not enough time to plan and achieve such a large-scale goal.  Since my return to the states I have spent my time constructing new installations & exhibition proposals with my art partner; teaching Sculpture, Fibers, & 3D Design at the University of Missouri & University of Missouri-Kansas City; and planning my return to Chapala in order to produce this new body of work.  With the encouragement of fellow artist and Chapala resident Deborah Kruger, I plan to return to Mexico in late August 2014. I am launching this Indiegogo fundraiser in order to facilitate my return to Mexico to produce what I call The Lake Chapala Projects. 

(Catherine in her Chapala studio, January 2013)

The town of Chapala is approximately 45 minutes outside of Guadalajara and sits on the shore of Lake Chapala—Mexico’s largest lake.  The lake is an important resource for the state of Jalisco—providing income for fishermen, fresh water for drinking and irrigating crops, and a revenue base for enormous amounts of weekend tourism.  Though a major source of life, the lake is in jeopardy for various political and environmental reasons and is a constant source of debate in the region.  According to globalnature.org, “Eleven million people live in the [Chapala] catchment area (about 10 % of the total population of México), and the potential for conflict over regional water resources is high due to their overexploitation… About 81 % of the lake’s catchment area is agricultural, and the area irrigated has quintupled over the last 50 years.”  Thus the lake is the essence of the area, acting simultaneously as a symbol of both vitality and loss.

(the lake at sunset, January 2013)

The Lake Chapala Projects are a series of works dedicated to the lake—and in the grander scheme, to water in general.  Through installations and performances I will simultaneously celebrate the gift of life and express my concerns over its availability.  The issues related to Chapala are not isolated there—though the project will be directly connected to that site, accessibility to fresh water is a global concern.  As stewards of the earth, humans need to be conscious of our relationship to water for the present and the future.

The impact this project will have on my creative research is tremendous.  The majority of my work thus far, has been a series of singular objects for indoor display.  The work I have planned for Chapala is in step with my earlier work—which often references icons & altars while utilizing altered found objects to provide context.  This new series of work planned for Chapala is similar to the old in that it deals with cultural topics and uses specific materials to build meaning, but will push my creative boundaries through outdoor installations and costumed performances related to the lake and surrounding region. 

I hope to also make a difference by raising awareness regarding the health of the lake.  There will be a number of festivals taking place in Chapala while I am there—I plan to publicize this project by attending these events & passing out flyers, using social media, and making local gallery & political connections.  There are a number of groups in the Chapala region that host lake-related activities with whom I would like to connect.

(mural by Jose Lopez Vega in Ajijic)

Project Plans, Budget, & Perks

The funding I seek will help pay for living expenses, transportation, and material costs during my stay.  I plan to stay in Chapala from late August 2014 until early January 2015.  Any extra funding earned will be rolled into those costs.

Projects in the works:

I know that 4 months will go quickly and I may not be able to accomplish everything on my list, but these are the projects I am developing (in order of priority).  The work is all inspired by Chalchiuhtlicue & Ix Chel, the Aztec & Mayan Goddesses of still and running water.

  • Floating sculpture that acts as a (temporary) altar on the lake
  • Small shrines & amulets (made of biodegradable materials) placed around  the edge of the lake
  • Costumed performance: Immersed in water, then emerging from lake onto shore and drawing in sand with large braid.  Documenting through photo & video
  • Costumed performance: Placing unfired ceramic jugs and/or ceramic fish in shallow water.  Filling the jugs with water from the lake.  Documenting their deterioration—clay “melting” back into lake--through photo & video
  • Documenting the area using found vegetation and salvaged rainwater to create natural dyed fabrics

Supply Expenses:

I will need a variety of materials to produce the installations, costumes, & performances I have in the works:  @ $1500-2000.

I plan to purchase most of my materials in the Chapala/Guadalajara area in order to support the local economy there.  Final materials required will depend on each specific project... 

  • Floating sculpture materials:  wood, plastic, recycled materials, glue,    paper mache materials, glitter, chicken wire, tape, wire
  • Unfired ceramic materials for shoreline installations
  • Boat hire to install & de-install floating sculpture
  • Small shrine materials:  found objects & vegetation
  • Kayak rental to place small shrines around shoreline
  • Costume materials:  fabric, yarn, thread, rope, ready-made garments to alter with sewing, crochet, knitting, & embroidery, sewing machine
  • Hire videographer & photographer to help document installations & performances
  • Natural dye materials: plants, vegetables, fruits, flowers, fabric, bowls & jars

Transportation & Living Expenses:

The bulk of my costs will be spent on travel and living expenses, both in and out of Mexico.

  • Round trip plane ticket:  @ $650
  • In-country transportation (buses to/from Guad, town to town for events) =  @$200
  • Apartment Rental with studio (4-5 months):  @ $500/month = $2000-2500
  • Food:  @ $200/month = $800-1000
  • I will have additional financial responsibilities (shared with my spouse) in the US that I will also need to keep up with (housing/utilities in US, student loan debt, pet care, etc.—my half is @ $1000/month)

I have some money saved for this venture, but not enough to sustain the full project. Thus, I’m launching this campaign and offering some fabulous perks!  All the perks are artworks lovingly created by me.  I’m offering stickers, collages, stencil prints, art cards, and more—so much color and pattern!  All perks include shipping within the US.  Some photos of perk samples are posted here in the gallery section.  If you’d like to see more, photo albums of more perks are posted on The Lake Chapala Projects’ Facebook page.  https://www.facebook.com/lakechapalaprojects

(samples of some of the $25 postcard collage perks)

Making a Difference...

As a university-level art educator, I am expected to build a wealth of creative ventures & shows on my resume in order to get hired for a more permanent teaching position.  While I believe in that process, I also believe in constructing artistic opportunities for myself outside of the normal gallery setting.  With your help, I can make this a reality.  The impact the previous Indiegogo campaign & subsequent residency had on my life was incredible.  I came back from Mexico and—among other things—sustained an active studio practice, produced 4 new costumes, and built a new Fibers curriculum for the University of Missouri-Kansas City.  I can only imagine the emotional and professional impact this new venture will have on my life as a human, an artist, and an educator. 

The Lake Chapala Projects are not only important to me, but will hopefully become meaningful to the people living in the region as well.  They are the ones most dependent on and affected by the lake.  I hope to respectfully work with the area and the community, creating an awareness of the issues surrounding the lake and perhaps even encouraging folks to get active in support of the lake.

And I hope The Projects will become important to you as well.  We all depend on water…

Gratitude

Even if you can’t contribute, I thank you for taking the time to consider this project and my campaign. 

I would appreciate you sharing a link to this campaign, if you think it worthwhile.  And you can stay in touch through The Lake Chapala Projects' Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/lakechapalaprojects

You may also check out my portfolio at www.catherinearmbrust.com

Have a beautiful day!

(the lake at sunset, January 2013)

(above: samples of 9x12" and 12x18" stencil prints--$40 & $75 perks)

story:
*✲ﾟ*｡✧ $3,500 *✲ﾟ*｡✧  MILESTONE ACHIEVED
Our first bonus is a beautiful 52 piece card deck! Once we hit this milestone, all bonus pledges will have the chance to grab this card deck. 

*✲ﾟ*｡✧ $5000 *✲ﾟ*｡✧  MILESTONE ACHIEVED
Once we reach $5k for Cutey Confidential pledgers are able to choose a pre-made Morning & Night Dakimakura of two very lovely royalty figures! All dakimakuras are printed on high quality fabrics.  



Please keep updated with us as we release more milestones!

***Bonuses from Milestones are only avilable for $75+ pledgers during this indiegogo campaign. However, they will be permanent in our store after the fundraising making these rare items easily purchasable for those who pledge lower or those who miss out on the fundraising.

Back in 2011 a group of artists had the desire to create a wonderful little calendar and began a project called My Little Sweetheart. Eventually it became the charity art book you know and love today, already undergoing it's fourth edition (more information can be found at this tumblr).

This brings us to our baby project; Cutey Confidential! We selected some of your favorite artists from previous books to create to you a one-of-a-kind fully illustrated calendar. This calendar features sexy human ladies parodying your favorite fandom characters for 14 months!


This calendar will have a sfw and a sexy edition, depending on what you pledge and your pledges also unlock special hidden features as well as items! (whooooo, mystery~)

Digital Edition

Digital editions will include high resolution digital copies of the calendar and a desktop version. The Cutey Editions will include PSD\SAI files, sketches, videos and any other extras artists have collected.

Standard Print

Standard Prints shipped to you will be 8.5x11 full color.

Premium Print

Premium Prints shipped to you will be 13.5x19 full color.

Standard base bonus

Buttons & bookmarks of artwork that have been featured in MLS or Cutey Confidential.

Milestone bonuses **

Special bonuses will be at tier levels that will allow you to gain access to merchandise. As the project increases funds, more merchandise options will be available through milestones. This means you will gain more selection as the project hits each milestone. This will allow you to customize what your calendar comes with to best match your personal taste and interest. Additional bonuses will be able to be purchased post project! There will be an offer to purchase extra bonuses at a discount for supporters at the delivery stage.

Taxes & Shipping?

None! No extra fees applied to your pledge unless you want to upgrade later on.


This is the list of wonderful artists involved in this project! All profits will support them for making this calendar come to life. The commission slots are for high pledgers only~. 

 
slot 1: open

 
slot 1: open
slot 2: open

 
slot 1: open
slot 2: open

 
slot 1: open

 
slot 1: open

 
slot 1: open
slot 2: open

 
slot 1: open

 
slot 1: open

 
slot 1: Closed

 
slot 1: open
slot 2: open

 
slot 1: open

 
slot 1: Closed

 
slot 1: Closed

 
slot 1: open
slot 2: open

 
slot 1: open


1. . What deadlines are there for the project?

We are currently aiming for a end of October- November release for calendar, with the final release date being November 31st.

2. What is the theme for the calendar?

There is no real set theme for the first calendar project outside of representing the corresponding months with their own themes. Overall we are doing a general 'hopes for 2015’ feel. We are also seeking to embody some of the projects some of our MLS participants have already started working on outside of My Little Sweetheart.

3. Will the calendar be published?

Yes.

4. How will the calendar be published?

With Lulu.

5. How long will the calendar be released? Will it remain just a calendar?

The current plan for the calendar is to be on sale from November until February 2015. After which, we plan to release more merchandise, assuming certain milestones are met.

6. Will I be able to edit my pledge later?

Yes! You can email us about this and we can work on editing your pledge after you have already made one.

7. What are special bonuses?

As the funding progresses for this project we will hopefully release special milestone bonuses. Examples would be mousepads, wallscrolls, or even dakimuras! Keep up with this page to see what we have in store for our milestones.

8. How do the commission slots work?

Its on a first come first serve biases. The artists let you know how many commissions they are willing to do for this project. You will see the slot availability next to the artists' name. Once you pledge, you will email us the artist you would like to commission, reserving you a slot with your desired artist. 

9. What does "Slot: Unknown" mean?

We are still trying to contact each artist to be sure if they are completely open to do a commission and how many. Please keep up with this page to see if they have opened a slot or not.

10. Are there rules with commissions?

There may be rules/guidelines to what you can commission the artist based on the individual artist you commission so it's very important you keep in contact with us if you pledge any of the top tier amounts.

11.* Are Dakimakuras pre-drawn? Do we get to pick the artist?

There are no dakimakuras yet. You can pick and reserve which artist you want to draw your daki just using the commission slot.

13.* Are Dakimakuras canon characters only?

Yes.

14.* Are the top tier options available to anyone else?

All merchandise will be available even after this fundraiser is over. 

15.* What do you mean "Amount adds in tax & shipping"? I have to pay more?

No! The amount you pledge already adds in enough to pay for any taxes and shipping. We are aware not all places have the same amount but we didn't want to make the charges separate so we did a general amount that will pool in the end to cover both charges. 

If you have any more questions you don't see answered here, please ask us! Or send us an email here!

Eventually it became the charity art book you know and love today, already undergoing it's fourth edition (more information can be found at this tumblr).This brings us to our baby project; Cutey Confidential! We selected some of your favorite artists from previous books to create to you a one-of-a-kind fully illustrated calendar. This calendar features sexy human ladies parodying your favorite fandom characters for 14 months!This calendar will have a sfw and a sexy edition, depending on what you pledge and your pledges also unlock special hidden features as well as items! (whooooo, mystery~)
Digital EditionDigital editions will include high resolution digital copies of the calendar and a desktop version. The Cutey Editions will include PSD\SAI files, sketches, videos and any other extras artists have collected.
Standard PrintStandard Prints shipped to you will be 8.5x11 full color.
Premium Print
Premium Prints shipped to you will be 13.5x19 full color.Standard base bonusButtons & bookmarks of artwork that have been featured in MLS or Cutey Confidential.
Milestone bonuses **
Special bonuses will be at tier levels that will allow you to gain access to merchandise. As the project increases funds, more merchandise options will be available through milestones. This means you will gain more selection as the project hits each milestone. This will allow you to customize what your calendar comes with to best match your personal taste and interest. Additional bonuses will be able to be purchased post project! There will be an offer to purchase extra bonuses at a discount for supporters at the delivery stage.Taxes & Shipping?None! No extra fees applied to your pledge unless you want to upgrade later on.

This is the list of wonderful artists involved in this project! All profits will support them for making this calendar come to life. The commission slots are for high pledgers only~. 


 



slot 1: open





 


slot 1: openslot 2: open




 



slot 1: openslot 2: open






 



slot 1: open






 



slot 1: open






 



slot 1: openslot 2: open






 



slot 1: open






 



slot 1: open






 



slot 1: Closed






 



slot 1: openslot 2: open






 


slot 1: open











 



slot 1: Closed






 



slot 1: Closed






 



slot 1: openslot 2: open






 



slot 1: open



1. . What deadlines are there for the project?We are currently aiming for a end of October- November release for calendar, with the final release date being November 31st.2. What is the theme for the calendar?There is no real set theme for the first calendar project outside of representing the corresponding months with their own themes. Overall we are doing a general 'hopes for 2015’ feel. We are also seeking to embody some of the projects some of our MLS participants have already started working on outside of My Little Sweetheart.3. Will the calendar be published?Yes.4. How will the calendar be published?With Lulu.5. How long will the calendar be released? Will it remain just a calendar?The current plan for the calendar is to be on sale from November until February 2015. After which, we plan to release more merchandise, assuming certain milestones are met.6. Will I be able to edit my pledge later?Yes! You can email us about this and we can work on editing your pledge after you have already made one.7. What are special bonuses?As the funding progresses for this project we will hopefully release special milestone bonuses. Examples would be mousepads, wallscrolls, or even dakimuras! Keep up with this page to see what we have in store for our milestones.8. How do the commission slots work?Its on a first come first serve biases. The artists let you know how many commissions they are willing to do for this project. You will see the slot availability next to the artists' name. Once you pledge, you will email us the artist you would like to commission, reserving you a slot with your desired artist. 9. What does "Slot: Unknown" mean?We are still trying to contact each artist to be sure if they are completely open to do a commission and how many. Please keep up with this page to see if they have opened a slot or not.10. Are there rules with commissions?There may be rules/guidelines to what you can commission the artist based on the individual artist you commission so it's very important you keep in contact with us if you pledge any of the top tier amounts.11.* Are Dakimakuras pre-drawn? Do we get to pick the artist?There are no dakimakuras yet. You can pick and reserve which artist you want to draw your daki just using the commission slot.13.* Are Dakimakuras canon characters only?Yes.14.* Are the top tier options available to anyone else?All merchandise will be available even after this fundraiser is over. 15.* What do you mean "Amount adds in tax & shipping"? I have to pay more?No! The amount you pledge already adds in enough to pay for any taxes and shipping. We are aware not all places have the same amount but we didn't want to make the charges separate so we did a general amount that will pool in the end to cover both charges. If you have any more questions you don't see answered here, please ask us! Or send us an email here!

story:
A Bit About Steen


HI! My name is Justine Pulles, but you can call me Steen. I'm an artist living in Vancouver, BC, Canada, specializing in illustration and painting. I'm a professional 2D animation artist, working on many projects that range from music videos to children's cartoons (Pound Puppies, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, My Little Pony: Equestria Girls, & Disney XD's Packages from Planet X to name a few.) I have an obsession with art, and a love for animation and cartoons. Take a look at some of my artwork here!

I am looking to branch out further with my own personal art, and create more artwork, prints, merch, etc, with the hopes of eventually attending conventions and making a name for myself. 

In order to do this, I need to upgrade my equipment from a 10 year old Wacom Intuos 2 tablet to a Wacom Cintiq 22"HD! 


As an artist who enjoys painting and colour, it is very important to me to be able to draw and paint more fluently and efficiently, to in turn create more artwork! With a Cintiq, you draw ON the screen, so your artwork retains certain qualities that I personally feel I can't achieve with a tablet. 

The Wacom Cintiq is an amazing tool that would benefit myself and my career for many years to come!


What is Needed


The Wacom Cintiq 22"HD will cost me $1899.00 + tax = $2126.88, rounded up to $2127.00 as the final total of funds I need to raise. 

All funds contributed will go directly to the purchase of the Cintiq. 


Rewards for your support!


As a thanks for your support, everyone who contributes will receive artwork in return! 

Every amount counts, and different price ranges have different rewards. 


$1 = 

  • A personal "thank you" Twitter mention. You can use this to promote your website or any project or anything!**
  • One (1) entry into a draw (date TBA) for a FREE 8x10" digital speed painting of one (1) character or portrait, file delivered to your email

$5= 

  • Postcard pack featuring my artwork, shipped to you

$15= 

  • One (1) digital sketch OR one (1) Flash vector (with basic colour) of one (1) character, file delivered to your email


$20= 

  • One (1) 5x7" pencil sketch of one (1) character of portrait, shipped to you


$25= Value Bundle

  • One (1) 5x7"pencil sketch of one (1) character or portrait, shipped to you
  • Postcard pack
  • And entry into the draw

$35= 

  • One (1) 8x10" digital speed painting of one (1) character or portrait with a simple background, file delivered to your email



$50= 

  • One (1) 8x10" pencil sketch of one (1) character or portrait, shipped to you



$100= Awesome Bundle

  • One (1) 8x10" pencil sketch of one (1) character or portrait, shipped to you
  • One (1) 8x10" digital speed painting of one (1) character or portrait with a simple background, file delivered to your email
  • One (1) Flash vector (with basic colour) of one (1) character, file delivered to your email
  • Postcard pack
  • Twitter mention
  • An entry into the draw

$200= Super Bundle

  • One (1) 11x14" full colour digital painting commission of maximum two (2) characters, printed and shipped to you
  • Postcard pack 
  • Twitter mention
  • An entry into the draw




*I reserve the right to decline any drawing concepts I deem as offensive or unsuitable.

**I will post with discretion.


Other Ways You Can Help


Every little bit counts! If you want to help by sharing this page to your friends via Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, etc, I would be SO thankful for it!! You can link to it, or use the Indiegogo sharing features above. My twitter is @steen182, I will be posting about it, and retweets would be appreciated!


Thank you!!!!


I am forever thankful to my friends and supporters who have been there with amazing feedback and comments, you guys are the best! Thank you for sharing in my adventure!

I will be livestreaming every Friday night, at 8pm PST. Make sure to come by and check it out, and watch me do art! livestream.com/steen182
