story:
Short Summary

The Movement Creative is teaming up with Spontaneous Interventions to design & build a temporary, pop-up playscape and public space the 2016 season.  Our installation will inhabit a small section of Nolan Park, providing shaded seating and lounge space, including room for eating, working, and of course, movement & playing for children and adults!  There will also be a robust schedule of free movement and social programming, open to the public, all season long, organized by our team!  

To make this happen, we need your help!

(Check back for new images, to be released each week!)

Below find more information on:
Site&Design - Programming - Impact - Rewards - Risks

POPUP is a modular, portable playground for children and adults.  We travel around the country, popping up in parks, public and private spaces, schools, museums, and more.

Site

POPUP PUBLIC will be located in Nolan Park on Governors Island in NYC, just south of the Manhattan Ferry.  The design is composed of two major spaces--the Jungle Gym and the Playscape Path.  Consideration is given to entry points to Spontaneous Interventions and the location of the Little Free Library (see below).

The Jungle Gym

The bar jungle gym will inhabit the cozy space between the houses.  Over the course of the summer, this will change shape, varying between more geometric forms to more organic ones.  These bars also fit into the larger bar system holding the sunshades down popup path. Designed for children AND Adults!

The Playscape Path

Playscape path creates a series of smaller social spaces established by large timbers and material threshold changes between path and grass.  These spaces are further defined with sunshades and hammocks.  Each area is unique, providing different opportunities to move, explore, and play.


Shading

Throughout the site we hope to install sunshades, to cast shadows on the bars and keep them cool  for use in the mid-day, high-heat summers.  They also will provide much needed shading for the social spaces along playscape path for visitors who choose to lounge or relax in the space.

A Closer Look at the Design


There are 4 major design components of the POPUP Public Installation System.

  1.  Canvas Sunscreens - Long swaths and short bands of canvas and roping at varying intervals.  Each component is sown to slip onto the pipe
  2.  Pipe System - A heavy-duty speedrail system, composed of schedule 80 galvanized pipe, clamps, and custom cuts.  Strong enough to lean, hang, and swing around on.  Sunshades and hammocks are suspended from the system.
  3. Hammock Climbers - Designed, printed, and sown by local artist and textile designer Julya Rosenberg;  These are not your typical hammocks.  They are pulled taught between bars and are strong enough to jump or roll over, yet still comfy for a brief respite.   Large and small, to accommodate one or two people. 
  4. Wood Timbers - The basing of the system is large 12x12 timber beams locked into place by the bar system.  Configured for working, eating, lounging, and, of course, play! 

Multiple Uses

While the primary focus of POPUP Public is play, movement, and fitness (see our programs below!), it also happens to be a pretty awesome public space.  By laying out the timbers in a variety of configurations, we can accommodate a far larger swath of uses during down times on the island.

PLUS The Little Free Library

At the far edge of the site we are looking to include a Little Free Library for the duration of the season--filled with fitness, movement, and design books to curl up with in the shade.  
We are currently hosting a design competition for architecture students for the design of this LFL, and are hoping to partner up with a local bookstore to populate the library when built.

Programming

We have partnered up with some amazing organizations and companies around New York City to bring to Governors Island a series of free or donation-based programs, classes, and meetups on the weekend for visitors!  This list will continue to grow over the next month, so make sure to check back on our website as it updates!
Movement & Wellbeing
  • Parkour Classes
  • Contact Improv
  • Calisthenics
  • Capoeira
  • Acroyoga
  • Yoga
  • Ninja Fitness
  • Movement Games
  • Primitive Skills
Art & Hobby
  • Meditation
  • Origami Folding
  • Boardgaming
  • Urban Sketching
  • Art in the Park
Interested in running a fitness class or program on our site? Reach out to Caitlin@TheMovementCreative.com to get involved! We are always looking for new partnerships and unique activities!

The Impact

POPUP Public is a flexible and tolerant playscape--we welcome people of ALL AGES to come and make a place for their hobbies and interests in our space, and to share those passions with others.  We believe that these passions, which perhaps exert vastly different energies and trajectories, can co-exist together and even make each other better because of it--and that our space, abstract and sturdy, can hold up to that task.

At the end of the season, POPUP Public will be broken into smaller sets and distributed into to local gyms, community centers, and schools to be used as playgrounds, workout equipment, and leisure space.

If you are interested in getting a piece of this years POPUP into your space, contact us!

The Rewards

Without you, we know that this project would be a shade of what it could be!  We have put together some awesome perks for our supporters -- please spread the love so that we can hit and exceed our goals!

Other Ways You Can Help

The easiest way to help is by sharing this campaign! We only have 21 days to raise the money to make this come to life!  The more momentum and support we can build for this project, the more likely we are to hit our goal and bring to life this awesome playscape!

We also are always looking for:

-Hands to help build in May

-Programming partners for weekends June through September

Our Partners, Past and Present

The Movement Creative
Spontaneous Interventions
Come Out and Play
Thrive in the Park & SoRIPE
TrainDEEP
The RISE
MR Calisthenics
Urban Sketchers NYC
Storm Yoga
Andrew Suseno
Brendon Trombley
Stephanie & Alan Fleming
+ MORE TO BE ANNOUNCED!

Stretch Goals

At $5,500 we will add another small wood seating/play area!
At $6,000 we will add another small pipe/jungle gym section!
